Reviews.Title: “Just a few minutes walk from San Marco!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_alloallo
Reviews.Content: Just a few minutes walk from San Marco! This hotel is ideal for visiting Venice. It has its own vaporeto stop (Giglio) on the line one, which makes it very easy to go anywhere. This was the second time we stayed at the Ala hotel, and we would probably stay here again next time we visit Venice. Good value, clean and comfortable. Breakfast could have more choice and variety, but staff are very helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday March 2012”
Reviews.Author: Thomas M
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault anything about this Hotel, the location, friendliness of all staff, superb breakfast, our room overlooked the canal at the rear of the hotel each evening we were serenaded by the Gondoliers as they sailed past, memorable. There were four in our party and no one had any reason for complaint. Congratulations to all at Hotel Ala

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: K M
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ala certainly lived up to expectations. The location is ideal - central but quiet. The hotel has clearly been refurbished recently and everything looked fresh and clean. Our room had everything we needed - comfortable bed and clean, modern bathroom (though the hairdryer was a bit odd!) The staff were friendly and helpful. We found the late breakfast particularly helpful, even if the food selection was a bit uninspiring. We would certainly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a moderately priced, but very comfortable stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, smelly rooms”
Reviews.Author: HoracioLima_Peru
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its location: across from the Gritti Palace (closed for renovation) and a few minutes away from Piazza San Marco. Because it belongs to the Best Western chain of hotels, we believed it would guarantee a certain level of comfort and cleanliness. The hotel is indeed well located, but if you are going to Venice it is worth searching for a better hotel, and perhaps spending a little more to get it. We travelled with our children so we had two rooms. Both were good sized but garishly decorated, and with very little daylight. We were bitten by mosquitoes every night, but the worst part of the hotel was the dreadful smell emanating from the bathrooms. At first we thought it might be a "Venetian" odour because of the canals, but it came out of the sewers in the shower and sink. The smell was unbearable and we were given another room. The hotel has the disadvantage of not having a lift operating from the ground floor. The one they have is situated on the first floor, so this is a most inadequate hotel for the physically handicapped or elderly. Once you get to the floor your room is in, you have to make your way through a number of winding corridors where you can easily get lost. Service was alright. I did see most of the guests heaving their cases up to the lift floor, with the hotel employees just leading the way with the room keys in hand. Although they are polite, they are not helpful. Breakfast is inedible. The fruit juices taste of candy diluted in water, the coffee had a greasy film on the surface, the eggs were left to dry out in the heating cabinets, and the dining room was horribly decorated. I seriously do not recommed this hotel. It spoils the magic of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: L C
Reviews.Content: We stayed during March 2012. The hotel was easy to find by water taxi. Great location, 10 minutes walk to all the main sites. Staff very helpful stayed in room 460 with a balcony and spa bath, great for relaxing after a long day out seeing the sites. Breakfast was very good with lots of choice. Good hotel bar with happy friendly bar staff. Venice is expensive but a place everyone should visit, we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, affordable, and great location”
Reviews.Author: haller8457
Reviews.Content: With easy access from the ferry, we found our way from the train station to this delightful hotel without trouble. (Take ferry #1 for about 12 stops. It's a great ride on the grand canal and the best deal in town.) The hotel is just two minutes walk from San Marco Square, so the location is outstanding. The rooms are small, but sufficient, bathroom very nice, small balcony overlooking the canal, and the staff are kind and helpful. Best western affiliate, so it was easy to book. Price seems very reasonable for Venice and the location. (about 165 Euro per night double occupancy, including taxes, etc. Breakfast also included.)

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl9651
Reviews.Content: I stayed there during Carnival this year for the first time. I loved the location being a very short walk from the vaporetto stop and also a 10 minute walk from Piazza San Marcos. The breakfast is everything one could ask for and the staff that serve it were very gracious. Do have the hot chocolate. It is fantastic. My room was a comfortable size and the bathroom was clean and very good as well. The only problem I would mention is the mattresses are extremely hard. The maid did go out of her way to make it as comfortable as possible. If the bed is not a problem I do not think you could do much better when looking for a hotel in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Another enjoyable stay at Hotel Ala”
Reviews.Author: Bridget_from_Oz
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd visit to the Hotel Ala, and once again, they did not disappoint. As usual the staff were great, they are customer focused and always friendly and helpful. The location is perfect, being located in easy walking distance of St. Mark's square, and less than 50 metres from Vaporetto stop "San Giglio". (Catch Vaporetto No. 1 from the train station, and get off at San Giglio stop after a cruise through the Grand Canal ). There are restaurants nearby and a bar downstairs. The rooms are adequate in size and their housekeeping standards seem high, so the rooms are always clean. Wifi access is available. The Beds are comfortable, although I found the pillows are very high, but when I requested a smaller (skinnier) pillow, this was supplied promptly. Breakfast is included with options of continental, hot or cold selections, so there is plenty to choose from ! If I am lucky enough to return to Venice, I will definitely be booking into Hotel Ala once again.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Thorner
Reviews.Content: Perfect location straight off the San Giglio vaporetto stop so is ideal if you have bags and cases. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms on small side but this is typical of Venice but could not fault the cleanliness - we had clean sheets and towels each day, odd considering we're all trying to save the planet. We had asked for a canal view but not sure its worth the extra cost as the canal itself is very narrow with little traffic except for gondolas. Breakfast excellent with plenty of choice. Easy walk to all tourist areas. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew P
Reviews.Content: Very close to the San Giglio vaporetto stop and a short walk from St Mark's, the Ala is very conveniently placed. The staff were helpful and friendly. Our room was as small as so many rooms are in France and Italy but it was warm and comfortable in the middle of a freezing cold spell. There are restaurants close by as is the Opera House. We were very pleased to spend time here and to enjoy the bar that operates at night

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but who cares when you're in Venice?!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Ala with my mother and husband in September 2011. After much research, we decided on Hotel Ala for location, price and based on other reviews. We were happy with our choice. The rooms are small and a little dark, but we were not in Venice to be inside a hotel room! The location is ideal as you can either walk (15 minutes) or take the local water taxi (vaporetto) to Piazza Saint Marco. If you're looking for a cheaper option than taking a private water taxi, you can take the public water taxi from the main train station to the hotel. The hotel is just 50 metres from the Santa Maria Del Giglio stop. Although the public transport is about a third of the price of a private water taxi, the public transport can get pretty crowded!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ala in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Melinda080
Reviews.Content: We loved exploring Venice and this Hotel Ala was in a convenient place for our frequent walks around the canals. It is in a direct line, along an ally, to a water taxi stop so arriving and departing was easy. Our room opened out to a canal so we could look down to see gondolas glide past with accordian players and singers on board! What a wonderful welcome to Italy! The staff were frendly and breakfast in the dining room was pretty good too!

Reviews.Title: “Gondolas under my window”
Reviews.Author: Anita T
Reviews.Content: You go into your hotel room and open the window. Often you see another building. But below my room at Hotel Ala, the gondolas were going by. Thus began the magic that is Venice. The hotel is centrally located, the public areas comfortable with a homelike, intimate feeling. The service excellent and the breakfast is the finest I'd enjoyed in any European hotel. I highly recommend Hotel Ala

Reviews.Title: “Belated but Rave Review”
Reviews.Author: happytravelerinNC
Reviews.Content: This is a very belated review, as we traveled to Italy in May of 2009 and started out trip in Venice with two nights at Hotel Ala. Not sure if it was just good timing, or a bit of sympathy for some dishevled travelers (who couldn't find our paper work for the room when trying to check in) arriving from the US, but the front desk staff gave us a suite on the top floor and it was wonderful! The bedroom had a huge window that opened up to a rooftop view of Venice, complete with a flower box full of red geraniums. The bathroom was decent for European standards, breakfast good and location fantastic. This trip was the first time my husband and I traveled to Italy and planned it out ourselves, so I was a bit worried about the logistics of finding everything and how things would live up to our expectations. Starting the trip in Venice in hindsight was a perfect choice, the city (being an island!) is not too big, and walking everywhere to exlpore was so enjoyable. Hotel Ala's location and our room upgrade made our stop in Venice that much better. I would definitely recommend this hotel to those looking for a place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and a good value”
Reviews.Author: CathyOfCal
Reviews.Content: We were three couples traveling together and loved having all of our rooms overlooking the canal. Charming rooms with large windows and the traditional green shutters. Rooms were surprisingly large and our bathroom was even spacious. We found the staff pretty friendly and helpful and the breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent standard for a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: KMH09
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel for a 3 star. The rooms are immaculate and very comfortable. The choice at breakfast is better than some 4 star hotels in Venice. My bag went missing at the airport and the reception staff helpfully took the forms from me and chased up getting it delivered the next day. The location is very convenient, a few yards from a vaporetto stop, 5 minutes walk to San Marco and 5 minutes walk to the Accademia bridge. I have been to Venice 6 times and would stay at the Ala again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff but worn out facilities”
Reviews.Author: Meg L
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel 2 nights before going on the cruise. Great location just only 5 minutes to St Mark square. We had a room at 4th floor, room is quite small but we had a balcony. It's quite good to look down the canel to see the gondola. We had an air-conditioner in our room but the louver of the air-conditioner is so dirty and full of dust. Bathroom looks very nice but the bath is leaking. Always has to place 5 or 6 bath towels at the bottom of the bath to prevent the bathroom flood. Facilities seems quite worn out in our room. Breakfast is OK, not as good as I expect from the comments I've seen on this website. I love the free internet service and friendly staff. The staff gave us useful information to get from our hotel to the cruise port.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: k e
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the location is fantastic. Close to the Vaparetto, easy to find. I was traveling with my 16 year old son and 22 year old daughter. The breakfast was great. Enough to satisfy a 16 year old teenager. The staff in the breakfast room could use a refresher course on customer service, but they weren't horrible. The hotel staff were fabulous. The gentlemen at the front desk were very helpful, whether we needed a recommendation for dinner or helping us with our bags. Very courteous. The "living room" lobby is very comfortable and quiet if we wanted to just relax and read for a few moments. The bar was great and the bartender and waiter were very friendly and welcoming. Great place to have a night cap and talk about our wonderful day.

Reviews.Title: “Jammed breakfast room and questionable booking tactics cancel out 'good' location.”
Reviews.Author: SonomaValleyWoman
Reviews.Content: We travel to Italy frequently and this was our 4th stay in Venice, 6 glorious nights -- unfortunately our first and last at the Best Western Ala whose failings trump a good location. And isn't almost every hotel in Venice well-located? Staying out of the way of the hungry hordes in the jam-packed breakfast room, squeezing around those same hordes for coffee, for eggs, for what is indeed a nicely varied breakfast but in a cramped, inadequately-sized room was an unpleasant way to begin each day in this magical city in sunny late-September. On the plus side, several of the staff were pleasant enough to compensate for overpriced rooms (we can afford it, but more on that later) and the hardest, most amazingly uncomfortable bed ever slept in anywhere on earth: The quietly helpful Alessandro at the front desk; Luca, whose charming assistance and warm hospitality are no doubt unmatched in the hotel trade; and efficient, smiling Mario, a bellman with a sincere wish to accommodate. The most un-charming and first-time-ever event occurred at checkout when a clerk we'd not seen before refused, loudly and rudely, to honor the rate the hotel had confirmed to us in writing. No kidding. In two languages (we speak Italian). When several times we politely tried to present our confirmation papers, he interrupted and just talked over us, finally saying -- and this is pretty close to verbatim -- "well there may have been rooms available at that rate when you booked, but now there are not." So we gave up and made our escape, paying E340 per night for a room that had been confirmed to us at E240. Is this the Best Western way? It certainly is not the Venetian way and this single bizarre experience, unforgettable as it is, won't keep us away from the sparkle of Venice and the countless well-located and charming hotels that fill her piazzale and calle. But the Ala? Stay away. I just wish we'd written this earlier.

Reviews.Title: “The location is ideal & you can't beat the price”
Reviews.Author: ZorraLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a few hundred yards from a Vaporetto stop on the Grand Canal, and a ten-minute walk from Piazza San Marco in one direction and Piazza Santo Stefano in the other. It doesn't get much more convenient than that. I booked it via internet several weeks before my stay, and got an unbeatable price. Admittedly, the room (a single) was the second smallest hotel room I have ever had, but you don't go to Venice to hang out in your hotel room, and it was equipped with everything you could possibly need. And the room was immaculately clean. My only quibble is that the mini-bar only offers plastic cups rather than real glasses, and I really hate plastic. My room had a small balcony overlooking a tiny back canal, only wide enough for gondolas. Very Venetian, especially when they were singing or playing the accordion. The price of the room included breakfast, which is entirely self-service, but offers a good range of eggs, toast, yogurt, fruit, cheese, cold cuts, cereal, pastries, etc. And breakfast is available from 7.30 to 11.00, catering for both the eager beavers and the lay-abouts. It was too chilly to sit out on the roof terrace, but I imagine it's lovely at warmer times of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: prncessmou
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 2 nights during our Italy Honeymoon. The hotel, situated in a quaint piazza, is in a great location, about a 5 minute walk to St. Mark's Square and about a 5 second walk to the Varapetto (water taxi). The walk to St. Marks square passes every major designer store you can imagine (fashionistas beware!). The hotel itself is typical European / Italian style - kind of dark, but warm & cozy and the staff is very friendly & helpful. Our room was small, but clean, facing the canal (we could see the gondoliers go by all day) and comfortable. I'd compare it to a 3 star American hotel. The breakfast buffet was delicious with a great assortment of cereals, meats, cheeses, fruits, etc. We booked the evening serenade-gondola ride with the hotel, which was nice, but since you are in a group of 6 gondolas with one seranader, there were times when we didn't hear the music during our ride! Next time, we'll pay the extra 20 Euro for a solo gondola ride and take it from St. Marks (so you can go under the Bridge of Sighs).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: cccruiser
Reviews.Content: We throughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Ala. The hotel was within easy walking distance of Piazza San Marco. The Varparetto (water taxi) was about a block away. The room was small, typical European style. It was very clean, with a view of the canal. The front desk staff could not have been more helpful. They were happy to help with sight seeing ideas. They even offered us rubber boots on the day the water was particularly high.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Tanzer
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Hotel Ala before we boarded our ship for a Transatlantic Cruise. The hotel is old with lots of Italian flavor. The water taxi took us right to the back door. We arrived in mid-morning and our room was ready for us. The people at the Hotel front desk were friendly, warm and answered all our questions. Because we arrived from the USA we felt we wanted to get on Venice time so off we went for a walk around San Marco Square. Then lunch at Cafe San Fresco, pizza of course! We loved it and made sure we came back for another lunch the next day. The sun was shinning and even though it was cool out the sun felt good. The Hotel Ala has small rooms and we had no view from our window. The room was clean, bed comfortable. Breakfast was excellent with lots to eat. The elevator is on the 2nd floor so you will have to walk up one floor to go to your room. The porter took our bags up and down for us. The American Cafe connected to the hotel was fun for a drink on a very cold evening.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Central”
Reviews.Author: JayBee25754
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful on arrival and throughout our three day stay. The room was adequately sized, clean and tidy. Amenites were as expected. Dining facilities and choice of food were more than adequate for our needs. The hotel is located in easy walking distance from St Mark's square and is surrounded by boutiques shops, eateries and 'nooks', all well worth visiting. We will definately stay again when next in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Our 3 days in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Candy G
Reviews.Content: Our first night in September we roasted in our room and walked the floors most of the night. We alerted the desk but no changes were made. The next morning the hotel was loaded with a tour. Breakfast was extravagant including eggs. The next night we were told the air conditioner was repaired but not much change. To open the windows meant mosquitos and to close them meant a sauna. The next morning the breakfast was very basic....no eggs since the tour left. To make amends they refunded some money and helped us to the airport with a private shuttle. Not the best experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near the canal”
Reviews.Author: JacobOslo
Reviews.Content: Great location in beautiful Venice and easy to find from the vaparetto stop. Only a 5 minutes walk to St. Marco Square but still in a quiet area. The hotel itself is quite average, and our room had a very strange smell, however the staff at front desk were very helpfull. Also the breakfast buffet is generous and very good. Recommendable and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: torcello123
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Hotel Ala many times, recently for a week. The location is perfect, as others have written, just steps to the vaporetto and traghetto. Easy walk to San Marco, La Fenice or Accademia bridge.The staff is great, and they have a popular bar/lounge. I don't know how some reviewers can call the breakfast here 'not big' - it is huge, and has anything you could possibly want in a very nice setting. I would recommend this highly. One other thing, I read in another review here wrong information about the airport and vaporetto. You cannot take a vaporetto to or from the airport for 3 or 4 euros. They don't run to the airport. You can take the Alilaguna which takes about 1 hour 20 minutes to get to San Marco for 15 Euro, or a water taxi directly to the hotel door for 110 euro. I guess you can also take a bus to the Piazzale Roma area, far from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “small but clean, good location, good breakfast, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: shawnsk
Reviews.Content: rooms was small but adequate for 2 people for a couple of nights. free breakfast was not very big but good. lots of fresh fruits. free wireless internet worked fine. friendly staff. friendly bartender in bar attached to lobby. walking distance to San Marco unless you are handicapped, but then Venice is not very handicap friendly. You'll have to do a bunch of stairs and a few bridges to get around. located very close to Vaporetto (about 50 meters from Giglio stop). and about 500 meters from San Marco (center of town). best and cheapest way to and from airport is Vaporetto about 3-4 euros per person. speed boat and Alilaguna service costs 4-5 times more and you'll have to carry your luggage up and down a bunch of stairs and bridges because they don't stop near the hotel. Vaporetto drops you off very close to hotel. They both take about the same 30 minutes. I think they run 24 hours, about once every half hour.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueenLWR
Reviews.Content: Having arrived at the back door by private water taxi via a narrow canal, we were surprised by the beauty of the lobby. Our check-in was flawless for the four couples traveling together. We dropped our bags and headed out for the day. When we returned the bags were in our rooms and we each had a different layout plan. We had flat screen tv's with 3 English speaking channels, a mini bar, hair dryer, comfortable beds and air conditioning. Our room overlooked the canal but it faced a building. We didn't mind, as we loved hearing the gondoliers singing while gliding by, so that made up for the lack of view. The breakfast room was large and well staffed. They had cereal, hot scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs ,rolls, juice, meats and cheeses. The cappuccinos were wonderful. LOCATION- the location was incredible. We were a short walk away from the Vaporetto, private gondolas and a bridge over to St. Mark's square. Everyone working at the Hotel Ala was kind, helpful and courteous. The lovely wine bar was intimate and just the right way to end a lovely day in Venice.We ate our best meal in their restaurant around the corner, Restaurante Raffaello. We cannot wait to return to Venice and The Hotel Ala.

Reviews.Title: “Locatio, clean, and charm”
Reviews.Author: Phillip T
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel Ala in October 2011, our first trio to Venice. After a disappointed experience with Venice-Connected machines, we arrived at mid night, the front desk and bell person were friendly, quickly to get us to our room. The room was large, charming, simple Venice style; It's better than our expectation since we'd read few horrible reviews about hotels in Italy in TripAdvisor. The bathroom was functional, modern with jacuzzi. We had a room with a view of canal. Since the hotel is right off S.Giglio stop of ACTV, and 5 minutes to S. Marco, we were be able to ride up and down the canal easily. Like other reviews, we had wonderful breakfast, a lot of fresh fruits, and fresh pastries. Overall, we like to recommend the Ala. We will stay in this hotel when we visit Venice in the future. Hotel Ala di personale, Grazie mille per la vostra ospitalitÃ .

Reviews.Title: “Location and charm”
Reviews.Author: KYlake
Reviews.Content: Our 3rd floor room overlooked the canal with gondolas going by in the afternoon and early evenings. Very charming. The room was large with three windows. Our only complaint is the shower which seemed to be an afterthought in the bathroom. If you get a room with a bathroom that is all tile with a shower curtain in the corner, watch out. The entire room becomes a shower with any paper products in the room included! If you want dry kleenex and toilet paper, put them in the cabinet when you shower. Other than the shower, the room was extremely comfortable. We had a problem with the breakfast area. On the first morning, another guest was coughing into the food displays. The coffee also was diner-type, well below Italian standards. Other folks seemed to be enjoying the breakfast, we ate elsewhere. All in all, great location, adequate staff, and a nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Value, Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ala in September 2011. It was our fourth stay at this hotel. The location and value are exceptional, but this time the staff performed beyond expectation. I took our clothes to a laundry and didn't check the closing time for the laundry and when I returned to pick up our clothes the laundry was closed. We were leaving early the next morning before the laundry would be open, but the concierge said he would have someone go to the laundry and pick up our laundry and send it to us in the USA. Only a few days after we returned home our laundry arrived. Mille Grazie Hotel Ala John and Paula Minnesota USA

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ala”
Reviews.Author: Peggysue43
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ala is centrally located, which helps on your first visit to Venice, The staff are all very friendly and helpful,our arrival on the water taxi was easy and without fuss The bed was comfortable, although the room was a little small for a three night stay.Breakfast had lots of choices. The bar attached to the hotel was a great place to finish an evening in Venice. The only disappointing thing was that our room did not look anything like the advertised rooms. The friendly staff (very helpful during a ferry strike on the Monday of our stay) and the central location helped to ease this disappointment. We travelled with another mature couple September 2011

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Convenience in San Marco”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne D
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Best Western Hotel Ala in the heart of Venice 2 or 3 times. It is unbeatable for location and the service is very good. It is right by the Vaporetto stop at Santa Maria del Giglio, so if you are too tired to walk, you can take the water bus and basically go anywhere. It is a 3 â€“ 4 minute walk to San Marco and the Doge Palace. Continental breakfast, with some cooked things such as eggs, is included in the daily room rate and certainly sets you up nicely for the day, There are interesting neighbourhoods nearby, such as Campo Angelo, and many good restaurants for dinner close at hand. Excellent shops, such as Venetia Studium and Cristina Linassi are also near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I Love Italy”
Reviews.Author: RPWfromAustralia
Reviews.Content: Having arrived to Venice by train from Florence, we took the vaporetti and enjoyed a trip down the grand canal to the Giglio stop. Make sure to buy a vaporetti map (2 euro) when you get your ticket so you can follow the journey and use for locating other things. It is only a short walk to the hotel using the directions they emailed me. Despite a complication with our booking - my fault not theirs - we were accomodated for our two nights. Our room was small but comfortable and all that we needed. Pricing and location far outwayed that minor issue. Everything is in walking distance. Be sure to go to St Marks square in the evening and listen to the music - just magic. Walking to the Rialto bridge gives you a chance to get away from the main areas and see more of the city. The shops are also cheaper. Breakfast at the hotel was excellent - catering for all tastes. We were able to leave our bags at the hotel after check out for half a day until we had to go to the airport which allowed us a final few hours to enjoy the city. Arriving home a week and a half later, I realised I had left behing a painting we had purchased in Venice. The hotel was most helpful in locating this and sending it to us. I definately need more time in Venice and would not hesitate to stay at Ala next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved watching the Gondolas drift below our window..”
Reviews.Author: MORROCOMRS
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ala was so easy to find, which is a plus when staying in Venice. We arrived by Vaporetti. Our room was on the second floor. Bed was comfortable and all you would need in a room for a two night stay or more was there. Fav thing was hearing and seeing the gondolas drift by with the solo singers and piano accordians and seeing the happy people floating by. The staff were good and when the printer didnt work to print our boarding pass they let us use the office. Breakfast was plentiful, there seem to be a lot of American Tourists more than any other. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Tort_10
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend this hotel. It is one of the hotels where you can get off the public â€œwater busâ€� (vaporetti) at the Santa Maria Giglio stop and take your bags up one short alleyway to the hotel without having to drag them over any bridges. It has a great location close to St. Markâ€™s square (10 minute walk), The Opera House (5 minute walk), and Accademia Bridge (8 minute walk). The staff was most good and helpful. Breakfast included and was great â€“ a wide variety of meats, cheeses, fruit, cereals, bread and rolls, coffee, juices, etc. A very good â€œAmerican Barâ€� with personable and helpful staff. A lot of travellers found their way to this bar. Stayed September 26-30 2011 with two of our friends of 30 years.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room and great view!”
Reviews.Author: mer0406
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel ala for 1 night before we left for a cruise. It was a very pleasant experience! The rooms were a good size, however it was a little pricey! But that's just Venice I think. It was kinda hard to find but after we found it it was very centrally located. Front desk were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was also very good. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annie D
Reviews.Content: Great location - so close to St Mark's Square - just a five minute walk but far enough away not to be noisy or completely surrounded by other tourists!! Great room and many thanks for the free upgrade we had due to celebrating our wedding anniversary. Our room overlooked the canal at the back of the hotel and every evening as we were getting ready to go out we were serenaded by the passing Gondoliers. Room was spotlessly clean, bathroom a good size with a bath (we were only expecting a shower), the beds were a tad hard but we slept fine and things like that are always going to be down to personal taste so not a problem. Breakfast was fantastic with a huge choice ranging from pastries to cheese, meats, cereals, yogurts and scrambled eggs. The coffee was SO good!!! We didn't really have a need to interact very much with the staff but they were always polite and answered our queries immediately. Many thanks for a really lovely stay in a very beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing stay at a Best Western hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yanmike
Reviews.Content: Perhaps part of my comment is that I had just arrived three hours late in Venice via the Orient Express but I had expected better considering that the hotel would have been advised of our lateness. We felt that the reception staff were surly and not really interested. We had not had any food for hours and needed something light like a sandwich. As the hotel had no restaurant we looked in the neighbouring squares but only full meals were being served. The hotel bar had one ham and cheese sandwich made that morning - it was now 10 pm!! We do not eat meat so refused. The hotel at a second request told us that nothing was available only breakfast food but no offer was made to feed us some of it...bread, cheese etc. The room was quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Neat, clean, and great location but mixed feelings about PR!”
Reviews.Author: Quirindi
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the evening at Hotel Ala exhausted after an extensive train journey from Paris, and received a warm welcome from Mario. He very kindly took our cases up to 3rd floor, carrying them up physically to 1st floor, twisting through several passages then to 3rd floor by lift. Our room was quite small and narrow, and at the end of a corridor, and we wondered how we would find our way out if a fire broke out and blocked our exit from the back corner of the hotel. Our 3rd story window overlooked one of the minor canals and a narrow footpath, which probably could be reached using knotted bedsheets or jumping into the canal itself in a case of emergency! Breakfast was lovely and very generous with many choices on offer,with soothing classical music playing and overall physically the hotel was very clean, neat and an attractive venue. Most of the staff were friendly apart from one person on reception who was quite abrupt and gruff as previously mentioned by TA critics. However, he helpfully recommended the nearby restaurant over the nearest bridge, and owned by the hotel for dining. The restaurant was very romantic with outdoor or sheltered outside dining with candles etc. and with singing gondoliers passing on the canal beside it. The food offered was reasonable but it all was no different than the usual Italian fare. We had been given a "10 % discount voucher" by the hotel which we used, but unfortunately the discount was cancelled out by the extra charge of 6 Euros per person for " the use of the cutlery" (as explained by the waiter). I have never heard of these charges before anywhere and we were not forewarned at all about it. Next day we had been kindly given the option of leaving our cases at the hotel until we left at midday which was the hotel's room vacation time. There is a certain nervousness about its staff as I read previously in Trip Advisor, we also were followed out by a staff member and questioned about our activities on our way to some nearby ATMs to withdraw money for our hotel payment. We were reminded that we only had 2 hours until we left! This was despite the fact that our luggage was being minded by the hotel, and we had earlier advised them that we were leaving late morning for our cruise ship. (I am not sure whether this over-vigilance comes from management down, or from the overly zealous staff member!) Apart from the above mentioned idiosyncrasies and the safety issue for some rooms, this hotel is quite a good venue for the Venice Experience! Maybe some PR training would help!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: reedlar
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice. We highly recommend this hotel. First, it is one of the hotels where you can get off of the public "water taxi" (vaporetti) at the Santa Maria Giglio stop and take your bags up one short alleyway to the hotel without having to drag them over any bridges. That is important in Venice. It has a great location close to St. Mark's square but far enough away to not have the noise of the crowd. We had an unusually hot night in late Sept - so the air conditioning was not able to keep up with the demand. However, after that first night - the temperature cooled and the air conditioning worked effectively. The staff was most helpful. We even left a picture we had purchased in our room. They found the tube and sent this to us at home. Anytime we needed directions or suggestions they were helpful. They have a very good "American Bar" with a personable and helpful staff. Many travelers found their way to this bar. Breakfast was included and it was great - a wide variety.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: lim0nata
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in an excellent location on a quiet square a short walk to the vaparetto stop and very convenient for sightseeing. Rooms were simple but comfortable and very clean. Nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrottingChris
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Hotel Ala during a recent two day stay in Venice. The location is great - the water bus stop is just a minute away (not fun for pulling heavy luggage but close enough). It is a short walk to St. Mark's Square and the walk there is perfect for all those who enjoying shopping at designer stores such as Burberry, Chanel, and Gucci to name a few. There are plenty of excellent restaurants and gelaterias nearby as well. The rooms were a fairly decent size however the air conditioning in our room wasn't working very well so it made for an unpleasant first night. Fortunately the customer service is excellent and we were allowed to move to a different room. It seems that some rooms have been renovated and others still need an update -I'd recommend staying on the 1st floor if possible. There is a nice bar on the first floor for cocktails in the evening and the hotels restaurant (located a short walk away) had delicious food. I'd recommend staying here. If you arrive by train be aware that the train stop is quite a distance away from the hotel and you might want to consider a private taxi boat. I didn't have breakfast here although my mother did and told me that it was quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Lynnie17
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ala was perfect for anyone's Venice trip and especially our second trip to Venice with our parents, who have some limited mobility issues due to knee problems. The hotel is just steps from the San Giglio Water Taxi stop - about a one block walk down a narrow Venice alley - where you emerge into a lovely open courtyard and the Ala. The Ala is in a lovely Venice nieghborhood with trendy shops, beautiful churches and the quiet Venice ambience one always imagines. Yet, it is convenient and closeto everything Venice has to offer. The service was exceptionally friendly and the rooms we had at the top of the marble staircase to the second floor were wonderful, with stained glass windows that opened up to fresh air, pretty window boxes and the expansive courtyard right outside. The bathrooms were generous and spotless - ours had the small black and white tiles of the 1930's. The hotel and rooms were appointed with antiques and elegant Venetian style fabrics. Breakfast was the best, with great American-style scrambled eggs and bacon - as well as a tremendous buffet selection of meats, cheeses, breads, cereals, fruits and yogurts . St. Marks' was a water taxi stop away, or a lovely canalside walk of about 6 blocks. The Rialto Bridge water bus stop was close, as well as the Accademia stop for the museums on the other side of the Grand Canal. Also, the Gondola ride point close to the Ala Hotel was well-located with the trip encompassing a long journey through the peaceful canals --- and with no gondola traffic! I would highly recommend the Ala Hotel, and would stay there in Venice again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ala is peace of mind.”
Reviews.Author: elFlaco1953
Reviews.Content: We were so please with this hotel last year that we decided to come back again for our third time in Venice. Great location and service is what you come to expect for your money and this is what you get here. Again we were satisfied with their great breakfast buffet and in the manner they took care of us. Our room had a great view to the front "campo" or square and in the morning the birds and the church bells was like music to our ears... a very quiet area in the morning, right on the center of it all. O.Galloso Miami, Fl

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Hotel Ala Venice Italy”
Reviews.Author: GLT-LCT
Reviews.Content: Comfortable and clean room but too narrow. Needs nightlight to help navigate at night to avoid bumping into clutter. Breakfast varied, fresh and very good. Friendly and informed staff who spoke English, and sometimes French.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Venice”
Reviews.Author: sulee
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed 4 night stay at this hotel during August 2011. Our room was abit small but clean and well attended to by the maid. Great location (5mins from San Marco), in a quiet square and had rooms overlooking canal. Enjoyed the breakfast in breakfast room (lower floor) particularly the fruit tart and lemon cake.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: canadampls
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here at the end of August 2011. Location can't be beat, especially since I was traveling with my father who has a bad knee. Easily close enough for him to walk to Piazza San Marco and some great restaurants. Great breakfast and service, and very clean hotel. Only criticism would be that the air conditioning didn't work all that great.

Reviews.Title: “Fresco Ceiling, Canal View and Old World Charm... Wow”
Reviews.Author: Packman58
Reviews.Content: This well positioned yet affordable hotel was a great overnight stop before we cruised off to the Greek Islands. Staff were friendly and very helpful, the room was absolutely beautiful and the breakfast had a delicious selection to choose from. The price could be better and there are a few stairs to navigate before the lift is accessible, however, Hotel Ala is a great place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: laralopes
Reviews.Content: This was the second time that we have stayed in this hotel, the last time being in 2009. The staff are fantasic and very helpful and the hotel is very close to Saint Marco Square. The rooms are very clean and comfortable and the breakfasts are very good with a great selection. We are looking forward to staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, wonderful staff and delicious breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: lozziewade
Reviews.Content: We could not be happier with this hotel and staff. Our room was spotless and very comfortable. It was much more luxurious than expected. The breakfast buffet was delicious, expecially the fruit tart! Best thing about this hotel was the location. So close to St. Mark's Square and museums. Very friendly and helpful staff. Right on the water but very quiet and peaceful. Cant wait to go back again. A definite gem!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful service, great breakfast, superb location.”
Reviews.Author: Enjoy-the-nature
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent, only metres from the water bus stop, or by water taxi direct to the hotel reception! The breakfast is great. We were provided with a coffee/tea tray each afternoon and night free of charge. All staff were very helpful. Room and bathroom was small but we expected that. We had a room that faced the plaza which was nice during the day but still very quiet at night and the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Judeandmick
Reviews.Content: We had a family room for 4 and it was really big with 2 kingside beds. The hotel and room were clean and comfortable. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was good and varied. Location is perfect - 5 mins walk to San marco square. Overall, excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for exploring Venice”
Reviews.Author: neverstoptravelling5
Reviews.Content: From the water taxi dropping us off at the back canal door to being picked up for the short trip to airport in the same way this was a perfect spot. It is in a great location to explore Venice and is easy walk to all the sites and right into the heart of the shopping. The staff were very nice and the breakfast more then adequate. Our rooms were good size by European standards and clean and neat. The staff arranged private taxi and tickets back to Morano Island which was a nice change from the main Venice. Would definitely choose again.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: TanyaTJ
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed our stay very much, had beautiful view over a square, jacuzzi tub... we will definitely return :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Aussie1956
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for three nights. Hotel Ala is located on a canal and you can get a water taxi directly to their door. Checking in was efficient and the staff were professional. Our hotel room was not large but adequate and we have a reasonable sized renovated bathroom. Our room was located directly on the canal and we could hear and see the gondolas passing by our window. Breakfast was very good and included hot cooked breakfast, pastries, fresh fruit, and yoghurt. We found our room on the second floor to be quiet. We would certainly return to this hotel. There was free wi fi If you turn left when leaving the hotel entrance on the piazza there is a ferry station on the Grand Canal (approximately 20 metres) St Mark's is about a 10 minute walk or less. This hotel is in a truly excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay any where else?”
Reviews.Author: jpstrv
Reviews.Content: I found this wonderful place a few years ago. Now I spend at least a week there every year Friendliness, beauty, service, convenience, comfort, breakfast - I can't imagine any hotel offering more, or better!

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers”
Reviews.Author: Almac71
Reviews.Content: What an awful experience in the city I was most looking forward to visiting. Normally I go with at least a top 10 rated hotel on trip advisor, but as I left it late & it was the w'end, I had to go MUCH further down the list. Mind you, this hotel is still rated highly & I've no idea why...there must be better rooms than the one I got?! I read a few negative comments, but on the whole, positive, so against my better judgement, booked it, but only for 2 nts not my intended 3. The ONLY redeeming features of this hotel is the location & the rooftop terrace, which had a nice view. The room I had was tiny, had no window, just a skylight, was decorated from what looked like the 60's, smelt of sewerage (they put the rubbish bin in the bathroom over the drain & the sink plug was closed...it didn't take long to work out why), was grimy & the bed like a rock. The dust on the ancient aircon was disgusting. The shower nozzle didn't work properly & 1/2 way through my shower I had to turn it off until it could drain so as not to overflow...it leaked anyway. The porter/receptionist was like Basil Fawlty...clunking my luggage up the stairs & muttering to himself. So far on this trip I've used trip advisor for my hotel choices in London, Paris, Madrid & Barcelona, all fantastic. This hotel is the most expensive (yes, I know it's Venice on a w'end in peak season) yet the most hideous.

Reviews.Title: “Shoved us in the tiniest, oldest, smelliest room they had.”
Reviews.Author: abigail t
Reviews.Content: THis place was horrible. not only were the rooms small and cramped, they were straight out of the sixties. the worst part, however was the fact that the sewer kept backing up and filled our bathroom with the smell of other peoples fecies. if the stopper on the sink is not down all the way, beware!!!!!! also, no windows, and staff was very rude. Avoid this place!!!!!!! not a good value for the amount we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Breakfast, Great Location, Small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: labtrav2
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here in July in 2 double superior rooms. I wouldn't want to stay in a regular double room if these were superior. I don't know what could have been superior about them. They were tiny with tiny bathrooms. All bathrooms in Italy are small but this hotel had the tiniest of our entire 3 weeks in Italy. The breakfast and the service almost made up for it though. The staff is generally very helpful and accommodating. We asked to move to a bigger room which they did but it just wasn't much bigger and the bathroom was the exact same. We were only there for 2 days though and spent most of our time sightseeing anyway. The breakfast was fantastic. It had everything -cereal, pastries, eggs, sausage, fruit, fruit tarts, yogurt, sliced meats and cheeses, on and on. It was included in the price of the room so that was a big bargain. The location is great. It's a short walk to anywhere important in Venice and there's a water taxi available right out the back door of the hotel which was extremely convenient for our early morning departure. I would recommend this place as long as you know you'll be cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but nice”
Reviews.Author: iwiwi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an old palazzo on a nice piazza. We had very clean rooms. Some of the rooms were with a nice view, some with no view at all. Air condition was a little tedious at night. Friendly service, superior breakfast. The breakfast rooms was not big enough for all guest, so sometimes you had to wait for a table. The hotel bar is open until midnight, on weekends until one. Good drinks, even good wine (preferred the Chianti). Just five minutes from San Marco, close to the vaporetto station. All in all - although not very reasonable - worth the money for a relaxing trip to venice.

Reviews.Title: “avoid”
Reviews.Author: Sqwhirl
Reviews.Content: The room was ok. Fun to look out over one of the back canals but the staff ruined the stay. They weren't merely unhelpful. They actively interfered and caused hassles and when asked for assistance were unhelpful, distant, appeared anoyed and at times openly rude. One staff member ran out of the hotel and chased us down, demanding that we check out immediately (hours earlier than the scheduled time). We had planned to leave early and if asked kindly wouldn't have had a problem with putting out bags in storage but to be chased into the street to be barked at repeatedly demanding that we go back to the hotel and check out hours earlier was ridiculous. When we did leave, this same man kept yelling out our room number. We never did understand what he was so upset about but were certainly happy to leave. I recommend you avoid this hotel. Lots of lovely other places to stay in Venice with good people and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: MrsVAuckland
Reviews.Content: So easy to find from the railway station, get off at Giglio walk to the end of the alley and you are there. Rooms very clean and serviced twice daily with new towels if required. Singing gondoliers passed right under our window, St Marks Square just a short walk, fantastic breakfast catering for all tastes. Only concern in our standard room the shower was very tiny, if I was just a wee bot bigger I wouldn't have been able to get through the door :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Nanpacific
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights before we started our cruise. I booked this online and was very happy with the hotel. The staff were great to work with and very welcoming. The breakfast was wonderful and had a wide variety of things to choose from - not just bread and coffee. The location of the hotel was great for us - an easy walk to St. Marks Square and a vaporetto stop about 100 meters away. The room had been recently remodeled (this is an old building but you would never know it inside) and was immaculately clean. The bathroom was modern, the room had the traditional silk on the wall. The room was not huge (typical in Europe where space is at a premium) but the best part was that we could open the window and see and hear the gondoliers below us. We were close to the Grand Canal and had alot of gondola traffic. We loved to hear them sing. When you wanted quiet, the hotel had these amazing windows and shutters that closed and you had no noise, and also no light if you wanted complete quiet. My only issue was that the bed was very hard. I have back issues so that is why I gave it the score I did on Quality of Sleep. It was not due to noise or anything else - I just need a softer bed. The hotel to their credit had me try several rooms to see if any were softer (they were all the same) and they had the maids put some blankets over the mattress to make it softer. They did their best to accomodate me in this matter. One thing that you will love is that you do not have to walk over bridges with luggage to get to the hotel. If you take Vaporetto 1 and get off on Giglio you are a straight 100 meter walk to the hotel on a flat surface. Venice is loaded with bridges, and very crowded so you wil appreciate the location and ease of getting there. We bought the Vaporetto pass and had an easy time getting around since the stop was so close to the hotel.When we got ready to go to the ship, we used the Vaporetto pass to get to where we could take the People Mover to the ship. Water taxi's are pricey and we managed to do this fairly easily with a month's worth of luggage. The People Mover to the port is only 1 Euro and is a good value - you can get luggage carts at the port and from there the check in is easy. Water Taxi's start at about 80 Euro and go up so this was a good savings. I don't know if the hotel had a gym or a spa as I did not bother to check - too much else to see in Venice and since you find yourself walking all day you do not need the treadmill. They do not have a pool as far as I know. I did not eat in their restaurant so I cannot tell you about it. There is a decent market in Venice off the Zattere stop (called something like Billeca) on the vaporetto. Wine was very reasonable there and we got a few bottles for on the ship. They also had a nice deli and good selection of snacks. My husband found some cookies he loved. Try the local wine called Prosecco - kind of like a champagne. You could get a bottle for very little at this market. This is the wine used in a Bellini which is the drink of Venice. If you want fresh fruit I recommend the Rialto Market but you have to get there before noon. They have a huge selection of fresh fruits and vegetables which are good quality. You will love Venice - food is kind of pricey but you will have a great time! It is really an interesting place, and one that you should definitely visit.

Reviews.Title: “We all thought it was excellant”
Reviews.Author: Flowers095
Reviews.Content: My elderly brother and wife came over to stay from Australia and we stayed in Hotel ALA for two nights it was a beautifull hotel very clean and friendly and the staff could not do enough to help us with our cases and information. The rooms were a good size, beds were very comfortable, safe in the room free, and a well stocked fridge if needed and really great bathroom amenities. Breakfasts was superb, wished they catered for evening meals. The location was the best, 5 minutes walk from St Marks Square and just down the alleyway to water bus stop, we could not have wished for better. It was my brother from Australias dream to go to Venice and this hotel helped to make very memorable - so thank you all at Hotel ALA - Southampton - England - July 2011

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Beautiful & Spacious Room”
Reviews.Author: RoaminGnomes
Reviews.Content: After flying into Marco Polo airport, my husband and I followed the directions in Rick Steeve's book. We bought our tickets for the Vaporetto and, after leaving the airport, followed signs (left) for the docks. We waited a short bit before boarding the Vaporetto and enjoyed the ride to Venice. We got off at Saint Mark's, and had to ask a few different hotels how to find Hotel Ala. It was a bit of a trek with our luggage to get to Hotel Ala (from Saint Mark's). Instead of this, we could have taken the Vaporetto an extra stop (or two) to S. Maria del Giglio - it is 50 yards from the front door of the hotel; a short two minute walk down a little alley. We did then when we were leaving and it was SO much easier. The hotel itself has a strange layout. We had to walk up a flight of stairs to get onto a floor with an elevator that we then took to our fourth floor room. After checking in, we did have a member of the staff carry our bags up that flight - which was helpful! The room itself was lovely. We had a nice window that opened up into a little alley and allowed us to look out over the rooftops of Venice. Our room had a queen bed and a settee. Both were rather firm. We had a small refrigerator, a small tv, and a decent sized bathroom. The shower even had nice water pressure. The room was cleaned daily and felt like home. One of the best features of our stay was the complimentary breakfast Hotel Ala offers. It had a terrific spread of cheeses, meats, breads, cereals, and fruit. They had a number of awesome spreads as well - nutella, jams, jellies, etc. We were offered tea, coffee, espresso, and cappuccino, as well. The best part was that many of the cereals and fruit were individually packaged and the staff didn't mind if you took one or two for the road. We did this each morning, since I'm not a huge eater when I first wake up. I'd take an apple or some granola to snack on. Lastly, the location of this hotel is perfect. I know that I said it was a trek with luggage from Saint Mark's. Without luggage, it was an easy five-minute walk to the square and all attractions. We adore Venice - be sure to visit the Basilica (I recommend paying the extra 4 euro to go to the upper level; you can see the original horses, can view the square from above, and the view of the church's inside from above is impressive) and Doge's Palace (the audio tour of the palace is WELL WORTH the money!!! and, you get to walk the Bridge of Sighs!). When we checked in, the hotel gave us a coupon for the restaurant Ristorante da Raffaele. We went and had a lovely dinner right alongside one of the smaller canals. The food was good, and the view was very quaint. Overall, I would definitely visit Venice again and would most definitely stay at Hotel Ala. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back again !!”
Reviews.Author: MrsH100710
Reviews.Content: We booked a superior room for our first wedding anniversary and had an amazing stay. Our room was in the attic and there are a few steps to climb from the lift but nothing unreasonable and staff carried my bags when we checked in. The room was not huge but at the same not to small either. It was very clean, quaint and cosy and the bed was super comfy. Towels were also changed everyday. There is plenty of choice for breakfast and all food is fresh and constantly replenished. The bar staff were very friendly and it wasgreat to finish the evening off there before bed. This hotel is in a great location just a short walk to the St Marks Square and close to the vapretto stop convenient for arriving but we still decided to get a private water taxi from the airport, expensive but then everything is in Venice and felt like we arrived in style. Make sure you make use of the sun terrace, after a long day exploring we would sit and enjoy a bottle of wine before freshing up for the evening but we were the only ones who seemed to take advantage of this so we had it all to ourselves for the whole stay and you can order breakfast up there to if you like. Make sure you visit the church next door. All in all we thought this was a lovely hotel in a great location and will definitely stay there again when we return to Venice. Thanks Hotel Ala

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location. Ho-hum room.”
Reviews.Author: trat10
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have pointed out, you need to take the stairs to get from the ground floor to the first floor for part of the hotel. This wasn't much of an issue as the porter carried our bags to the room. The room was fairly clean and well furnished, but given that it we had paid for a "Deluxe Room," the room did not meet my expectations at all. It did not look as nice as any of the "Deluxe" or "Superior" rooms on the website and wasn't as big as those. Although the room was designated a "non-smoking" room, it smelled faintly of smoke. The location is convenient to the major sights and the vaporetti stop. In the end, however, I would have preferred to have been more distant from the sights and in a quieter, more picturesque area. The breakfast was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: malzy
Reviews.Content: A comfortable and pleasant 3 star hotel with staff who work hard to please. Only 50 metres from the No 1 ferry stop so easy to get to from the railway. Nearby is a provision shop for those important snacks and beers. Piazza St Marco only a stroll away. Our room was on the 4th floor (attic) and very nice - but the lift left us with one level to lug the bags. Room was larger than expected and large enough for us both to have our bags open, plus a nice nook for catching up with my email on the free wifi for internet. Breakfast was really great in a kitchen/dining area. Fresh fruit plus all the regular great stuff to fill you up for the day, Bar downsatirs is very popular at night. Highly recommended for your no problem stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: PamGurdHughes
Reviews.Content: Our trip started in Istanbul and then we boarded a ship to cruise Ephesus, the Greek Islands, Montenegro, Croatia and Slovenia. Our cruise ended in Venice and we decided to spend an additional three nights in Venice. We were very disappointed in our room, the service and the lack of elevator from the main floor to our room. The people at the front desk were not very friendly or helpful. The best part of our stay at the hotel was the breakfast that was included in the price of the room; it was very good. The hotel was rated as three-star; however, we found it to be a dump. It was expensive as two of the three nights were over $400 Canadian. We have rarely been disappointed with our choice of hotels but this one did not meet our expectations. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ppapp
Reviews.Content: Once in Venice, you notice quite a few hotels, as the island is a large tourist trap embedded in a historic city. So with that in mind, location of your Hotel becomes key. We stayed here because of it's proximity to St. Marco square and traveling with a six year old has it's challenges. Our room was quite nicely appointed and had a brand new bathroom, with jacuzzi I might add. Our daughter loved that feature. Morning breakfast was included, in the basement resturant, good selection and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Morganmime
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed here several years ago- I think it was 2004. My memories are so fond, I still think about it and decided to write a review. It was so interesting inside- there was so much character. We even had real heavy wood shutters on our room and the window looked right out onto a canal, I remember a beautiful gondola being parked beneath. It was in easy walking distance of piazza san marco and it definitely deserved more than 3 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned hotel, wonderful breakfast, staff could be more friendly”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkMary
Reviews.Content: Hotel was well positioned and communal areas were attractive. However, one sofa and two armchairs were all the seating available in the lounge area, which I felt was rather inadequate for a hotel of this size. Breakfast however, was a highlight with a vast range of fresh produce - we really were spoilt for choice. Initially we were rather disappointed with our room as it was described as 'superior', however, it was fairly basic. Nevertheless it was kept very clean and tidy, the bed was comfortable and it was fairly quiety, so it did score on those points. The hotel did feel rather impersonal as the staff, particularly those on breakfast duty were efficient, but not exactly friendly, not even saying good morning. Overall a well positioned hotel with a wonderful breakfast, which we would probably recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in magical Venezia”
Reviews.Author: Cruizergrl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value, has a fantastic location, (five mins to St. Marco) & has fabulous, helpful staff. Hotel is family run by the Salmaso family & the building dates from the 16th century. It's located at the Santa Maria de Giglio stop on the vaporetto (one stop before St. Marco) in the square of Campo Santa Maria del Giglio. The rooms are a bit tiny but the other amenities more than compensate. Breakfasts are fantastic with lots of choice. Be sure to pay to see the church next door - Chiesa di Santa Maria del Giglio. The Venetian baroque facade is amazing & so is the art by Tintoretto & Peter Paul Reubens inside. Shopping en route to St. Marco's square is the best in the world: Chanel, Gucci, Prada, Hermes etc. Hotel is within close walking distance to many fine restaurants & panini places & the Rialto etc. etc. Make sure that you visit Ristorante da Raffaele which is 2 mins away & is owned by the same family. Having the boat pull up to the canal in back of the hotel is beyond convenient. Make sure to take the free boat ride over to Murano to visit Signoretti glass making factory & ask for Massimo. Murano is great to sightsee as it is quieter than Venice & very charming. The private boat launch to Murano was the ride of a lifetime which I will never forget. Grazie tanto bella Venezia!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, wonderful location, quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Igetarnd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 2 other couples. We all enjoyed our rooms. They were large enough, well furnished with very nice bathrooms. We enjoyed a bottle of wine on the rooftop patio more than once. Ask at the desk for a restaurant recommendation and they will give you a post card for the Raffaele with a 10% discount (apparently they own it). The Raffaele was good. We paid for our rooms before hand and received a nice discount. We took a water taxi from the airport and stopped at the hotel's back door, very convenient. Would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Ciao Venezia”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotters08
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Venice and it was a stunning few days. The hotel was very nice and the staff extremely courteous and helpful. The room and bathroom were a little on the small side but comfortable and very clean. Breakfast was very good with excellent scrambled and boiled eggs with plenty of fruit, yoghurts, rolls, ham etc. Also the delicious little cakes that the Italians love so much.There is a lovely roof terrace where we spent many hours enjoying the peace and quiet and listening to the wonderful opera singers on the gondolas gliding below us. The location was perfect for everything that we wanted to do. Wonderful restaurants nearby and excellent sandwich shops where we bought our lunch and daily bottle of prosecco! Also, very close to some of the most gorgeous shops which we would pass on our way to St Mark's Square and try not to buy anything! Thank you Hotel Ala.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience, never again”
Reviews.Author: Citygal23
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the hotel Ala, my husband and I approached the reception desk and were asked to produce our passport details and then handed a room key to proceed to our room. Firstly we were allocated a room which was on the second floor and the ground floor having no access to a lift, my husband was saddled with carrying a huge heavy suitcase up the flight of stair, no assistance from the hotel personnel whatsoever. The hotel staff and reception personnel were exceptionally rude, and arrogant to say the least! Getting into our room my husband discovered the air-conditioner was out of action, and hence called the hotel manager to enquire if there was anything they could do to solve the cooling issue. There again we were shirked off - i was so disgusted i wanted to leave the hotel immediately. We paid for a superior room, but were given the worst room in the hotel, to add to this the bulbs in the bathroom had burnt out on the first night and the hotel didnt bother to replace them. The room was tiny, damp and depressing!! I will never ever return to this hotel, and will certainly convey this to all my friends and family who are visiting venice between 2011-2011!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with very pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Baxterthetravelguy
Reviews.Content: Once I figured out the Vaporetto 1 stop going to St. Mark's was to the far right of the train station it was a lovely trip down the canal to the Giglio stop. It really was incredibly easy to walk up the little path and within maybe 2 minutes maximum we were at the hotel. We used a water taxi twice and it did pull up right to the canal side door of the hotel. The best part was the 5 minute walk to St. Mark's Square but you have to keep your eyes shut as you go past the Gucci and Chanel shops that seem to line the walk to the square. Breakfast filled you up and there were always scrambled eggs and toast. The breakfast area can get a little crowded and I was surprized the coffee was American style and not Italian style. The rooftop garden was a nice touch and we enjoyed a drink at the attached bar. I loved our canal side room (2nd floor) and enjoyed waving at all the tourists in the gondolas and hearing the music. Ask for a canal side if you can, we didn't find that they used this canal very late at night so it never disturbed us at all. Please see my pictures to see how pleasant a spot this is.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel "A...L...A"---A...Location...Absolutely”
Reviews.Author: GCSMaryland
Reviews.Content: Pre cruise 2 days at the Hotel Ala was FANTASTIC. Reasonably priced for prime location 2 bridges west of Piazza San Marco. 10 min. walk tops. Hotel beautifully located on canal where we (2 senior lady friends) had our room overlooking the canal thanks to the wonderful bilingual staff. Kudos to Moreno and Mario who could not do enough for us with their Italian friendliness and kindness which was very much appreciated. Room was very clean with nice bathroom supplied with toiletries and clean towels every day. Breakfast room was located on lower ground floor decorated in bright white and well lit. Wonderful selections of fresh fruits, meats, cheeses, yogurt, bread/rolls, scrambled eggs, cereals, hot coffee, tea, and even pastries. Everything you want or need for breakfast. Staff constantly keeping everything filled. Lovely bar with many selections and dish of nuts given with your drinks. Overall, cannot want or need anything more that is not supplied at this charming hotel. On my return to Venice, Hotel Ala will be my NO. 1 CHOICE.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - rooms a little overpriced”
Reviews.Author: travelling006
Reviews.Content: Stayed in ala hotel for the weekend, great location, close to all main parts of the city, shopping, restaurants,... Hotel is a little bit overpriced, rooms could be refurbished! Friendly and helpful staff! Nice choice at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: peterza
Reviews.Content: Booked two nights here to end our whirlwind trip in Italy and couldn't have wished for anything more. Room was spacious, overlooking the canal and even had a spa bath - was a bit pricy but it was Venice and the location is in walking distance to all the main attractions so worth it. No need to catch the line 1 boat if you get the ferry from the airport - the hotel is barely a 5 minute walk from the main dock provided you don't have too much luggage.It is an older building so was rather nosiy at night but not unbearable.The staff were extremely helpful and went out of their way to ensure that your stay was a good one - the tea and coffee service was great after a day of walking round Venice. Check with the reception as the hotel also offers complementory shuttle services to different locations on a daily basis. The breakfast couldn't have been better - was very sad to leave this great hotel and magical city!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: BellaGirlTravels
Reviews.Content: Just finished a two night stay at Hotel Ala, after reading reviews from Tripadvisor. I was a bit concerned as I had read mixed reviews, but am happy to advise that we had a lovely stay and found the hotel to be in an excellent location, the rooms to be spotlessly clean and the breakfast to be plentiful and varied. Lovely! Pillows were a little hard for my likely, but I am very hard to please when it comes to pillows. If I could travel with my own, I would! Short walk to St Marks Square or Vaporetto Line 1 (Giglio stop). Lovely campo out the front, far enough away from the action to be quiet, lovely surrounds (especially if you would like to do a bit of shopping at the prestigious boutiques!). First trip through the hotel to our room was a bit of a maze, but once we learnt the route to our room we were fine. Found the staff to be friendly and accomodating, with excellent english. Hotel even notified us of the local transport strike that was to occur on the day of our departure to assist us in making any changes to our travel plans. Would stay again at this hotel the next time we are in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, stay away from basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: gauravgangwani
Reviews.Content: We booked an economy room category just to find out the room given to us was a terrace room on the fourth floor with hardly any place to stand or move around ... it was the worst room i had ever seen in my life,it was like a torture room..my wife felt very claustrophobic, after requesting the management few times we finally got a better room the next day..although the new room was very very small but it was thankfully not a terrace room. the hotel staff was very helpful and polite, the only suggestion would be not to book an economy room in this hotel unless you want to spoil your holiday. The location of the hotel is excellent, very close to excitement of St Marks square and the Water bus stop and the breakfast served was very good.

Reviews.Title: “A staff that goes above and beyond.”
Reviews.Author: ferrari60532
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. First of all, it is absolutely stunning. I visited here with my family last summer and it was a great start to our Venice portion of the trip. The rooms were beautiful and charming. The location is great, near the canal and San Marco Plazo. There are great restaurants all around. But what makes this place really special is the staff. The last night of my stay, my daughter lost her stuffed animal. It was a teddy bear her boyfriend gave her before he went to college and it meant the world to her. The sentimental value was great so when it was nowhere to be found she went to the front desk and tried to explain to them her concern. Apparently, it must have gotten picked up by housekeeping with the bedding. She showed a picture of the bear from her camera (it's something they do whenever they bring the bear to a new place) and concierge took her information. About a week later, my daughter received an email from the receptionist telling her her bear was found and would be shipped to the United States. The bear arrived around the time we returned home and although a little shrunken from the dryer, her bear was good as new. The hotel staff contacted the laundry facility to make sure the bear was found and then shipped it all the way to us in Chicago free of charge. I hope this story is an indication of how dedicated and caring Hotel Ala is to their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Convenient Stay in the Heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: rbuck82
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 10 day trip to Italy with my wife and her parents. We spent the last two days of our trip in Venice and stayed at the Hotel Ala. It is part of the Best Western chain, but like most Best Westerns in Europe (maybe everywhere - I'm not sure), it is independently owned and operated. The location could not be better. If you take the Vaparetto to the Rialto stop, the walk is only a couple of minutes from the dock down a narrow alleyway. If you walk the other direction, you can be to St. Mark's Square in about 10 minutes. Our room was spacious by European standards. They were kind enough to place us in the room adjacent to the in-laws, which was convenient for us. Our room was very pink with white, flowery furnishings. It was very princess-like. My wife loved it for that reason but I wasn't too keen on it. But it's all very tongue-in-cheek in the moment. It was clean and comfortable and didn't affect my ability to use the restroom or sleep, so who cares? Her parents' room was not pink but a light shade of green, so I don't think all the rooms are fit for a princess, so to speak. The elevator going up to the room was brand new, but since my wife hates elevators, we took the stairs. We were on the third floor, but it was not bad to climb. The hotel offered one computer with complimentary Internet access (although they suggested a donation to charity in a little lock box on the desk). They gave me the paper with the login credentials, but I decided to drop in a 2 Euro coin. The computer is situated right next to the area where they serve breakfast. The breakfast was pretty good. It was the only place we stayed in Italy that offered hot food, like scrambled eggs. They also had the typical assortment of pastries, breads, etc. and juices and coffee. The seating area was large and clean. There were two people on staff, but they weren't proactive in offering coffee or anything of the like. It seemed like their job was to keep the area clean and well stocked. We booked a water taxi to the airport for the morning of our departure and it arrived right behind the hotel. It cost 110 Euros and took about 45 minutes. The hotel made all the arrangements for us and I don't think they charged us much more than if we had done it ourselves, so that worked out well. The only issue we had with the hotel was the mosquitos. I'm not sure why I never figured there would be mosquitos in Venice with all that stagnant water, but I guess I just assumed early April would be too early for them. I was WAY wrong.
