We had our window open because we were hot and the A/C was not yet on for the season. Once we realized mosquitos were coming in, we closed it, but it was obviously too late. Although we never really saw most of them, I woke up the next morning with 25 mosquito bites all over my body. The hotel did provide mosquito repellant wipes in the rooms, but no one ever warned us about this. I docked them a little on sleep quality as a result, but honestly, I think this could happen anywhere in Venice, so don't let that deter you from this hotel. Just make sure you bring insect repellant and Cortisone or Benadryl!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly positioned”
Reviews.Author: annmargaret31
Reviews.Content: A perfectly positioned pleasant hotel providing a substantial and varied tasty breakfast. My husband's gluten free dietary needs were met and we had an excellent few days in a city we had never before visited. The hotel staff were very good to the point of locating my nightdress which had inadvertently been sent to the laundry along with the discarded towels, and then forwarding it to me here at home.The hotel had a welcoming atmosphere with friendly staff and we will return to the Ala when we next visit Venice, hopefully in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “What a dissappointment”
Reviews.Author: brownswekile
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was such a let down :(. After so many rave reviews from TA I had high hopes. Check in process was good. The man who helped me was friendly and escorted me to my room. First ompression of the room - was ok but not totally impressed. The old school kind of deco does not go with me. The room had a little terrace, which I loved. I needed a showere immediately after check in - that is where my troubles started. The shower had zero power. I had to wait 2 minutes to wet my face towel??? Where was all the water? So I just left and dressed up again went to reception to enquire. Nice dude turned into eveil dude on me. Refused to change my room. I asked him to come to my room and see if he could have a descent shower in that shower. Thankfully he agreed, after seeing my predicament, he agreed to swap my room. Next room had a good working shower and a bath so I was happy with that. The fact that the guy refused to swap rooms for me left a bad taste on my mouth. Location wise, its perfect. I mean - its in Venice and a few minutes away from St Marko and most of beautiful Venice. Breakfast was good as well... full english breakfst with scrambled egg. The rooom was cold. Overall, good location - good breakfast but the service from reception needs a bit of work. They need to learn how to handle complaints from patrons.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, outstanding location!”
Reviews.Author: faraway46
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to be like everyone else, dragging luggage up and down bridges and stairs, then this is your place to stay. You get on Vaporetto #1, get off in Giglio stop and you are literally 50 yards away from the hotel, down a narrow alley. It is a 10min stroll to San Marcos square, 5min to Academia and 15min to Rialto.You can pick rooms with a plaza or small canal view. If you decide to splurge and take a water taxi, they can leave you at their doorstep. As for service, it is superb. Front desk is always attentive, kind and helpful. The rooms were on the larger side (compared to other rooms in Venice) and the bathroom is large and comfy. Bathroom amenities were complete, they would clean our room twice a day and change towels as many times as we liked (even twice a day, too!...we're shower freaks...sorry) Breakfast is varied, plentiful and delicious. The breakfast area is a little tight, but everything is in Venice. It is located on a quite square so the hotel is quiet but a bridge away from all major shopping (Prada, Valentino, Etro, Hermes, etc). This hotel is the best value for excellent service in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location”
Reviews.Author: proteinchaser
Reviews.Content: This hotel pleasantly surprised me. I found the front desk to be helpful, knowledgeable, and willing to make the extra effort to make my stay enjoyable and productive. My room was larger than I expected (based on past experience in Italy), quiet, and impeccably clean and well kept. The hotel is easy to get to and the location is hard to beat! The only slightly negative issue was that I found the internet (which was essentially free) to be slow. This is obviously a minor issue for most people, but if you are there on business and require a fast internet connection, it can be a bit frustrating. Nevertheless, this will not deter me from staying at this hotel during my next visit to Venice. Overall, an excellent experience. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Clean and Central”
Reviews.Author: matarsakzendeh
Reviews.Content: A clean, basic hotel with an excellent location in central Venice, easy access to the Vaparetto stop (which unfortunately was closed on the holiday we arrived, resulting in our some adventurous dragging of bags over too many bridges- in the rain). We had a triple room which was truly no frills - but clean, with a spotless bathroom. The staff was exceptionally efficient and helpful, especially in trying to provide us with boots for high tide â€“ and providing advice. Communication with the hotel prior to arrival was also excellent. Breakfast was solid. Internet access was also good, with codes provided by the front desk. The only negative at this hotel was that our room faced the busy side street which had a lot of foot traffic, and the noise level at night was quite high â€“ the windows did not block the conversations in the street â€“ so try to choose a canal-side room or a higher floor if you can. Another minor inconvenience was the constant malfunctioning of our room key â€“ even the staff had issues with itâ€¦ Overall we were quite pleased with our stay and would happily choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: hvann
Reviews.Content: We were at the hotel with my in-laws who had not travelled extensively internationally. They had a great experience due, in no small part, to the friendliness and understanding of the staff. The rooms were very nice, 101 and 102, on the piazza and, though somewhat small, were well appointed and very well kept. I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GMCIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden jewel. From the outset, prompt and friendly replies to any emails I sent, no problem with late check in (arrived at 10:30pm). The hotel really is beside the Vaporetto stop, take the one and only street leading from the jetty and the hotel is at the other end - could not have been easier to find!!!!! Having stayed in other hotels in Veince, I know how hard it can be to find your hotel, again no problem here. Had 2 rooms on the 1st floor, one overlooking the square to the front of the hotel, the other overlooking a charming canal to the side. Both rooms were of a good size, with clean well appointed private bathrooms, safe and minibar in the room, and tea facilities available upon request (just ask at the front desk). Breakfast was a delight, and what choice (in a previous hotel all that was on offer was coffee and bread rolls). This hotel provided everything from fresh fruit, yoghurts, selections of ham and cheeses, tea and coffee, toast, selection of bread, jams and honey was provided also, little packets of biscuits in wrappers (great for filling your bag to keep you going throught the day), and a full selection of fruit juices. Then my favourite bit, the pasteries - what can i say tried different ones each morning , totally spoiled for choice. The bar was a lovely little oasis from the hustle and bustle of the Carnivale crowd. My mother was most suprised by the delightful way the tea was served - a nice touch of class. Throughout the hotel any member of staff i came in contact with was both polite and friendly. Back to location - i know on the map it looks a fair walk to St Marc's Square, but i can assure you it is very short. On our first morning we could not believe how quickly we covered the distance. Plus being only 2 Vaporetto stops from St Marc's, either by land or sea this hotel is right in the heart of things. We walked every where from the hotel. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to family and friends, and when I next return to Venice, I will look no further than the treasure that is 'Hotel Ala'.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ala has the service and hospitality of a 5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bebadbubba
Reviews.Content: I am fortunate to be able to frequently stay in 5 star hotels. On a recent trip to Venice I needed to be in the same hotel as a group of photographers with whom I was attending a workshop at Hotel Ala. The exceptional service began as I arrived by water taxi at the hotel's canal entrance in chilly, rainy, blowing weather. I was quickly escorted inside, and my (way too much with photo gear) luggage was immediately taken to my room. Throughout my 10 day stay, my room was immaculately clean, and every special request I made, including booking my water taxi's and numerous concierge services was addressed courteously, enthusiastically, and promply. I can't say enough about the quality of the hotel's service during my stay. To make a 6:45am plane, I had to leave the hotel at 3am, and in my bleary state, I left a small bag of personal gifts for my family. One phone call, an email to confirm, and the hotel promptly FedExed my gifts to me in the US. The hotel location was excellent for us--close enough, but just far away from San Marco Square and the Rialto for some relative quiet during Carnival. My only recommendation for those who visit during Carnival is to request a room that does not adjoin the street or square sides of the hotel--the party goes on all night and the narrow street and small plaza are like a megaphone that makes earplugs worthless. And if the budget permits, enjoy one of the hotel's largest rooms, especially if you are carrying extra luggage or photographic gear. I know it's kinda girlie for a big guy, but the towel warmer in the bathroom was a nice touch. My comments relate to a 10 day period when the hotel was completely full during Carnival, maximizing service challenges for the hotel staff. The people at Hotel Ala are exceptional, and I will undoubtedly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, european charm, close to San Marco Square”
Reviews.Author: kds1227
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay, wonderful european rooms, clean, friendly staff, delicious full breakfast buffet every morning, very short walk to the public water transportation, one boat stop from San Marco Square. Location was also short walk to the Square. Would definitely stay again. Kathy

Reviews.Title: “Good Value with a great location”
Reviews.Author: CTCBear19
Reviews.Content: From the start a great experience. We arrived after an overniight train from Paris around 10 A.M., which is well before the check in time. Our room wasn't ready but we were extended other choices. The person at the desk offered a cup of coffee if we wanted to wait for our room to be ready, really a nice touch. We stayed 5 nights and the staff was accomodating through out our stay. I think our room was a Superior Room. It was spacious (by even American standards) and spotless. Housekeeping was left a generouos tip when we departed. We had a canal side room. We would recommend a room facing the square, you need to lean out to appreciate the canal. Location, location, location. Easy 10 minutes to St. Marks, a little longer to the Rialto, less than 10 to the Accademia and no more than 100 paces to a "bus" stop. This was our 4th trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “The BW Ala in November in a group of 10 women for 2 nights pre-cruise and 1 night post-cruise was an excellent choice.”
Reviews.Author: omatravel
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located with its own pier for water taxis, friendly, helpful staff, and bountiful breakfast madke the Ala a perfect choice. We walked all over Venice in groups of 2, 4, or 6, even alone at all hours of the day and evening and always felt safe. Leisurely walking alog the narrow streets, stopping in beautiful shops, eating gelato, all made for wonderful nursing home memories! I had previously stayed at the AL maybe 10 years ago ad shall stay again o my next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: SashieZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on two ocassions - once with my husband, once with my mother and was happy both times. The price was reasonable, the room although not large by American standards, was fine. I thought the breakfast was great, a large selection with delicious coffee. the location was quiet but close to the major sites including St. Marco's square.

Reviews.Title: “Bug Bites in Room.”
Reviews.Author: dkim76
Reviews.Content: The room was nothing special - kind of run down. However, the worst part of this hotel were the bugs. Both my wife and I ended up with multiple bug bites. There was some sort of mosquito rub on the nightstand, but it didn't work. Gross. Would never stay at this hotel again. (Note - the service at the hotel wasn't bad. They gave us rubber boots to wear, as it was raining in Venice.)

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: MATRAVEL
Reviews.Content: We arrived on December 25, Christmas Day. I had been warned that it would be difficult to find a place to eat on Christmas Day, so I emailed the hotel in advance and asked them to make a reservation for us for dinner. They did, and the restaurant was wonderful and fairly priced. As we walked around that night, there were many open restaraunts, the scare that none would be open was rediculous! The hotel's location was central to all sights around San Marco and very near the vaparetto stop which was very convenient. The room was small, but most in Europe are. The bathroom was modern and again, by European standards, adequate. The internet was slow, and my mini laptop aquired a virus while there. Not a good thing! (I have anti-virus software on it, so not sure how that happened.) The breakfast was good, but the only hot item, eggs, ran our quickly and wasn't replenished. The other offereings were plentiful and we enjoyed it. We discovered after ordering tea in the adjacent 'bar' for 6 Euros per person, that the hotel will send up tea for free to the room. The next day, we did this, but wish I had known before that. The room was clean and faced a small canal. The two big windows had metal shutters that sealed tightly to keep the cold out. It was a bit noisy there as it faced what we found out was a betting place across the canal. Small boats and gondolas passed by with people singing even though it was rather cold. We didn't take a gondola because it was too cold - felt badly for the gondoliers! All in all, I would recommend this hotel, but it is nothing fancy, just the basics. It wasn't elegant as the website had me believe, but it served our purpose and we rested comfortably there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ala - in the centre of touristy Venice”
Reviews.Author: Pathin
Reviews.Content: Our very first stop in Italy. Was very disappointed with size of the room and the bathroom. The nearest vaporetto stop to the hotel - S. Maria del Giglio - was closed on the day of our arrival and that necessitated a long walk over bridges and alleys lugging our baggages. Do check availability of vaporetto services on the day of arrival to avoid such inconveniences. The location is fantastic, St. Mark's Square and the Campanile just about 10 mins walk through shop-lined alleys. This hotel is in the middle of touristy Venice, so expect to pay extra for everything. Having said that , it is also to be noted that its central location makes it convenient to just walk across the canal to Accademia and Santa Maria della Salute and also explore other islands like Lido, Murano, Burano. The breakfast of Hotel Ala is another high point. Extensive selection and very pleasant staff. There is no restaurant in the hotel, so lunch and dinner were not available. However, they had an arrangement with Raffaele Restaurant, just across the square, whereby Ala guests were offered a discounted price. Ala is a hotel to consider when you want to stay in a place with excellent connectivity.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Beachgirl089
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Ala in July as I studied abroad in Florence during that month. As a student, I was looking for a decent place that was on the cheaper side. Hotel Ala was perfect! The hotel/rooms were VERY clean, which is always a must for me. They served an American style breakfast which was great. The staff was very nice and helpful as well. If I was going to be in Venice again, I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: RonJohn777
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Ala. Unfortunately, it rained the entire time we were in Venice (5 days), but the hotel provided us rubber boots to get through the minor flooding in the streets and an umbrella. Location is convenient to Piazza San Marco, La Fenice opera house, St. Mark's Square. San Marco was beautifully lit for Christmas. We got an excellent rate through Travel Zoo. Breakfast at the hotel is awesome. Great selection of meats, cheeses, pastries, plus scrambled eggs, toast and breakfast sausages. Staff is responsive and very helpful. We had a noise problem in the room we were assigned, and were given an upgraded room in the rear (on the canal) that was large and very quiet. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Ala”
Reviews.Author: ZephyrK9
Reviews.Content: I booked at Hotel Ala based on the many reviews I read and was not disappointed. The staff was wonderful. The promptly answered all my emails. The breakfast is excellent. The front desk was very helpful helping me to find a late Mass when I arrived on Sunday. The locations is perfect. Getting to hotel from train station was simple not to mention you get a great tour of the Grand Canal on the way. The rooms are small, but I expected that so wasn't disappointed. I found it comfy and cozy and was quite happy w/ my room. Lovely Murano chandelier. I would recommend this hotel to family/friends and those considering a stay in Venice. I booked online so I received a good deal. Toss the map and just go for it. you can't get lost and if you do,,,hop on water taxi 1 it'll take you right to the hotel. On an unrelated note I highly recommend a hot chocolate at LaVerna in St Marks Sq. you will NOT be disappointed best Euro 1.70 I spent...talk about chocolate coma~mmm. Can't wait to return to Venice and Hotel Ala. Thank you to all who work there for making my stay very pleasant. Enjoyed the sitting parlors.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy In Venice”
Reviews.Author: Notausedscreenname
Reviews.Content: Great location, great Value. Room was much bigger than anticipated. Breakfast was fine, service was good. Internet service was a bit disappointing. Free trip to Murano was a bonus! Would love to stay at Ala again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Honest place to stay (for a 3-star hotel)”
Reviews.Author: vanjacobson
Reviews.Content: Be careful while choosing an Hotel in Venice. They all look fabulous through the Internet but as soon as you take the vaporetto and arrive there, you might get a bit disappointed on what you are getting. This hotel instead is a typical WYSWG - "What you see is what you get". Although not the cheapest 3-star hotel, it certainly won't let you down while searching for a clean place to stay in Venice. Staff is well trained and in good mood to assist customers. Highly recommendable for a couple or small families. (AVOID INTERNET TRAPS SUCH AS HOTEL TORINO -- A STINKY PLACE THAT DO NOT DESERVE YOUR MONEY).

Reviews.Title: “This disappointing hotel is in the Best Western chain.”
Reviews.Author: b25b25
Reviews.Content: In preparation for the trip I read guide books. One of those suggested requesting a room overlooking the canal. Good thought and I followed the advice but: -it was the worst room I have ever been given in all my years of travel - small, narrow (2 people could not pass each other) -mosquito repellant was provided in the room and YES IT WAS NEEDED. I redeamed a substantial number of RBC points for this hotel that was booked through Carlson Wagonlit Travel in BC and the hotel would not accept my Best Western membership card.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: michelle6057
Reviews.Content: My father and I stayed here in November 2010 and would stay again. The staff was professional and pleasant. The room was clean and cozy. The complimentary breakfast selections were plentiful. The location was amazing; easy to find and close to St Marks Square. Overall this is a great value in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “What a Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: padric
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had been to Venice once before for a short visit - now we decided for our anniversary to go for 10 days. We booked a deluxe room at the Hotel Ala, which sits on St Giglio Campo. We had one room overlooking the sq, but decided on a second room with two windows - overlooking the canal that runs past the hotel. Like many hotels in Venice, the room was not large, but we could look down on the canal and bridges and tourists, and watch the gondolas pass by. The staff were very helpful, in suggesting restaurants in the area, making reservations, and giving directions to various sites.. They also serve a full breakfast from cereal to eggs to pastries. The hotel is very centrally located - easy walk to St Marks and the Rialto, and 50 meters from the Grand Canal and the vappareto stop. We also took advantage of the nearby stores to buy some cheese, ham, bread and wine, which we kept in the min-bar. (There is also a roof top terrace to sit, read, and drink wine.) The one down side is that the hotel is on a busy square, so during the day many tourists are coming and going - just keep the windows closed at night to keep the noise out, and you will have a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: aphillytraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location. We were able to walk (without taking a water taxi) to most places, although there was a temporary bridge up while we were there which helped with walking. There is a water taxi stop right next to the hotel so when we neede one, it was convenient). It was a good value for the money. Rooms were small, but manageable. Full breakfast, which was delicious. We were there during a rain storm, and many hotels had flooding in their lobby, but we did not. Front desk was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all round”
Reviews.Author: Helix139
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a perfect position, Room with a view, great bathroom, nice size room, lovely breakfast. Hot chocolate to die for in the bar.....Had a fantastic 4 days in Venice. Thanks Hotel Ala.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Price, Great Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: SmallFamilyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location walkable to Plaza San Marcos via great shopping streets. Accessible even when PSM is flooded. Very short walk to water taxi stop (Giglio). Located on its own quaint plaza. Best Western affiliation provided additional confidence in booking. Rooms were very comfortable and unexpectedly sizable. We booked a three person room (queen + one twin-size bed), and a separate double bed. Staff made certain booked rooms were adjacent. Breakfast included in price was excellent and breakfast room was very pleasant. Staff spoke more English than expected and were very helpful. Our family only regretted that our plans allowed only a one-night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend break in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Nikal
Reviews.Content: Although we got what I would imagine to be one of the smaller rooms it was absolutely fine for us with plenty of storage space and we did get what we requested â€“ a non smoking room on a high floor. The bathroom was a good size with toiletries and a hairdryer. As everyone mentions the breakfast is great and served in a lovely breakfast room that has plenty of tables and enough food to keep you going. As we had a public transport pass we used the vapertto regularly from the Giglio stop just outside the hotel. However there was a notice at the stop to say the stop would be suspended for some time from November 17th â€“ Iâ€™m not sure how long it was going to be suspended for but you may want to check if youâ€™re visiting in the coming weeks. The traghetto stop close to the hotel was also suspended whilst we were there but again Iâ€™m not sure how long for. The location is however within walking distance of most places â€“ on an evening we tended to end up at Campo Santa Margherita where there are lots of bars and although it looks far away on a map, it only seemed to take 5 â€“ 10 minutes to walk back to the hotel. To sum up, I think this hotel is absolutely perfect for a break in Venice. The location is fab, the rooms are adequate and the breakfast is over and above what you expect. I would certainly stay here again next time I visit Venice and would recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah1712
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at Hotel Ala on the basis of the trip adviser recommendations and we weren't disappointed. The location is great - a short walk to St Marks Square past lots of lovely shops and restaurants, and also to Campo San Stefano where is a fantastic restaurant A beccofico. Our superior room was really nice (not the shoebox we were expecting) and it looked out over a canal where we could watch the gondolas go past. Breakfast was also very good, and the staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cslovestravel
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a perfect location. Very beautiful hotel. Right on the water with a pretty view from our window. Walking to all the historic sites is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The Service received was excellent”
Reviews.Author: wendycoota
Reviews.Content: I inadvertently left my medication in my room on check out. When I discovered this two days later, I contacted the Hotel and arranged to have my medication posted to my next destination. I was pleasantly surprised to be greeted with my medication on check-in two days later.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Quasi Good Location”
Reviews.Author: NMonte
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good as far as service is concerned. We had issues meeting up with family when we missed our train from Austria and they contacted the hotel in Austria free of charge to get details. The breakfast was hit and miss. Eggs were sometimes runny and other times cooked through. Boiled eggs were sometimes runny inside the yoke. Very close to the grand canal to pick up the water taxis. Free transportation to Murano and back. Very loud in the courtyard just outside the hotel. Sometimes bad at night.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: torcello123
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Hotel Ala many times. We keep coming back for the location, the familiar and welcoming and helpful staff, the great bar and incredible breakfasts. As others have said on here, the location is great - you can pull up by water taxi to the lobby, or get off and on the vaporetto just down the alley outside the door, or even take a traghetto across the Grand Canal from just across the Campo. Walk to La Fenice in about 2 minutes, or over the Accademia bridge, or to San Marco in about 10. Breakfast is huge and extensive and more than you could want. There is internet in the lobby, or Wi Fi in the room. Rey is always a pleasure to see in the bar, which is frequented by locals and tourists alike. All in all, no complaints, and nothing but praise for this hotel and its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: dlgdjg
Reviews.Content: Ideal location. Walked off the water taxi and travelled 75 meters straight ahead to the Hotel. No bridges to lug suitcases over. Our room was spacious, tucked under the rafters on the fourth floor. King size bed, chaise lounge, sky light that opened, a large Jacuzzi tub and very clean. Beside our room was a staircase to the roof top terrace where you could sit out and gaze over Venice. Breakfast was included with the room; it was plentiful with a variety of items. There was no restaurant on site but there were plenty of eating options in the area. Located within easy walking distance of St. Marks Square and the Accademia. Staff was very helpful and suggested sites to see; hotel provides boat service to Murano for interested guests. Staff arranged water taxi for 6 a.m. to the airport. We were picked up at the door on the canal behind the hotel and travelled the canals in the dark! An all round marvelous stay. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Venetian hotel, friendly courteous staff, perfect location, our favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: caliecat
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently and have found that a useful indication of a good hotel is whether the staff members remain with the hotel for a long time. My husband and I have stayed at the Hotel Ala 15 times, staying from 2 to 7 nights. I have noticed that over that time, junior people have gradually been promoted to senior posts, and receptionists, breakfast room and bar staff, porters, housekeeping, etc have all become familiar figures to us. All are welcoming, friendly, courteous and professional. The hotel will even supply boots to wear when there is the aqua alta. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the rooms are all individually furnished, many with antiques. It is worth paying the extra for a de luxe room (see hotel website) The position of the hotel could not be better, with an entrance directly onto a small canal, allowing for arrival by water taxi - a wonderful way to arrive in Venice from Marco Polo airport!, or the Giglo vaporetto stop is 30yds from the front entrance â€“ very important if you want to avoid pulling your luggage endlessly through the tiny (safe) streets trying to find your hotel! (See maps) The hotel does not have a restaurant but as there are so many very good ones within walking distance this is not a problem and the reception staff have given us suggestions for restaurants which have become regular favourites over the years, these vary in price and style. Of course the reception staff will make reservations, do ask for their advice. The hotel bar is used by locals as well as other tourists which gives a good atmosphere, and the bar has a great selection of wines and other drinks, and can offer cheeses, salamis etc. There are two suggestions we would make if it is your first visit to Venice â€“1. Make your first sight of St Markâ€™s Square at about 11 at night; you will have it to yourselves. 2. Save up and take a gondola late at night from the hotel steps. You will be taken through the small dark silent canals then out onto the almost empty Grand Canal. Completely magical! Again, the reception staff can arrange this. I hope anyone reading this and visiting Hotel Ala with come to love it as much as we do.

Reviews.Title: “Location, convenience and a great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: svwriter2
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Hotel Ala is in the San Marco district of Venice, close to St. Mark's Square and ideal for enjoying the "real" Venice, the city after the day trippers leave. Located on a quiet square, it is five or ten minutes to the historic St. Mark's, via picturesque canals and gondolas. The rooms are each slightly different, ours opened to an interior courtyard. Some open to a canal view. The breakfast surpassed expectations, featuring ham, eggs, fruit, pastries and more.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ala - A Gem in Venice. Wow!”
Reviews.Author: coach4
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with Hotel Ala! Having worked our way up from Rome we had already had satisfactory to very good stays in a few 3 Star hotels. This hotel sets the benchmark in my mind as it proved to be an excellent place and a very good value.. We arrived via a side canal and were helped off the water taxi into an attractive lobby where we were looked after right away. When the porter let us into our room and opened the shutters onto a canal we went wow! The room was very spacious with attractive antique style furniture. The bathroom was huge compared to what we had become used to, it even had a jetted tub. Our bed was very comfortable. Our friend had an equally attractive room overlooking a small square. The breakfast buffet was excellent. There was a variety of: fresh fruit and juice; meats and cheeses; bread, rolls, cereal and pastries; eggs and tea and coffee. All served in an attractive breakfast room. What else could one look for. Location of course is very important and Hotel Ala is very well situated being only a short 5 minute walk to St. Mark's Square. In the other direction I would say we were not much further to the Academia Bridge. Full marks again! We noticed many travelers hauling their bags around obviously looking for their hotel. Given the interesting design of Venice's streets and canals I suspect that some are still out there. The hotel set up hostess service for us and we were greeted at the train station by a very welcoming young lady. If you were inclined to find your own way this hotel would be fairly easy to find being close to the Giglio stop from Vaporetto #1. We were also pleased with the front desk service. On arrival they mentioned a free trip to Murano. Yes I know the motivation but as the ladies wanted to go there anyway off we went. It was very pleasant and the glass blowing demonstration by the masters was neat. The showroom was stocked with beautiful but expensive glasswork, our guide was informative but soft sell so it all went well. When we finished the boat for the return trip was ready to go and back we went. The front desk also suggested a Vivaldi concert at a nearby church, it was excellent. Go at least a half hour early the church was packed. Surely there must be some negatives. Not really the Hotel Ala was impressive in every way. The only nitpick I would have is with the restaurant they suggested, the Da Rafaelle. It was truly awful, snooty service, poor food and over priced. Hotel Ala is a gem, it would be a mistake for them to send customers to this restaurant under any circumstances. Trust your guidebooks like Fodors and Rick Steves for independent restaurant recommendations. On a final note the hotel has basically free wifi internet service and a very nice lobby bar with a mixture of tourists and locals. The Hotel Ala was without a doubt the best hotel we stayed in. We experienced great accomodation, superior location, friendly service and value. If you are traveling to Venice this is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 Star & Location”
Reviews.Author: PETOC
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and room was fab for a 3 star we did have a delux non refundable room but we booked early enough and got a good deal. Very easy to find the hotel from San Marco waterbus stop from the airport, just keep the water on your left and the hotel is only 15 mins walk from the boat. Breakfast was very good, very good to have the breakfast served until 10:45. Would book this hotel again if returning to Venice again on a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ala has great location, friendly and helpful staff, and great buffet breakfast .”
Reviews.Author: Gardencook
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Ala for 4 nights and were very pleased with the location, the clean and comfortable room, and the friendly and helpful staff. The Hotel is just a short walk( with no stairs) from the Vaporetto stop just before Saint Marco -- just walk up the small street to directly in front of the hotel. Easy walk to the square or the Academia. The buffet breakfast was great. We stayed here in 2008 for 2 nights and were happy that we were able to return.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Venice for value and location!”
Reviews.Author: willowwood65
Reviews.Content: The easy accessibility from the airport by water taxi to the door of the hotel was a plus. Staff were very accommodating and the check in was speedy. This was much appreciated after an overnight flight from Canada. The location of the hotel was fabulous. Walking distance to everything important. Breakfast was ample and varied. Everyone was very friendly and helpful with directions. Would definitely use this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: billd10
Reviews.Content: Located near St. Mark's Square, the location was quiet & convenient, with an excellent breakfast, a clean (but small) room which was tastefully decorated, and was air conditioned. The hotel has a nice bar attached with very nice quality liquors and wine available. Staff seemed very professional. St. Stephen's Square, a source of more moderately priced restaurants is nearby. The bedding was firm and quite comfortable. We loved our stay in Venice and would recommend Hotel Ala highly. It was also convenient to make our reservation on the Best Western website. All hotels in Venice are pricey, but we thought our room rate was fair (we booked months in advance, however.)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, clean, large, airy room, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: woodynwoody
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ala was a fabulous find. Less than 5 minute walk from St. Markâ€™s Square and easily accessible by water bus (Giglio, stop 13), we couldnâ€™t believe how centrally located from all the sights we were. Per usual, we had checked the hotelâ€™s review on tripadvisor and found that it would be best to ask for a room on the top floor, asking for a view of the square or canal, depending on preference. We asked for a room of the canal, and were not disappointed. Room 308 is a large, well appointed, airy, two large shuttered windowed, classically decorated room. People say the canals in Venice can smell; however, our experience was that they did not. Many of the gondolaâ€™s use the canal as their tour route, and we greatly enjoyed the free entertainment it provided. The breakfast served is excellent, including hot eggs. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Wifi has a cost of 5 Euro for the first 24 hours, than free for the balance of your stay. There is a beautiful rooftop patio that guests can enjoy a coffee on. Hotel Ala definitely helped make our visit to Venice and we will not consider staying anywhere else when we return to Venice in the future. Clean, great location, a fabulous large room and good value made Hotel Ala our best hotel stay in our multi-European city vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: DBuck76
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with small but clean room. Wonderful breakfast included. Location was excellent 60 yard from vaporetto stop and 5 minutes from St. Mark's. 15 - 20 minutes (including photo stops) fro Rialto bridge. Dee & Dale Buck Wilmington, NC, USA

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ala was a great experience, 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: blancheg36
Reviews.Content: Picking a hotel in Venice was a roll of the dice. But picking the Best Western Hotel Ala was a big winner. Hotel is great. Beautiful place, great service. Breakfast was terrific. The American Bar was a pleasant surprise; good place to end a busy day.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: stephen4444
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay at the Hotel Ala based on Trip Advisor reviews, and man were they right on. The location is great and very easy to get to by Venice standards. Just a short walk to all the major sites also helps, but the friendly staff and clean rooms makes the difference here. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great Hotel for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: renamason
Reviews.Content: A group of 12 family and friends stayed here. Everyone was so friendly and location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: happy_traveller_dw
Reviews.Content: Arrived at noon on 30th Sept. I was pleasantly surprised to discover a room was already available for me to take, even though it was a couple of hours before official check-in time. The big seller for this hotel is its location - under 5 mins walk to San Marco Piazzo, and you really do feel "right on the centre" of everything. Water buses are also easily accessable to the airport from either San Marco or San Angelo water bus lines. The room itself was a decent size (for Venice).. It was also clean, although the and the bathroom could do with a makeover, it was perfectly adequate. The big plus for this hotel was the staff -I found them all to be really helpful and friendly... For example, we overslept for breakfast on the first morning, due a very early start the day before - The hotel prompt arranged for cappucino's and croissants brought out to us in the sitting area instead. Little touches like that really helped to enhance our stay. The bar within the hotel is one of the better places to enjoy a evening drink as well. It does cater mainly for Americans, but that is no great surprise seen as it is part of the Best Western franchise, and hence is popular with US tourists. Overall, big thumbs up for hotel location and friendliness of staff. You could find more luxurious hotel rooms in Venice - but you will pay a lot more, especially in such a location.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Venice! Great value!”
Reviews.Author: OliaRussianLady
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights on the 30th of September. In the room nr 350. Standard double room on the third floor. Windows of this hotel face the canal. The staff was very helpfull and the breakfast was great. We stayed in Venice many times but this was the best hotel so far. I will definetely recommend it to everyone! Olia and Mike

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Sherpa836
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for what we wanted. Within a shrt walking distance to all 10 of the main recommended sites. The hotel staff were polite and extremely helpfull at all times. Our rooms was comfortably furnished, with a balcony over look a side canal. The bathroom was well equiped and spotless. The buffet breakfast was fine, a good variety of hot and cold foods, a great selection of teas, coffee and juices, certainly enough to keep you going enough to keep you going during the day. There is no restaurant, but within 100 yards by turning left out of the hotel entrance and walking over the two bridges there are a number of reasonably priced restaurants, frequented by locals and touriusts alike. There is great themed comfortable bar at the hotel. The staff are friendly, polite and knowledgeable. Drinks are a little pricey, but still a great place to collapse and enjoy a relaxing night cap. We decided to catch the frequently run ATVO bus from airport into Piazzale Roma (3 euros each) which was an excellent decision as the comfortable journy took just 20 minutes. From the Piazzale Roma we took the Water bus No1 route direct to the Giglio stop. The Hotel is 50 yards up the alleyway...simple. We purchased a weekly Water bus ticket (50 euros) which turned out to be a brilliant investment........we certainly got our money's worth over the next 5 days. A big thank you to the Hotel Ala for giving us a comfortable and relaxing holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Even Better Service”
Reviews.Author: MotownMJM
Reviews.Content: This was the first of our stops for our Italian honeymoon - what a way to start! I requested through e-mail a room with a hotel view and a jacuzzi, and they delivered. We listened to gondolas ride by all evening, often sitting on the small balcony with a glass of Prosecco, waving to the tourists below. The service was second to none - all spoke great English, and did not hesitate to get on the phone and make restaurant or tour reservations for us. They also recommended restaurants, listening to what we wanted and suggesting great options. Breakfast every morning was amazing as well - a great way to start the day. I would definitely stay there again if I returned to Venice. One recommendation - figure out the right water taxi stop before you arrive. We showed up with our heavy luggage to St. Mark's Square and had to ask around on how to find the hotel - ended up walking it for 15 minutes, when had we known where to go, we could have been dropped off with a 1-minute walk to the hotel. Thank you, Hotel Ala, for the perfect start to our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: mrhappy53
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just what we wanted central to all main sites. The hotel was very clean the staff were very helpfull at all times of the day, we asked where we could get a coffee one afternoon as the bar was closed, they said they would bring some to our room free of charge. Rooms are comfotable bathroom a little small but did not cause a problem, Breakfast was fine, enough to keep you going for most of the day ( you will need it as it very expensive to eat any where there ). Eating out, soup costs around 13 to 18 euros, pizzas 9 to 16 euros for a margaretta (not sure how to spell it) ,small bottle of local beer around 5.50 euros. Getting to and from airport / hotel is very easy with out having to pay a fortune for a water taxi ( if you use one always ask price before boarding) bus to piazzale roma Venice 3 euros, line 1 water bus from piazzale roma to hotel, 6.50 euros ( from airport to hotel takes around 40 to 50 mins ) all part of holiday. Watch prices for Gondolas, the first one we went to wanted 150 euros for fourty mins for 2 people. Venice is very nice, Doge's palace is a must. Go get lost and have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we chose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doc21144
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel on the recommendation of our travel agent, even though she'd also recommended a four star property. SO glad we did. The staff was immensely friendly and helpful, the location was ideal, with just a short block to the vaporetti. Our rooms (we also traveled with our 28 year old daughter, who had a single) overlooked a canal, and as soon as we opened our windows we looked out at 3 gondolas drifting by. The breakfast was fabulous--to call it a buffet does not do it justice. (The scrambled eggs were divine--no small feat for the large dishes of them found on buffets. Amazing.) The variety was wonderful, and as we got up every morning to go out by 6:30 to take pictures its availability was appreciated--there are almost no options at that time of day. The beds were hard, which didn't affect my sleep but bothered my daughter. The room was very clean, and the bathroom was surprisingly roomy and well outfitted. I would absolutely stay here again--and hope to.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need for a perfect stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: ItalyWithFriendsTour
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ala is my preferred hotel for my small group tours - Italy With Friends Tours. The location is superb, only a few minutes to St. Mark's Square. They are located on a small canal with their own entry dock. They are also just steps away from the water taxi stop. In a town known for hard to find hotels, Hotel Ala is very easy to locate. The staff is very helpful and always available. Any special requests that I make for my tour members, such as nonsmoking rooms, are always arranged if possible. The rooms are very comfortable, clean and have lovely Venetian details. A/C works great in the hot summer. If you are lucky enough to have a canal view, you might even get to hear a Gondolier singing as they float by. It is a Best Western property and booking is very easy. They even have ice machines! They do not have a restaurant on site, but are affiliated with Da Raffaele located nearby and very good. I always get rave reviews from all of my tour members and highly recommend Hotel Ala to other friends and family. I do not think I could find another hotel of this caliber at such a great value in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “NIce oasis in a very crowded, loud city”
Reviews.Author: TCPort
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ala is a quiet, hidden gem in close proximity to most sights in Venice. Located on a quiet square, the hotel is situated a short one minute walk to the Santa Maria del Giglio waterbus stop (Vaperetto line 1). It is also a 10 minute walk to St Mark's square or the Rialto Bridge. Althought the rooms are small, they are well appointed, clean, quiet, charming, and are very well maintained. The staff is helpful and willing to attend to you every need. Tis is a hidden gem and qould reccommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: JaneMLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a wedding anniversary trip. Proximity to both St Mark's Square and the Accademia Bridge is excellent. A couple of minutes from the Giglio water bus stop on line 1 on the Grand Canal. Hotel quiet despite being on a square. Our room looked out over a canal - in standard rooms these are allocated on a 1st come 1st served basis so we were lucky. Room was spacious and clean, bed comfortable and bathroom fine, if a little cramped for my husband (he is tall). Nothing you could do about that as it is an old building. Partial lift service - also because an old building. Buffet breakfast very good. Staff friendly. Good internet price - a one off charge, then free. There is a bar - beer is expensive (even by Venetian standards) but wine was standard price. We got a good room deal because we booked a almost a year in advance and paid for it when we booked. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Ah, Venice!”
Reviews.Author: BeWhereBondHasBeen
Reviews.Content: A superbly good value hotel, particularly considering the location (5 minutes from San Marco, right next to vaparetto stop). I e-mailed ahead and asked if a canal view would be possible and, even though I chose not to upgrade our room, they accommodated our needs anyway. We heard gondolas going to and fro at all times of the day - very romantic. The roof terrace is good for lounging with a book and a cheap half litre of wine (available in the excellent hotel bar or from one of the handy shops in the streets to the west the hotel, just a couple of minutes away). The cleanliness of our room was also faultless. Breakfasts were varied and filling. Well done Hotel Ala! Try the offer codes on their website for some great extras, like free breakfast, wi-fi, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, morning reception staff very helpful, will return”
Reviews.Author: DodgerEric
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night from the 8th to 9th August, very convenient for water taxi drop off and collection. The reception and front of house staff when we arrived in the morning were wonderful, very polite and extremely helpful, making us feel at home instantly and again the same staff were there the following morning of our departure, with the same degree of friendliness, they arranged for our water taxi to come to the actual hotel. Great location as only a few mins walk to San Marco etc. Our bedroom was big and comfy with an oldie worldie feel and character, very clean too, as was the rest of the communal rooms at the hotel. Breakfast was lovely with a great selection. I would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room in a great location, best hotel breakfast in Italy”
Reviews.Author: sanmarco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ala the first 3 nights of our honeymoon, and it was a really nice welcome to Italy. The location is unbeatable, just a short walk from Piazza San Marco and really close to the Vaporetto stop. We had a standard double room. It was nice, but tiny...not unusual for Venice on a budget. Outside our window was one of the canals, with gondolas going by with an occasional accordion player / singer on board, lending some great ambience. The big hit was the breakfast, compared to other places in Italy where you get the standard croissant and coffee. This one had pastries, eggs, prosciutto, more pastries, fruit, yogurt, coffee, juice, etc. All in all, a great stay, and an outstanding location.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Greatest”
Reviews.Author: dizzle123
Reviews.Content: I don't know if it is just the fact that Venice is expensive, but I expected a lot more for the price we paid. Our room was quite dated. It appeared like the carpet was from the 1970's and had never been properly cleaned. The bathrooms faucets barely worked. The staff was really nice though. The location is good too. And the WiFi was a plus

Reviews.Title: “an excellent hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: cruiser105a
Reviews.Content: very good location with very helpful staff. within easy reach of St Marks square and via private water taxi to cruise terminal. V gd quality breakfast included. Would definitely stay again. upgraded room very beautiful with gondalas passing under window.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service at Hotel Ala Venice”
Reviews.Author: Tal050
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near Piaza st. Marks, the rooms are nice, breakfast is exallent and the service is outstanding!!! We were 14 family members and we took 7 rooms for 1 night in this charming hotel, before cruising from Venice to Greek Islands. The hotel staff treated us so nice, much better than other hotels in Venice where we used to stay in the past. after we sailed away we found out that we forgot a baby blanket in our hotel room - they found our staff, kept it for us and agreed to sent it back to our country.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location,lovely hotel,fantastic breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: Vastomole
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel many, many times, and am rarely disappointed with it. This visit was everything I expected it to be. The hotel is always clean, the staff friendly and the breakfast is superb, with a choice of fresh croissants, scrambled eggs, fresh fruit, cakes, fruit tart, toast and jam, cheeses and ham, yoghurt, cereals etc. there is something for everyone. Most Italian hotels only provide a bread roll (frozen!) and tea or coffee. This is almost always what you will get in Venice at any other 3 or even 4 star hotel. The rooms are varied in size due to the nature of the ancient buildings, and you generally get what you pay for. The bonus of this hotel is that it does have a lift, which again, most in Venice don't. Some rooms overlook small canals, and are worth paying the extra for if you can as it's a main Gondola route, and you can hear them drifting past and singing. (Thank you Silvia, for the upgrade!) Check prices on the ala direct website for good deals, we payed â‚¬80 in August on a special offer. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel during our Europe trip!”
Reviews.Author: jfaulk25
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ala is an amazing hotel!! The staff was excellent and they upgraded us to a beautiful room with a cute little balcony over the canal. We spent many nights on the balcony watching the gondola's and drinking cheap wine and bellinis!! The area is perfect in Venice which is a short walk from the waterbus. The area is excellent and close to most of the major attraction. The breakfast was excellent. In summary, the hotel is in a great location, great price, staff was great and the rooms are amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice clean rooms, very good breakfast and amazing helpful staff and manager”
Reviews.Author: Chamina
Reviews.Content: Stayed almost two weeks at the Hotel Ala as I was working in Venice. It is a great hotel. Amazing Location, easy to find, close to Vaporetto Line 1 (Giglio). Nice clean rooms, very good breakfast, nice and helpful staff and a wonderful manager! Would recommend it to everyone whether for leisure or on business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmandaLenhart
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and comfortable. It is pretty close to St. Marc's, and close to the water bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: Momsterof4
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel! We took the train from Florence to Venice--you exit the train station and you are directly on the Grand Canal. Take the #1 Vaporetto to the Giglio stop and you are less than 50 yards from the hotel! Plus, you just got a tour down the Grand Canal! The hotel itself is in the cutest little square. The decor is like a small, medieval museum. There is also a small bar just off the lobby. The rooms are very small but comfortable. There is "free" internet (they ask for a 2 euro donation to give you the password.) Everything is very clean. Breakfast is the best in Italy. Very good--huge selection including scrambled eggs which were excellent. Large variety of pastries, breads, fruits, meats, juices--I can't think of anything they were lacking. Really good. It runs from 7 am to 10:45 am, too. The staff was very polite. They were not kind or welcoming at all, but at least they were never rude. I think this is to be expected with large chain hotels versus family run hotels. They did provide us with good restaurant recommendations and arranged our taxi to the airport for us. (It picks up right at the hotel, too!! BONUS!) Avoid the "free" boat ride if you are offered one--unless you are truly interested in purchasing Murano glass. I was duped by the hotel staff on this one and I did not think it was very nice of them. (I know, stupid on my part!!) We were offered a free boat ride, which we accepted. It was on a water taxi and it was very nice. We were taken directly to a glass factory on the island of Murano. The glass blowing exhibit was good and the showroom was filled with beautiful, very highly priced items. We didn't purchase anything and had to wait quite awhile before a taxi arrived to take us back. We didn't have much time in Venice, so we resented having to spend it waiting around for a return trip. But, if you are interested in touring one of the glass factories, this is a great way to do it--I just wish the staff had been honest about the purpose of the boat ride. NOTHING IS FREE IN VENICE--AND EVERYTHING HAS AN "ANGLE". Overall I would recommend this hotel--and the location is wonderful--just a few minutes from St. Mark's square, but in a very quiet square.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: AnnieWindsor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ala for four days. oi chose it because of the great reviews and wasn't disappointed. The room was beautiful and spotlessly clean. the breakfast was amazing and the staff quickly refilled empty choices. The location was quiet but so close to everything. Venice is a beautiful city and we did not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to find - brilliant location- outstanding breakfast”
Reviews.Author: stanist
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ala is very well appointed and in the heat of summer was cool and welcoming. Easy to find take vaporetta Line 1 and get off at Gigolo stop 13. Then walk about 70 metres down a little alleyway and you are there! A great relief. Our children (17 and 10) shared a twin room and it was much larger than our double. The rooms were very clean and neat and cool. The breakfast was a standout - the best we've ever had and we rarely needed lunch! Highly recommended, tho some double rooms are small.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, unbelievable breakfast, super value!”
Reviews.Author: nansf
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ala has it all--one block from vaporetto stop, great location near major sights, nice rooms, some historical touches, and a breakfast to, shall I say, die for? Fancy pastries including a beautiful fruit tart,, cheeses, delicious fruits, proscuitto and other hams, plus regular items. First quality food-- and included in the room price. This is the deal of the century. I would recommend Ala to anyone. Very quiet too!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location, service”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel1000
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. We spent 2 nights here out of a 17 day trip. Upon arrival we bought 3 day vaporetto tickets. Hopped on the number one vaporetto route and got off at the Santa Maria Giglio stop. I think it is just Giglio on the sign. The hotel is located 50 meters in a straight line from the stop so it is easy to pull you luggage to. It is on a small piazza with a nice restaurant (little expensive) and a church. Only about a block walk to St Mark's plaza. It is very near the main shopping area. Since we were so near the vaporetto stop we jumped on and off all the time to get to where we wanted to go. Aside from an ideal location the price was reasonable, breakfast good, someone was always at the desk to give recommendations or make reservations, and the rooms were small but nice. It is located beside a very small canal. They arranged for us to get a complimentary trip to Murano to see the glass blowing. You just step out the door onto the boat. It is a sales pitch and once they decide you are not going to buy it is obvious that they are ready for you to leave but it is a free ride and interesting to watch the glass being blown.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay and close to everything! Loved this place..can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: TrixieAustin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Nov of 09. I found them online using Tripadvisor as I do all our hotels and oh what a lovely surprise. The staff was courteous and our room was very spacious and clean. We faced the front with a courtyard below and right outside the front door you can walk to the vaparetto. We took a private water taxi to our hotel and they dropped us right off at the door!! Just up the way is Saint Mark's square not very far at all (three city blocks maybe)... we just stumbled upon it taking the street out the front door of the hotel. Tons of shops and places to eat although a lot of the places seem to shut down early as most of the city. The bar at the hotel was great as well as the breakfast. I would def recommend this hotel and we look forward to going back. They also had wi fi for two euros and I had no problem getting on. Can't wait to go back. Venice is a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingLibrarian11
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! It is clean, well located, and inexpensive. The hotel staff are pleasant, and the breakfast buffet was excellent. I highly recommend the Hotel Ala.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further”
Reviews.Author: short_stack101
Reviews.Content: This is was the best hotel I stayed at during my 3 weeks in Italy. Perfectly located - easy to get to by Vaporetto; 5 minute walk to St. Mark's square. Good size single room (by European standards), great staff, wonferful bar, good breakfast. Mostly importantly, the hotel and room were well air-conditioned - a must for the hot and muggy climate in July. And the "pay in advance" room rate I got via the internet was dirt cheap. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, and great value”
Reviews.Author: Mayatravels
Reviews.Content: The Ala Hotel in Venice was a great find. Located minutes from San Marco Square, easy access to the Grand Canal (and the vaporettos), and extremely helpful front desk. Rooms are comfortable and there is even a quad for families. Breakfast is delicious including Italian tarts and croissants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Great value”
Reviews.Author: PTelan
Reviews.Content: The word "value" can carry with it a connotation of being undesireable or cheap, but not in this instance. This hotel is a wonderful botique hotel in the heart of Venice. I use the term "value" to mean that, while it is not cheap by any means, I felt like the location, service, and size of the room made me feel like I was actually getting a good deal. We travelled to Venice from Orlando with 2 teenage kids (14 and 11) and could not have been more pleased with this hotel. The staff was very friendly and made reservations for us at a few very good local places to eat. I would suggest getting lost in the side alleys of the Jewish Ghetto and then going into a restaraunt where you hear only Italian being spoken. Our kids loved the sights (Rialto Bridge, St. Marks Square etc) but will never forget the wonderful experience of getting lost in Venice! Don't bother taking the tour to Murano as the salesmen in the glass factory make used car dealers in the U.S. look like wall flowers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TheHappyCouple92
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here before catching a cruise ship. Location could not be bettered at the price. Room had adequate space for a double and a single bed (two adults and one teenager). Staff were friendly and efficient. Continental breakfast was fine. Water taxis can pick you up at the back door - greetings to June and Joss who shared a taxi with us to the cruise terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, located in Venice as you dream off. Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: martina73Ireland
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, staff were lovely and very helpful. Located in a smallish piazza with a stunning church right beside it, so near varopetto stop, couldn't quite believe it. Walking distance to everywhere.Breakfast was fantastic, the air conditioning was super and such a relief to come back to after a long day exploring the intricit streets and wonderful sights of Venice. Double room was lovely with view out to canals. Only one complaint, we had to book a single room for first night because of change of booking and availability, it was way to small, but thats the only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: KHenry2010
Reviews.Content: The Good-great location, easy to find and central to most everything you want to do. The Bad-the cleaning woman twice (not once!) put and left our toiletry kit in the bidet!!!! How gross is that and what was she thinking?! The Ugly-it's catered to Americans. If you can get past The Bad and Ugly, then it's a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: BangkokLisa
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Venice and had no trouble finding our way to the hotel. The hotel gave us clear directions and tips on how to get to the hotel which has such an easy access with a vaporetto stop just steps away and practially, 5 min walk from San Marco Square, San Stefano Square - basically, the centre to everywhere - and yet on a quiet side. The Front Desk staff was always polite and helpful. We were given a Deluxe Room which has a lovely small balcony overlooking the side canal. The room was of good size - simple (decorated Venetian style) and clean. The bathroom was spacious and nicely equipped with a jacuzzi bath, shower, hairdryer - quite impressive for a 3-star superior. Everything works. Efficient daily housekeeping service that our room was always done when we came back before heading out to dinner. Every morning we looked forward to enjoying their breakfast which offers excellent choices of cold cuts, breads, teas/coffee (even hot chocolate!), fruits and yoghurt. Anything and everything! We have thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: JacobDB
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful rooms with amazing antiques. Water front back door, boat drove right up to it. 5 minute walk from Piazza San Marco. Very good all round hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with a superb location...”
Reviews.Author: DaneNWUk
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with a superb location. Lots of designer shops around, right in the heart of Venezia. Rooms were a little small but in these old buildings in Venice that's par for the course. Nicely presented and immaculately clean with a lovely and surprisingly sized bathroom. Air conditioning in the room almost silent but kept us at a nice cool temperature. Excellent breakfast massive choice all fresh and tasty would highly recommend trying the assortment of ham and salami. Overall highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Our Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: nicholasarcomano
Reviews.Content: The ALA has become our home away from home! What makes it so special is not only its location -- it is picturesque Campo Santa Maria del Giglio -- close to the vaporetto stop, the traghetto (a gondola) across the Grand Canal to Dorsoduro and to Saint Mark's, the Fenice Theatre -- and its unique character! -- a wonderful, friendly, caring staff. The concergi (Mareno, Fabbio, Alessandro, the two Stefanos and Luca) and all of the guys know about everything -- and owner/manager, Andrea Salmaso, who is one of the most thoughtful, kindest persons whom we have met in our travels through the years. He and his assistant, Silvia, are true gems! Now for some specifics -- let's start with the buffet breakfast. It is a feast and will keep you going for hours. Katja, Liana, Eleanora (and Alessandro and Farid) keep everything running smoothly! They are just great! When it rains, the hotel staff provides you with an umbrella and when acqua (the high water) alta arrives, a pair of boots. Nothing is overlooked. And their restaurant recommendations are excellent -- the family run, Al Bacareto has become a favorite. Then there is Tarnowska's -- a relaxing lounge with super hosts: Rey and Domenico -- where one can have a prosecco or an espresso, tea (they also serve a caprese salad and toast -- ham and cheese) after a day of sightseeing -- and there is so much to see in Venice. Walk and get lost and find your way back -- yes, there are tons of tourists -- but sometimes you must drift apart and find the serenity and mysterious beauty that only Venice has! Tarnowska's also has on-going art exhibits -- culture is indiginous to the Venetians. One doesn't need health clubs or pools -- just walk over the endless bridges and exercise your mind, body and soul! Our lovely room -- under the care of the lovely Yolanda -- with all the amenities for comfort (tub, shower, safe, mini-bar, air-conditioning, desk) faced the Campo and in the early morning -- when one opens the green shutters -- it seems as though a mini-operetta is taking place right before your eyes -- as the Campo comes to life -- the church bells ring, the kiosk opens, the t-shirt stall rolls in, the water colorist sets up his easel, the Venetians are walking to work with the grace that they alone bring to walking. It is an art in motion -- this sense of being Venetian. And in the evening, when you return to your room, sometimes, if you are lucky you will hear the voice of an angel singing in the Campo. On the Campo, there is the Church, the classy Ristorante del Giglio (don't miss it), a glass shop, a gllery, a textile boutique, an antique print shop and over on one bridge is the ALA's Ristorante da Raffaele -- run by Renato Salmaso -- it is on a canal and the gondolas float by as one dines al fesco on fine food in the soft and sensuous moonlight -- bliss! We have stayed at the ALA many times -- our last visit was for a month in May -- and we felt as though we were actually living in Venice. It can't get better than that! Our reflections are there somewhere, and I like to think they always will be!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous breakfast, helpful staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: marig48
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was amazing; besides meat, cheese, various egg choices, there were a number of delicious cakes. My single room was attractive. It even had a small balcony overlooking a small canal, unexpected for a single room. The location couldn't be better: a short block to vaparetto, close to both San Marco and the Accademia bridge. Staff was warm and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at the Hotel Ala!”
Reviews.Author: PalmettoMel
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise it was to find that our hotel was right off the vaporetto stop! This after struggling with large suitcases (we were at the end of a 6-week stay in Italy) on the train and vaporetto. Our room had a balcony on a small canal and we were happily serenaded by gondola singers on several occasions. Magical. It was very quiet at night. The room itself was comfortable and clean, if small, and the bathroom spotless, well-lit and with a large tub-shower. I just wish European beds were softer -- my poor aching hips! The location is ideal, as others have already mentioned. The breakfast was amazing! They served a fruit tart worthy of dessert and good coffee (thank you!), plus pastries, meats, cheeses, yogurt, eggs, juices, etc. A great start to the day. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, arranging a gondola ride for the two of us that we immensely enjoyed. We tried the bar in the hotel, but after waiting 20 minutes with no response (after my husband went up and asked for service) we left. But it certainly didn't spoil our impression of the hotel and we hope to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: LovestoTravel919
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect location in Venice. It is right off boat line 1, Santa Maria del Giglio stop (2nd to last stop before St. Marks Square). You get off the boat, walk down the little alley and the hotel is right there! No searching or walking a long way with luggage trying to find your hotel. St Marks Square is just a short walk down the walkway with the high fashion shops. So close but not right in the noisy center. I have a friend who went the week before me and stayed right off of St. Marks Square. She complained that it was so noisy all night that they could not sleep. The service at ALA was extremely friendly. We took advantage of the free boat trip and tour to Murano glass factory. (They would like you to buy something of course, but there was no pressure - prices are very high but very beautiful one of a kind pieces. We were tempted but got away with just a necklace). Breakfast was very good. Typical of the other Best Western's we stayed at in Italy on this trip and Euorpe in general on other trips. We have such good luck with Best Westerns, we stay there whenever we can and plan to use them on our future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: ashwood2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel ALA three times. My stay there was alway a pleasure. Get a room overlooking the canal very enchanting. Looking forward to another stay at the ALA.

Reviews.Title: “Location, quality, and service-- all excellent!”
Reviews.Author: jsnadler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ala is a 3 star superior hotel with a superior staff, and medium size comforatble rooms, very nice bathrooms, and a good location. In a city where prices are the highest in Italy, the hotel offered value for the money, and an excellent location. If I were to rate this hotel, I would recomment it to any traveler wanting good quality and not wanting to pay the 500+ euros per night of some of the 4 and 5 star hotels. A definite "best buy"!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: brooklyn24
Reviews.Content: we were traveling through venice and only staying for one night. we usually opt for more bed and breakfast type hotels, but because we were only going to be there for one night, we didn't have any luck finding one- most required a 2-night minimum stay. we booked this hotel through orbitz. The staff was very nice and welcoming. our room was not ready when we arrived so we came back around Noon and they had a room ready for us on the first floor. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was very small- and a little hard to get around in. But it suited us fine for the amount of time we were there. When we opened our windows there was a bridge right outside our window and lots of people walking right by. So we had to keep our shades shut all of the time. The location is great- it was very easy to get to St Mark's Square, the Rialto Bridge and the Accademia Bridge. It was very easy to take the main vaparetto and get dropped off literally a block from our hotel. This saved us a lot of money- taking a private water taxi would have been about $70 more. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Met all our expectations - and a bit more”
Reviews.Author: PatandPete96
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was very good with lots of choice and was constantly topped up. Our superior room (496) on the top floor was large and comfortable, and looked out over rooftops. We had a fault with our hairdryer which was fixed immediately we reported it. The only drawback was that the lift stopped at the floor below and the stone stairs up to our floor were quite steep. However, a very efficient porter carried our luggage up to the room. The hotel was located in a quiet square not far from St Mark's Square, ideal for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: flrose
Reviews.Content: We selected the Hotel Ala because of its location in Venice. We took a private water taxi from the cruise terminal which brought us directly to the hotel back door off a small canal. Since it was early, our room wasn't ready, so the desk staff said we could leave our bags in the lobby safely. We weren't pleased with that arrangement, but we were strongly assured that they would be watched. Right or wrong, we trusted them and went out to explore. We discovered how perfectly located the hotel is...just minutes from St Marks...right on a Vaporetto stop...and close to a pre-arranged gondola ride pick up point. The breakfast included with the rate was very nice indeed. Lots of cold selections, croissants, cereals, fruit etc. There were also delicious scrambled eggs...certainly enough to start a full day of touring. Please be aware that the hotel description does say there is an elevator...but what it doesn't say, is that if you are in the older section you must walk up a full flight of marble steps to get to the elevator. That being said, the bell staff were amazing, they did carry the bags to the second floor elevator. The rooms were small but comfortable, the bathrooms well equipped. Each room has a safe which makes it very convenient. For 2 euros per 24 hour period, the wireless internet connection was fast and trouble free. The only problem was using the computer in the hotel lobby to print out boarding passes for our flight home...the printer was jammed but one of the hotel desk people cheerfully fixed it!!! We had a very enjoyable stay at Hotel Ala.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoDoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Ala for two nights and were very pleased. The hotel is in a great location, only a 5 to 10 minute from St. Marks Square on a bustling pedestrian walkway with great shops. Restaurants, shops, trattorias, coffee shops, gelaterias are all close. To get to the hotel from the train station was a piece of cake. We took the vaporetta down the Grand Canal to the appointed stop, hopped off, walked about 100 feet down a very narrow alley, right to the front door of the hotel which is on a small square. Everything is close. For the price, it's a great location. But, be warned, to get a nice sized room, you need to chose a superior room.
