They are bigger than normal and very comfortable and, in our opinion, worth the extra money -- our room was located on a small canal. It was very quiet and the dark-out shades worked great. We could open the windows and watch the gondolas paddling by and enjoyed being serenaded by an occasional singer accompanied by an accordion player. Seasoned travelers know that Venice is very, very expensive, but this hotel is quite moderate for its prices. The breakfast, included in the room rate, has excellent American and European choices. The only negatives for us involved the Internet. The connection is very, very slow. A bit faster than dial-up, but not much. Also, to get internet you must pay a euro each day to get the access code. We agree with another reviewer that this is very "chezzie." Just add it to the room rate and give it to everyone. Anyway, we'd recommend it and on our next trip to Venice we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great staff/location but horrible room”
Reviews.Author: DrSteve24
Reviews.Content: the room was absolutely tiny and horribly organized. there were bugs in our room and the air conditioning was like a hundred years old on a good note, the staff, especially in the bar were amazing. and the location is very convenient to st marks square

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: SusanCrowe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Ala for 2 nights for a short break with friends. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel bar was great and the staff very attentive.The location of the hotel was perfect. All in all would definitely recommend this hotel and we all agreed if we go back to Venice we will be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great hotel with excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Edward1936
Reviews.Content: We had a stunning room "Antonia" with a view over rooftops and a church dome. It was very clean and comfortable. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: traveler938
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located with delivery by water taxi to the door. We had a room overlooking a canal and it was very comfortable and quiet. The breakfast is very American, (good), and the service is excellent. they have a good American type bar that is reasonable considering it's Venice. The only negative, is that to get internet service to the room you must put a euro in a "doll" each day and the desk clerk will give you the access code. How chezzie??? Otherwise it was first class and good value. Incidently it is next to the Gritti Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Would Never Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: laviajera73
Reviews.Content: Traveling with my sister and a girlfriend. Location was good. Short walk to the square. Internet was 2 euro. Room was clean, no doubt. Our room was extremely tiny for the money. Wish I had taken pictures. The photos that are posted above are a bit deceiving. Our double room was the size of a shoebox. Up to this point we had stayed in several hotels in Italy that were less money than this one and our rooms had all been significantly bigger. Not big mind you, but definitely larger than our room at the Hotel Ala. But, we could laugh at this this. Its about the whole experience right? They were nice enough in the beginning to show us another room...just as tiny, so we stayed put. Breakfast was good. Staff in the dining area looked very unhappy to be there both mornings that we dined. The thing that would keep us from coming back the most though, besides the horrible value, was when our friend, who was staying at a different hotel, came to meet us in the lobby at a specified time and was first told we werent even staying there and then very curtly told she couldnt wait there when she tried to approach the breakfast room where we were, to try and find us. She wasnt going to eat. She was only trying to find us. Then she was even told she couldnt wait inside the lobby. The front desk acted oblivious and unbelieving to the situation even though the employee who did this was standing right there right after it happened. Oh well, you cant win them all. Ive traveled many places without a lot of expectations. Ive stayed in many types of hotels and accommodations. From 1-5 star. My friend has too. I picked this one based on Tripadvisor reviews. I realize this wont be everyone's experience. But this was ours and we would never recommend it or stay here again. It was the poorest experience we had with our hotels over our two week stay in Italy. We can laugh at it now but it was seriously disappointing at the time. I was sent a survey afterward and a follow-up email from the hotel. They actually seemed confused about it at the time it happened , and there was still some question when I received the survey which was confusing to me considering how it obviously affected everyone. I appreciate the attention to try to figure it out and I get that it was one employee especially who was the antagonist in this situation but considering everything else about the hotel Ive mentioned it was not a place we'd want to stay again. Im positive there is a better option in Venice than the Best Western Hotel Ala. After all, you dont get a do-over.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for your stay in Venezia”
Reviews.Author: ccicerone
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel in Venezia. Rooms were clean, breakfast very good. We'll return to Hotel Ala...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and good service overall”
Reviews.Author: JMS_mature_couple
Reviews.Content: We followed the directions to the hotel from the website and had no trouble locating the hotel. The location was very good in our opinion. Our room overlooked the canal (although we couldn't see it as the position of the window in our room was quite high). Our room was quite small but well serviced and very clean and quiet. The hotel lounge area was very relaxing and welcoming after lots of walking. The breakfast selection was very good overall, although it can get congested at peak eating times. We booked our stay on-line and found the procedure straightforward and the staff helpful. It would be useful if written instructions for the air conditioning could be provided in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and value”
Reviews.Author: gibson71
Reviews.Content: Hotel ala is in a great location 10 min from St Marks Square, we chose a superior room which was bigger than normal and very comfortable. Great choice at breakfast although do not expect a full English.The Hotel is just yards away from the Giglio water bus stop from Piazza del Roma. There was a free trip to the glass factory at Murano by water taxi from the hotel which is worth while once you have been through the factory, the pressure to buy was not great but you are not left alone to just look and admire the glass sculptures. then thereis a free trip back ti St Marks. The day we left we took the water bus route back to the airport which is very good if the weather is ok cost 13 euros each from St Marks. I would go back to this Hotel and recommend it very highly

Reviews.Title: “A very good all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sucal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in 1991 and so was interested to compare it. It was OK in 1991 it is very good now. Rooms are well furnished and very clean, the staff are friendly and professional and the location is ideal. Breakfast was exceptionally good with a wide choice of quality produce. The bar was a nice place to meet friends in. The only downside was lack of air conditioning for 2 days when unexpected high temperatures made the rooms very hot and the arrival of mosquitoes. Our room had lovely french windows but we were unable to open them for fear of letting mosquitoes in. Thankfully aircon was eventually switched on and the room was bearable. Take repellents and an electronic room device if you are going in the warmer months. Be prepared to use cash in restaurants as very few take payment by credit card even some of the more expensive ones. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Then and Now, a Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: BKLou
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Ala in Venice, Italy 20 years ago and we returned in April 2010 with our 17 year old daughter. Both of our experiences there were great. The 2010 visit was especially sweet and the service and everything about our stay was exemplary. It is rare to find such outstanding, caring customer care/hospitality workers today. The staff at Hotel Ala is to be commended and thanked profusely. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingmom35805
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days at this hotel and enjoyed it very much. The building is typically "quirky" but the staff was friendly and helpful. Our room had a canal view, was a nice size and had a newly re-done bathroom. The breakfast was very good, with several staff members standing by to make sure everything was fresh and clean. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Make sure that you use the water taxi stop they recommend, if you do so you will have a straight shot from the taxi to the hotel, without having to climb up and down steps over other canals.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor value”
Reviews.Author: GrahamN
Reviews.Content: This was booked by my travel agent because of the delays to flights. Originally was booked for four nights, but managed to get a hire car so only stayed one night. Hotel wanted a 10% cancellation fee for the remaining three nights, but did not charge it when I ranted about them profiteering from the flight cancellations. I thought the room was overpriced. Room was very noisy as it was right on the front of the hotel. 24 hour internet access was good value at 2 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: travellernot2rist
Reviews.Content: We recently spent six nights at the Hotel Ala. The location is excellent, far enough away from the crowds at San Marco but close enough to walk there in 10 minutes, and convenient for almost any other sight you are likely to visit. A short walk from both the vaporetto number 1 and a traghetto that crosses the Grand Canal to the Dorsoduro. The breakfast included at the hotel is excellent with a wide variety of interesting offerings. Our room was a deluxe canal view and its decor was typically Venetian with beautiful plasterwork designs on the walls and a rather ugly Murano chandelier. Terrazo floors, marble bathroom, everything immaculately clean. I think it would be hard to find better lodgings in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “I love this Hotel and will return!”
Reviews.Author: chuckglass
Reviews.Content: This is a Great Hote,l close to San Marco Square, very clean and well kept property, great food and last but not least THE AMERICAN BAR! Great Bartender! 5 Star for sure. And I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: juleRochdale
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hotel 4 times now, and love its location. The Staff on reception are very helpful, when we were leaving the last time, they hooked us up with a Canadian couple who were leaving at the same time, so that we could share a water taxi. That way it only cost us half the money! The rooms are spotlessly clean . The staff are always courteous. The breakfast room is clean and if you can't find something from the extensive buffet, then you are really hard to please!! I would definately go again as I try to go to Venice at least once a year, but they seem to have put their prices up so much in the last 2 years that I have been forced to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: josephjoseph
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent.The location was very good. The staff were very helpful.All round excellent

Reviews.Title: “prime position”
Reviews.Author: thestylemeister
Reviews.Content: ideal stopover - great location and reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: CarrolUk
Reviews.Content: This was a great choice of hotel. 5 minutes from St Marks Square and within easy walking distance of many of Venice's other attractions. The hotel breakfast was first class with so much choice !!! also we could just ask for tea or coffee in our rooms and they would bring a tray up. Staff were all very obliging and friendly.Our frist visit to Venice was a great success.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is like coming home.”
Reviews.Author: Desperately
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we visited Hotel Ala, because of pleasant first stay in 2008. We will come back for a third time. Hotel Ala is our base camp for visiting friends in Treviso (Sisley Volley), for visiting the opera in Venice and for visiting cultural locations like Basilica di San Marco etc. We like doing walking everything, but when you are less mobile the boatbus is at 100 mtrs away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in every respect and perfectly situated”
Reviews.Author: LeicestershireBobbie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within five minutes' easy walk of St Marc's, Rialto and the Accadamia. It is immaculately clean, the breakfasts are excellent, the staqff friendly, courteous and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Venice at it's best 3 times over”
Reviews.Author: BookWormBB13
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was lovely, we had a great room with canal views. I can't rate the staff highly enough, we had the same porter the evening we arrived and the morning we left (arrived 10th left 14th), he was very friendly helping me to carry my hefty suitcase up to our room and back down again and stored safely in the luggage room. The breakfasts had a great variety, I don't know what most of the cheese were but they tasted very nice. Some wonderful cakes, breads and meats available, not only did it set you up for the day most of the time myself and my partner skipped lunch as we were still full. The day we arrived Venice was snowing, the day we left there was a gorgrous mist over the canal (more like dense fog up by Lido but still pretty all the same) and glorious sunshine in between. No matter what the weather the staff were always helpful, curteous and friendly. My partner was most impressed with the barman at the attached American restaurant for teaching him how to as for a beer. If we come to Venice again this hotel will be our first choice, great location, great staff in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!!”
Reviews.Author: MiraGreatFalls_VA
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, friendly staff, wonderful breakfast included in rate. High recommendation. Great Falls, Virginia USA

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a lovely city.”
Reviews.Author: Gardenaj
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Venice, staying at the Hotel Ala, with a group of friends to celebrate a birthday. From the moment the water taxi dropped us off, directly at the hotel steps, and the staff greeted us with a warm welcome, we knew we had made a good choice. The hotel is ideally located close to St. Marks square, but in Venice you're never too far from anywhere. The hotel was spotlessly clean, the bar had a nice atmosphere and our room had a lovely view overlooking the square. The deluxe room we had booked was also spotless and had everything we needed â€“ tea and coffee being available free of charge by contacting Reception. The breakfast was delicious and some of the cakes and flans on offer were out of this world. All the staff were friendly and courteous and helped make our stay very enjoyable. I would definitely stay at the Hotel Ala again if returning to Venice and would recommend the hotel to anyone without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at Hotel Ala took extra care of us and our lost luggage!”
Reviews.Author: BilluDada
Reviews.Content: After a year of frequent travels across Europe the staff at Hotel Ala are a real stand-out group! We arrived at the airport to find one bag lost. We had little hope after registering with lost and found at the airport. The hotel staff offered to keep in contact with the airport throughout the following day and we returned at night to find the luggage in our room. They never showed annoyance at us checking a few times with them and it was great not losing a day of our trip making calls. Don't let the "Best Western" in the hotel name fool you! The hotel is well located, yet quiet at night even during Carnival. The hotel was beautiful and well maintained, and the service was better than we have received at any other hotel over the past year.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel indeed”
Reviews.Author: Adam_S_WN
Reviews.Content: During my stay +: Internet worked correctly Reception was polite and highly professional Small services (like mailing etc) were fast and free The route of singing gondoliers just outside my window gave very local athmosphere -: Early breakfast (7.00) was incomplete, later (9.00) it was normal

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: manning
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a one minute walk from the waterbus and so very handy when you first arrive from the airport as we didn't have to drag a suitcase through the city like many other people we saw during our stay. The best thing about the hotel was its location. We were a few minutes walk to St Marks Square. The staff were all very friendly and English speaking. We had a very early morning departure when we left and so it was a blessing that the water taxi was able to pick us up from a side door to the hotel, which opens onto the canal. The continental breakfasts had everything you could ask for really, cereals, fruit, pastries, eggs etc. We had a standard room with a double and single bed, which was a bit of a squeeze but we didn't spend much time in the room and it was quite adequate for our needs. We had a safe deposit box in the room too. It was all very clean. There was a small bar in the hotel, which although quite nice was pricey as far as I recall. Overall I would definately recommend this hotel, especially for its prime location and would return myself.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Family Run Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: VenetianExplorer
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ala has been my home away from home in Venice for a dozen visits to the city. It has one of the best locations imaginable, whether from the point of view of for public transportation and for exploring the sights of Venice on foot. Close enough to St Mark's Square, yet in in its own uniquely characterful location, Ala offers a warm, welcoming and friendly style of hospitality, combined with a totally efficient and professional service that comes from it's dedicated, family-run ethos. The rooms/suites are well appointed (many with canal view), the decor is full of interesting object d'art, without being intimidating and there is a exceptional breakfast bar with the widest possible selection of cereals, breads, meats, cheeses, cakes and pastries to provide a hearty start to the day. The elegant Tarnowska Bar offers the perfect place to relax in the evening (or at any time of the day) with a coffee or a cocktail. I have recommended this hotel to many people and have no hesitation in recommending it to visitors to Tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ala was a very good choice for us.”
Reviews.Author: johnjg
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a wonderful trip to Italy, including some snowy days in Venice just before Christmas. We stayed at Hotel Ala which we found to be well suited to our family. The location was excellent with shops and good restaurants nearby, and only 50 meters from the vaporetto stop. We were able to walk from the hotel to most places in Venice we wanted to see. We found both the day and night desk staff to be helpful and accommodating. We ate in one of the restaurants recommended by the desk staff and had a very good meal there. We booked two of the larger rooms (which I do recommend), for our party of four and the rooms were warm, clean and charming. The bathrooms were also very clean and everything functioned well. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast each day which offered a wider selection than is typical in small hotels in Italy. We had rain, snow and sleet while in Venice but that did not stop us from exploring the city. It was nice to return to Hotel Ala and warm up by the fire in the sitting room just off the lobby. We ended each day with a relaxing nightcap in the charming American Bar attached to the hotel. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, and what i expected”
Reviews.Author: Krotz
Reviews.Content: We came with our three kids and stayed in a "suite" which had two king-size beds. The room looked like it was out of the 1970's, and had no windows, but neither of these things really bothered us. Service was good except the breakfast buffet, where I felt food was refreshed too slowly as the woman doing it went on frequent smoking breaks (I guessed this according to how she smelled when she did show up). Food was fair. Other reviewer warned about the "Murano Boat Scam" .... we expected that we'd be offered such a free trip, and actually wanted to go and buy some Murano glass, we did do the free trip, and were happy with it. I don' think it is a scam .... it is a way to get people to visit their store. Marketing, not scam! The location is awesome, and since we were looking at Venice, not at our hotel room, this was most important. Overall, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Watch for Murano Boat Scam”
Reviews.Author: dmdos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in October 2009, on our first trip to Venice. The location is great, short walk from the Giglio water taxi stop on the Grand Canal. The room and the breakfast were fine. We found the desk staff to be unhelpful and sometimes rude. The tipping point was when we were offered a free boat shuttle to the island of Murano, where the glass factories are. We accepted, and were dropped on a small dock in at an isolated end of the island, in front on just one factory. We were greeted by the factory barkers, and when we declined a tour, were badgered and harrassed. Of course by this time the boat taxi had long gone so there was no way back to the hotel. We finally found our way to the main part of the island, which is where we wanted to go, after a long walk...and took the public transportation back to the hotel. Left a very bad taste in our mouths, and we wanted to warn others to definitely skip that offer!

Reviews.Title: “The choice of Ala made our stay special”
Reviews.Author: TVR52
Reviews.Content: The other reviews have said most of it - the great location, etc. I would add that it's worth going for an upgraded room as Venice rooms are SMALL. Every one of the Concierge's recommendations for restaurants was excellent and close by. Off-season Venice is also under-rated - if the weather holds out, this is actually a great time of the year to visit Venice : no crowds, queues and other hassles.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure your room has got a window!!”
Reviews.Author: biancotartufo
Reviews.Content: I have been to Venice before and stayed at a cheaper hotel. Since my partner was coming with me this time I thought I'd go a bit more up market and booked two nights at Hotel Ala via the internet and paid A$526.53 in full prior to arrival. We arrived at the hotel at about 3pm on Friday 30/10/09. The foyer was very attractive and I felt happy I had selected the hotel. Even though I knew our room would be small nothing prepared me for the horrible room we were taken too. We went up to the 4th level and were led even further up along a hall way eventually reaching a room in the roof of the old part of the hotel. You couldn't swing a cat in the room but the worse thing was there was NO window. The room was dark, smelt musty and there was no fresh air at all. In the ceiling was a small sky light that you could apparently open a couple of inches. The room was a disgrace. I then had to go to the front desk and complain. I was then offered the choice of 3 rooms all with windows! I would not have paid $20 to stay in that windowless room. I am so annoyed that the supervisor thought he could palm that rotten room off on us dumb Aussies. The only good things about this place was the breakfast. I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone. Don't Best Western have standards? Check out the photos. I only wish I'd taken a photo inside the room.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: miranda099
Reviews.Content: stayed in hotel ala for 4 nights.location excellent, less than 5 mins from St Marks Square. Had a room on second floor overlooking canal. Room small and bathroom tiny, my husband who is tall could hardly fit into shower. Room very clean, indeed everywhere was spotless. Found bed lumpy ( THE MATTRESS NEEDS REPLACING) The breakfast was excellent . All in all had an enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: JohnRiv
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ala is in a great location, with St. Mark's Square less than a 10 minute walk away. We arrived early and the staff stored our bags while we explored Venice. When we returned after lunch, our room was ready. After being in an interior room on a cruise ship for the previous week, our room at Hotel Ala seemed enormous. We had a wonderful dinner at A Beccafico as well (less than a minute walk away) which I'd highly recommend eating at as well. Take advantage of their group gondola ride that the hotel offers if you plan on experiencing Venice at night via a gondola. It takes off from a dock right around the corner from the hotel and includes live music. At 40 euro per person (even at night!), it's the best deal a couple can get for a gondola with music (if you're willing to share the experience with others). Multiple boats ride the canals together (so everyone can hear the music, which is performed from 1 of the gondolas), so be sure to be the first on one of the boats so you can pick your seat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: PogglesWoodSurrey
Reviews.Content: This is not a 5 star hotel and does not pretend to be. What it is, is a very comfortable 3 star hotel. Yes, some of the rooms are small, but they are well furnished and tastefully decorated. As other reviews state, the breakfast is definitely worth having in a city where eating out can be very expensive, it pays to have a good start to the day. There was no pressure to hurry and no limit to how often you could return to the wide range of food available. The hotel is just up an alley from the San Giglio vaporetti stop, within a couple of minutes of St Marks Square and an easy walk to the Rialto. I recommend by a 3 day ticket for the vaporetti and making full use of the water buses up and down the Grand Canal. If you get offered a room overlooking the courtyard there is a constant noise from an air conditioning unit. You may not notice it or may find it annoying, just be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Michigaloot
Reviews.Content: Let me begin with mentioning the positive's of Hotel Ala: right near the water taxi dock (try dragging luggage down narrow vias and up/down bridge stairs in Venice), was reasonably priced, and close to St Mark's Square (about a ten minute walk). It proved to be clean and tolerably modern, the free breakfast was very good, the staff helpful and reasonably pleasant. Downsides? Rooms were least attractive of all the hotels we stayed at in Italy (doesn't mean they were awful just not as nice) and their "no extra towels" policy, clearly stated on the room flyer, is absolutely absurd. My wife accidentally dropped the second bath towel in the shower and we were forced to share one!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, great staff, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: PaSunlover
Reviews.Content: As with most European hotels the room was postage sized but with a surprisingly nice sized bathroom. The staff was most accomodating and the breakfast buffet was pretty good too. The hotel was close enough to walk to San Marco and there is a vaporetta stop less than a block away so it is convenient to most everywhere. We got a "free" water taxi ride to Murano to see one of the glass factories but it was really just a ploy to get you to buy which we didn't realize till we got there. Still the island was nice and we enjoyed eating lunch there. No water taxi comes to take you home though so be prepared to take the vaporetta back. I would give this hotel a 3 or 4 star rating and for the price is a good buy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel (Best Western) right near a water taxi stop and convenient to all the sites and restaurants in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: mftravels
Reviews.Content: We took a water taxi from the rail station to the hotel and were surprised to find our hotel within 100 feet of one of the stops. It is situated on a quiet plaza, very close to the the Doge's Palace and the Basilica. The service staff at the hotel was excellent. They even fixed my eyeglasses when a screw came loose from the frame. The breakfast served in the morning as part of the room was the best we had in our entire stay in Italy. The room and the bathroom was spacious and very clean. We would return to this hotel without a doubt on our next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A really good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TwinCitiesRedhead
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights recently at this hotel which was recommended to us by a friend, and we were not disappointed. There was a little trouble at checkin as, unknown to us, they had two reservations in our name, one of which should have been cancelled by 4 pm that day as we required only one. After a long discussion with the General Manager, he graciously solved this problem in our favor, which we really appreciated. The hotel is in a great location for Venice, easily reached by water taxi or vaperetto, and walking distance to many important sites and museums, and good restaurants close by. The staff was very helpful with directions, etc. We had reserved a deluxe double with a canal view, but did not like the first room they showed us. We spent three restful nights in the lovely second room they showed us, complete with a Murano chandelier. The bathroom was excellent, and the included breakfast the best one we have ever had in a hotel. Needless to say, we will stay at the Hotel Ala again! Venice calls one back!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in an excellent location and very professioanally managed.”
Reviews.Author: VisitareItalia
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ala is in an excellent location with La Fenice visible from piazza directly in front of the hotel. Piazza San Marco is within relatively short walking distance in one direction and to the Accademia gallery in the opposite direction. The Piazza is just one vaporetto stop from S. Marco and there is taxi access directly to the Hotel from the adjoining canal. The staff is highly professional, helpful and courteous. An all-you-can-eat breakfast buffet for guests has a large and plentiful variety of foods and beverages. Considering location, rating, confort and service the cost is very competitive and reasonable. I would return to the Hotel Ala for any future visit to Venezia .

Reviews.Title: “Finally we got the best”
Reviews.Author: kangaroo6
Reviews.Content: It was our fourth time in Venice: we are in love with the Serenissima since we met there in the '80. This time we discovered what we consider to be a rare preciousness, an hotel were love for details is breathble everywhere: Hotel Ala. This time we were travelling with our two children. The staff made us feeling home. We already know that there will be a next time and we are looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “The Canal's were a sight to remember!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kingman99
Reviews.Content: The trip from the train station (came from Florence) to the hotel by boat was easy and worth the trip on the canal. We got off at #13 right before Saint Marks Square and was surprised because when we got off the boat we walked through a small alley way into a square where the hotel was. The hotel was fine and one side of the hotel was on a small canal. We were close to everything but be careful you can lost quickly but again if you carry a map you will find your way. The food was not as good as Florence or Rome and was more $$> Nothing to buy that is worth while and we tried. Take the same boat back to the airport or there is another boat that only stops 3 or 4 times that leaves starting 3:40am by Saint Marks place. Do not take a private Taxi or it will cost you 100 euros or more. The hotel was fine and what you would expect in Venice for the price but it was comfortable and clean. The breakfast was very good I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: SDY
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I spent two nights at the Hotel Ala and found it to be a great hotel in a perfect location in Venice. It is extremely close to the Santa Maria del Giglio vaporetto stop (50 meters) so there was no hauling our luggage around the city. The location is about a 5 minute walk to San Marco square and we easily walked around from the location to Dorsoduro and San Polo. The rooms are lovely with huge and modern bathrooms. We had a canal view which was great. The hotel was also very quiet and clean and the breakfast had a few more options than others. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: Bimbom
Reviews.Content: For the third year in succession the "Dutch comitato privato for the safeguarding of Venice " choose Hotel Ala for their annual visit to Venice. We are so well pleased, not only with the excellent location of the hotel but also with the friendliness and expertise of the staff, that we already made a reservation for 2010. The location is at short distance of San Marco and the Accademia as well as the vaporetti stop on the Grand Canal. Hotel Ala can offer many good single rooms which makes it quit attractive for groups. The breakfast is superb with a big variety of food and to top it Hotel Ala has a well provided bar.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: VacationBug8
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel after reviewing TripAdvisor reviews. The hotel was great; terrific location (short walk to San Marco Square), nice breakfast, quaint rooms and friendly/helpful staff. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best place we stayed on our trip to Italy!”
Reviews.Author: Wikkidnik
Reviews.Content: Our room was fantastic! We had a balcony overlooking a canal and a hand painted ceiling with a murano glass chandalier. The bathroom was really small but nice. It had a blow dryer which was a plus. The location was great and easy to get to by water bus from the train station. My favorite part was the breakfast. They had the biggest selection of food of any of the hotels we stayed at. They even had fruit tarts. We are looking forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MGWAustralia
Reviews.Content: This was a great find. Easy to get too by vaporetto and close enough to St Marks Square without being in the thick of things. Pleasent ,helpful staff and comfortable clean room. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Melanie37
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ala was a treat. Room was small, but lots of character. Small rooftop terrace. Excellent breakfast. Professional staff. Close to St. Mark's square and vaparetto stop to get everywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Sarob09
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Hotel Ala. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The breakfast was the best of our trip (and we love breakfasts!). The location perfect within walking distance of all the major sites. We enjoyed dinner at the restaurant they recommend and are affiliated with (can't remember the name but it is literally just the other side of the piazza). We'd thoroughly recommend this hotel. It was great value for money. Our room was lovely with a spa!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: JennyTorontoCanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friend - her first visit to Venice. Hotel Ala is in perfect location- 2 minute walk to vaporetto stop and quick walk past beautiful shops to St. Marks Square. It shares piazza with world famous Gritti Palace hotel. Staff helpful,;rooms comfortable and well equipped; breakfasts the best on our trip! Have recommended Hotel Ala to friends and this month using it for Italian adventure package for hospital gala . Best Western hotels in Europe are excellent and more like boutique hotels- we have stayed in them in France, Italy and Poland

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GFBPA
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain. Well located, great breakfast, beautiful rooms ... not cheap, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The ideal hotel to explore and enjoy Venice”
Reviews.Author: wandererAntwerp
Reviews.Content: This summer we stayed for the fourth time in hotel Ala in Venice, and we were so satisfied that we intend to come back in the summer of 2011. Hotel Ala is a very nice and comfortable hotel with a friendly staff. They will make inquiries and reservations if you want to see something special. Its location is very good. It is very near San Marco, and a few minutes from piazza Santo Stefanno: a very nice piazza with good restaurants. It is also just a few minutes walk from the Academia, and the Academia bridge where you have a wonderful view on the Canal Grande! Hotel Ala is just one minute walk from the vapporetto stop, which is an great advantage when you have to carry your luggage. The hotel also gives a discount voucher for a nice restaurant located nearby along a small canal: restaurant 'Rafaelle'. Enjoy nice Italian food while watching the passing gondolas laden with enjoying tourists and their more annoyed looking male partners. Don't be afraid to come to Venice during the summer. Piazza San Marco and the Rialto are very crowded, but once in other 'sestieri' Venice is very agreeable and quiet, with lots of magnificent things to see.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Beautiful Hotel next to Gritti Palace”
Reviews.Author: oakleycmh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ala about 12 days in July. The location is perfect; close enough to San Marco to feel the energy, but not too close. Campo Santa Maria Zobenigo has a peaceful feel yet is steps from Calle Larga for shopping, about 100 yards from the Fenice, 5 minutes from San Marco, and in the other direction 5 minutes to the Accademia Bridge and onward to Dorsoduro, the Guggenheim, etc. Some rooms face a small canal with gondola traffic which is fun. Some rooms face the Campo and the church with great views. The Hotel is a 3 star and is part of the Best Western group. Excellent continental brkfst is served daily, Bar Tarnowska is great for cocktails. The Bar staff take great pride in their work and do a great job. The family also owns Ristorante Da Raffaele which is excellent and the setting on a canal is unbeatable. There is a rooftop terrace with views in every direction. On a clear day, you can see the Dolomite Mountains to the north. The staff was always helpful with any request and also was able to get a room last minute for friends who came in for the night form the Veneto. The hotel is always clean and well attended, and common areas are bright and cheerful. The final weekend of my stay was Redentore and the fireworks display in the lagoon. Spectacular, better than any I've seen before and the whole experience was great fun. The Ala is a great choice for a visit to Venice and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “The best value for Venice. Central but quiet. Pleasant staff.”
Reviews.Author: venitienParis
Reviews.Content: the hotel you look for in venice .nice and quiet rooms .staff so kind great breakfast coming back soon

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: golfer1942
Reviews.Content: We went for a long weekend with my grown up family, we had a great time. The hotel is located near St Marks square and only a few metres from the Giglio vaporetto stop. The hotel is very clean, the sheets were changed daily and the breakfast was excellent, I recommend the scrambled eggs. We booked the hotel direct with Best Western and found that to be the cheapest way to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay and Love It!”
Reviews.Author: Luvt0vacance
Reviews.Content: The four of us (2 couples) stayed at this hotel for 2 night as our pre-cruise. My brother-in-law especially loves the hotel even it is just an average and simple one. Everything was as expected and it made our stay enjoyable. The staff were extremely helpful and the hospitality was excellent. Emotionally the hotel can be rated with 4 stars! Location wise, it is excellent and very convenient. The Murano trip was fun with a beautify Venice view on the boat ride but people at the manufacture were rude and sarcastic. Same thing... we were pushed out the door abrupted and rudely because of no purchase attempt. However, we felt like we traveled first class with the fact that there is a dock at this hotel ... we walked up to the hotel from airport by private taxi and we also left for cruise port by private taxi:-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaAndiamo
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Ala, we found the staff to be friendly and attentive. The only thing I would like to advise on is the free taxi ride to Murano. We took the hotel up on this offer only to be taken to a glass blowing studio who really tried the hard sell on very expensive light fittings and large works of art, we only wanted to see the island, spend the day exploring and take home some keepsakes. We were moved through the gallery and then found ourselves back out the front and the taxi would only take us back to Venice, we were unable to see the rest of the island. I would suggest taking the water ferry instead.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Good4YouChicago
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this site all seem to be spot on for the Hotel Ala. Clean, great location and friendly staff. As a travel professional, we used about 60 rooms at the Hotel Ala to house conference delegates. All were impressed with the hotel and it was so nice for me to get many compliments, and no complaints, when everyone departed. The staff couldn't have been nicer to work with - particularaly Andrea and Silvia! It was effortless to work with the Hotel Ala and we will be back if our conferences bring us once again to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Maja_travelling
Reviews.Content: I simply ADORED Hotel ALA.... Our stay was pleasurable....the rooms were PERFECT..very clean...and beautiful rooms....The staff was excellent and welcoming...i liked the internet service also which was very helpful to use for 24h!! Excellent idea!!! The location of the hotel is PERFECT...it is very close to San Marco and the shopping area!!! YOU won't find a better Hotel in VENEZIA!!! CONGRATULATIONS HOTEL ALA!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in an Expensive Location”
Reviews.Author: OHARE4ME
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with the Hotel Ala. The staff were impeccable, especially Luca at the front desk and the bartender in the hotel bar. The room, though tiny, was quite charming and a good value only a few blocks from San Marco Square and a 2 minute walk from the Giglio stop on the water bus. The hotel was clean and quiet with lovely common areas. The bar was beautifully appointed, as well. The included breakfast was a delight each morning, with vast offerings of high quality meats, cheeses, pastries, toast, scrambled and hard boiled eggs, juices, coffee, cakes, and fruit. Gluten free selections were also available. We will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service.”
Reviews.Author: SydneyMeg
Reviews.Content: Just a ten minute walk from San Marco Square and 10 minutes from the Accademia Bridge over the Grand Canal. It seemed like every time we left, the housekeeping staff came in to straighten up. Staff was very nice and helpful. The breakfast was plentiful. Hotel and room were clean. Our room was over a canal and we could see the Grand Canal from our window. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “IN VENICE, ALWAYS ALA”
Reviews.Author: AKADE
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Ala at the end of last June. It was our third time in Venezia and our third time at Ala. We spent wonderful days and we are very pleased with the Hotel. It is a charming small hotel in an excellent location and with superb service. With no doubts, our next time in Venezia will also be at Ala

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Kayjay99
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ala is just a few minutes from all the major sights in Venice, yet far enough away to be able to get a good night's sleep! Hotel staff were professional, helpful and friendly - they'll be able to answer most queries on transport etc. There is a vaporetto stop conveniently close, but not all boats stop there. Check the routes carefully, otherwise it's a 10-min walk from St Mark's square. Bad news with heavy suitcases! As for the hotel itself, it was clean, elegant, and the breakfasts were excellent. Not cheap and the rooms weren't huge but they were well appointed and air-conditioned (essential in summer!). We opted for the canal view and had the added bonus of being seranaded by passing gondolas on our first evening which was a lovely welcome to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Parismyfav
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Great location - close to the vaporetto which btw, if you arrive in the night, gets you the full tour of Grand Canal and Venice by the night. San Marco square is just a couple of mins walk away. Bathrooms are small but that is true just about everywhere in Europe. Room on the other hand was decent sized and comfortably air-conditioned. Breakfast was the other great feature - too good!! The only not so good aspect - Wi-fi internet didn't work :(

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Venice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kristen211
Reviews.Content: The hotel is adorable and the location is great. It's about 50 steps away from the Grand Canal and very easy to get to using the vaporetto. If you take the #1 vaporetto to the Giglio stop the hotel is right there. Our room overlooked a canal and bridge with a gondola parked right under the window. The staff provided us with a crib for our 19 month old and made it up like a tiny little bed, complete with a pillow (which we didn't use but appreciated). The bartender was so sweet and provided me with warm milk for the baby's night time bottle with a smile and a wink. It didn't matter that the bar was packed with patrons. The bar itself looked like a lot of fun and had I not had a 5 year old & a 19 month old we would have enjoyed the nightlife there. Just outside of the hotel is a tiny store filled to the brim with glass frames, jewelry, even bugs! There is also a fountain outside the front doors of the hotel that my kids adored. I would stay at this hotel again and again! Would I recommend this hotel? Yes, yes yes!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ala is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneTravelQueen
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and a friend stayed here for two nights at the end of five weeks travelling around Italy and the French Riviera. It was a lovely way to end our beautiful trip. I booked this over the internet and had chosen a deluxe room that I saw on the net. However the deluxe room they gave me wasn't the same as I had chosen however to compensate they upgraded me to a Junior Suite which was very nice. We would stay there again when we go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience in Venice”
Reviews.Author: tourista90
Reviews.Content: Our family group reserved four rooms and were all extremely pleased with the reception and service we received. The rooms are fully renovated with spacious bathroom and beautifully decorated. The location is great, one block from a vaporetto station and a few blocks from San Marco. The breakfast was outstanding, the rooms immaculate, cool and quiet. Also, the internet is inexpensive. This hotel contributed to a great Venice experience. We hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ridleysmythe
Reviews.Content: This hotel was completely renovated, clean, an amazing location, and exteremly helpful and nice staff. The staff were able to answer all our questions and were very welcoming. I was impressed with this hotel and will definately return at the first oppertunity. Venice is an amazing city, and this hotel experience really was the cherry on top!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel captures the soul of Venice - a perfect holiday location.”
Reviews.Author: wls646
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ala is a supreb hotel right in the heart of Venice. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are beautiful, large and very comfortible. The location, right in the heart of Venice, is perfect. It's a good value for a hotel so close to Piazza San Marco. We hope to return and stay again. I recommend this hotel without any reservations. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “next time i will go back to this nice hotel in this very beautifull city !!!”
Reviews.Author: riccik
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel--near a bootstation near canale grande--you can rech it easy from the railwaystation und are near marcus place,

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Gerane
Reviews.Content: Very nice people at the reception, very well located, nice rooms, nice view outside, good quality and cheap internet (2â‚¬ per day), wonderful breakfast Wallpaper would need to be a bit refreshed, and room a bit expensive, but normal in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: LynnTed1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel twice. It is a convenient location. The hotel is very charming, the rooms are nice and the staff is exceptional. We enjoyed the breakfast at this hotel as well as the bar. I can't say enough about this place. We had a great time both times we stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely wonderful hotel in one of the the most beautiful cities in the world.”
Reviews.Author: SheenaEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: We stayed with friends in this hotel and we all agreed it was one of the nicest hotels we have stayed in on our trips together. The standards of cleanliness were first class, excellent breakfast, very pleasant and helpful staff and really conveniently placed near to St. Mark's Square and also with a vaporetto stop a few yards away. We loved the rooftop terrace. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice and hope to go back sometime in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel, Outstanding Location”
Reviews.Author: merlinandme
Reviews.Content: I stayed from May 29 through June 2, and I was delighted with everything about the Ala. Location, location, location. Getting to the Ala is easy peasy. Pick up the line 1 vaporetto and get off at San Maria Giglio (Giglio). Walk up the narrow little street in front of you the short distance that takes you to the square. On your left is the Hotel Ala. You are so close to San Marco along with the vaporetto stops that will take you to anywhere in this delightful city. The staff is helpful. The rooms are lovely. We had two windows, one overlooking the square and one overlooking a busy little calle. But there was no noise that ever disturbed us. Breakfast was abundant and good. I would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Charm and Convenience”
Reviews.Author: UKWildcatNCBound
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious yet retained traditional Italian charm. The location was very convenient to tourist attractions, shopping, the Accademia and the vaporetto. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We stayed at more expensive hotel in Venice in the past, but Hotel Ala was far better and exceeded our expectations. We plan on staying here when we return to Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer.”
Reviews.Author: BlancheDuBois
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Ala for only one night, regrettably. Wish we could have stayed longer. It was our first night in Italy, and we were quite exhausted after a long flight, and train from Milan. The hotel made our first night of needed rest very comfortable. It was well situated to everything we wanted to see. The staff were polite, friendly, and very helpful (both when we checked in and when we checked out, and everything in between). The continental breakfast had many selections and the dining room, was small but quite cozy. The room was spotless, likewise the bathroom. The price was a bit high, but we expected that in Venice. For Venice, it was actually a good deal. For the people who complained about the mosquitos outside the window, I do hope you realize that the Hotel Ala didn't put them there--that's called "nature" and it's part of being in a city situated on the water and marshes. I thought it nice that among the room's included toiletries were two mosquito repellent wipes. I've never seen that at any other hotel. We ended up using them in Florence. We'd stay at Ala again, and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: eab126
Reviews.Content: All of the hotels in Venice are super expensive however I found the ALA very resonable and got more than I expected. It's just off of St Mark's Square. If you take the Baglietto to St Marks get off make a left and go straight until you come to another street. Make a left, St mark should be at your back. Follow that street cross two bridges and you land right at the Ala. The staff was freindly. The room had no view and was quite small, but those things didn't matter since I was out of the room 98% of the time. Just a note, the Air Condition worked extremely well. Breakfest was great. They offered pastries/eggs/toast/and italian meats. The coffee was excellent. It was all perfect to start your day. Wireless internet was available for $8 Euros which gave you 24 hrs of service. It worked perfectly. Overall I have no complaints or problems with the hotel. For the price/location/ and service, I believe it's a bargain for Venice, however if you're looking for a view of the grand canal then be prepared to spend some money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, awesome location, definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Krisjand
Reviews.Content: This place is simply awesome and very good value for the money. While staying in Venice is not cheap, the Ala (a Best Western) provided us with the most affordable option. Situated less than 100 yards from a water bus stop and a couple hundred yards directly off Piazza San Marco, it was easy to find (also has it's own canal entrance if you take a taxi or gondola). While our paperwork was completed at our arrival, the bell hop showed us our room. It was small, but well furnished, very clean and comfortable (including A/C). We dropped our bags and finished the check in. For a 2 Euro donation, we received our wireless access for the day and then set off to explore. There is a bar on site with live entertainment, though we did not go. Breakfast is included and it was excellent. It included everything from eggs to fruit and breads and a variety of other choices. Our rooms were cleaned daily, even if the do not disturb sign is left, including a straightening up of our pamphlets and brochures scattered over the desk. The in-room safe is free and uses a guest-created combo. I can think of nothing bad to say about this hotel whatsoever. A very excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: baileysmom1993
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just a few steps from the vaparetto stop and St. Marks square which was very convenient. A bonus was the high end shops between St. Mark's and the hotel. The room and bathroom were VERY small but the bathroom had all the necessary amenities. We had to take our luggage up steps to the 2nd floor but the bellman helped. The employees spoke pretty good English and were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable hotel in a great location - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Midaregami
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel mostly because of its location - it's close enough to walk to St.Marc Square in 5 min., but as it's slightly off the main tourist tracks, the area is not crowded with people, and at night it's not noisy at all. Also, it's 2 min walk from a vaporetto stop, which means easy transportation. The hotel has both street and canal entrance, which makes it easy for those with heavy luggage to hop straight in a water taxi. I stayed at Hotel Ala twice - first time, several years ago, in a double deluxe room on the second floor, with large french windows overlooking the canal, and antique furniture decorated with Venetian landscapes. This year, we stayed in a double deluxe room on the third floor - the windows were much smaller, but the room seemed bigger. Furniture was new and expensive-looking, and the bathroom looked new and spotlessly clean, with a jakuzzi. One small problem - there were no Q-tips and cotton balls in the bathroom, so bring your own. Wireless internet worked well, and was cheap - 2 euro per day. Buffet breakfast was very good - lots of pastry and cakes, fresh fruit, quality cheeses, yoghurt (including low-fat), 5 or 6 kinds of cereal in individual small boxes, eggs, olives, mushrooms etc. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I booked the room for 10 nights, but a week before the trip I found out that my return flight was canceled, so I had to fly back home one day later. I contacted the hotel manager Andrea asking to prolong my stay for 1 night, and he generously prolonged it for free! By the way, in a square nearby the hotel (I think it was St. Mauruzio, but I'm not sure) a flea market works one weekend a month. It's highly worth browsing, especially for ladies - there were lots of beautiful things, antique jewelry, bead-embroidered victorian purses etc. When I visit Venice again, I'll most likely choose Hotel Ala again, but next time I will specifically ask for a second-floor room with french windows.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic find”
Reviews.Author: Liz100f
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this stunning hotel. Ideally situated for the water buses, we arrived there after a short trip down the grand canal and found the hotel in a small square just a few metres walk from the canal. Very attentive staff; excellent service, lovely rooms and fantastic breakfast buffet. A short walk to St Marks and the Rialto - we would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quality short break.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive staff, Clean rooms, fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: YCHTBROKER
Reviews.Content: We started a two week vacation in Venice at the Hotel Ala. We had just come from a long trip with flight delays and missed connections. We took a water taxi from the airport right to their door. Our room had a view of one of the small romantic canals just off of the Grand Canal. Several times while we were there Gondolas would come down the canal with music and singing which we watched from our window. The hotel, rooms and bathrooms were exceptionally clean. In the morning we enjoyed the included breakfast. They offered almost anything that you could want and plenty of it. We particularly liked the prosuitto ham with assorted cheeses and melons. They also offered eggs,cereals, fruits, juices and all kinds of pastries. They suggested a very nice restaurant for dinner which was a block away. It was also on a small romantic canal with gondolas docked out front. They supplied us with coupons for a 10% discount at that restaurant. The food was very good with a nice selection on the menu. We ate there two evenings! The location of the hotel is great. It is a couple of blocks from St Marks Square but in a quiet area. The best of both worlds! The staff was so good that they tracked down the same water taxi and driver that brought us from the airport to the hotel to take us to the cruise ship. They also were very accomodating in helping us exchange money at a very fair rate. We are looking forward to returning to both Venice and the Hotel Ala soon!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful eight nights”
Reviews.Author: tropicalia
Reviews.Content: Run, don' t wait to book at the Ala. As previosly mentioned by others it has an excellent location-central, but quiet, accesible to public transport, with clean and confortable rooms and VERY attentive staff. Yes, the room was small, but the spotless bathroom was huge and we even had the most charming terrace overlooking the small canal behind the hotel, so we got to hear gondoliers singing "O Sole Mio" on occasion. Wooden shutters on the windows and door provide darkness and quiet. Breakfast was very varied and ample-eggs, cold meats, cereals, yogurt, an assortment of breads etc, constantly replenished by a HAPPY staff. I spilled coffed on my husband's sweater and before I knew it it was out of my hands and being cleaned. We had to extend our stay in Venice due to a change in travel plans and the hotel was extremely accomodating in securing scarce new reservations even in an Italian holiday weekend and ensuring that a room change was seamless. Our second room had a smaller bath, but it was much bigger. The Ala does not have a fourth star due to the lack of a dining room, but there is a good restaurant ten steps outside the door and many others for all budgets--including sandwich shops--in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to find and great location”
Reviews.Author: lonestarbt
Reviews.Content: If you step off the vaporetta at the Giglio stop and walk down the alley you have arrived at the Hotel Ala. It's in a great spot situated between the Academia and St Mark's Square. We asked for a canal view and had the best time watching the gondolas go by. Our room was spacious, clean, and nicely decorated. The staff were courteous, respectful and responded quickly when we asked for an extra pillow. They were also kind enough to open our wine and loan us some glasses from the bar so we could enjoy our wine in our room. The breakfast is wonderful with plenty of selections and volume. You will not walk away hungry. This was a great place to stay while we explored Venice. Hope you enjoy it too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sumanthj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and we liked our room very much. Its small but clean. Breakfast was good. They also have internet for 2 Euro suggested donation to some charity. Its close to St.Marks square.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel at fantastic locations with great brekfast”
Reviews.Author: Mayday82
Reviews.Content: Despite that we booked ekonomy room, it was fantastic - nice, clean, coisy room with a view on Canal with small bridge and bouts. Service was great. Brekfast was really really good - lot of everything. Hotel is situated at a very good location - few minutes of alk to San Marco but hotel is in a very peacefull place. If we come to Venice once more, we will choose this hotel 100%. PS - I've never said such thing about any other hotel in my life - i'm kind of "picky" person

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling-clean room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ProudToBeFromBend
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Best Western Hotel Ala in late March. We got a screaming deal - 80 euros a night - by booking directly from the hotel's web site and responding to a web special. The rooms were small, and the bathroom even smaller, but who spends much time in their hotel room in Venice anyway? The rooms were super-clean. The bed was a little too firm for our taste. The location was great, halfway between St. Mark's Square and the Accademia art museum. Like many hotels in Venice, it can be a little bit of a hassle to find if you're hauling luggage and don't know your way around. We took the Alilaguna in from the airport and got off at St. Mark's Square. We started to buy vaporetto tickets to the Santa Maria del Giglio stop (one stop from St. Mark's), but the friendly ticket seller let us know that the hotel was only 5 minutes walk away and gave us directions. That saved us 6 euros each. We had to cross three bridges to get to the hotel - a bit of a challenge with luggage but not bad if you have wheeled luggage and only one bag per person. If you get off the Alilaguna, walk straight ahead to St. Mark's Square. Turn left and leave the square at the back left corner (opposite St. Mark's Cathedral). Just stay on the winding street, following signs to Accademia. From St. Mark's Square you'll cross two bridges and run right into the hotel. You could also take a water taxi from the airport directly to the hotel - it has its own dock on a canal. If you have lots of luggage or a large group, that would make the most sense. Or you can take the previously mentioned vaporetto one stop from St. Mark's. There's a little alley that leads about 100 yards from the vaporetto stop directly past the hotel. Breakfast was fine - average for a European hotel. They have wireless internet for 2 euros a day - a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “I'm counting the days before I can go back”
Reviews.Author: sold-on-venice
Reviews.Content: We researched many hotels before we made our choice. You have to realize the starting point, this is a 3 star hotel in probably one of the most expensive cities in Europe in an old building where every square meter is like gold dust. So, how did it come up to the reviews? We had two deluxe double rooms. They were certainly as large as any modern hotel elsewhere in Europe, obviously I can only comment on our two rooms and none of the others. Cleanliness was superb, clean than most 4* hotels I've been in - the bathroom, always the weak link, was totally spotless. Staff just couldn't be more helpful. We wanted two extra pillows and they nearly arrived in the room before we managed to get the lift back to our room. Everyone was so pleasant and were so helpful when I wanted to check-in for the return flight. Breakfast may have been "continental" which has bad over tone in the UK, but not this time. There was a wide choice and we never managed to try all the items that we really wanted. The locations is brilliant. It is so close to the main city sites that we would pop back 3 or 4 times each day to drop shopping off, pop to the bathroom or just for a few moments out the sun and then off again. This was something we hadn't realized as an advantage until we got there but prized it highly. OK so what was the downside? Well, there was a small chip on shelf above the washbasin and I noticed a small hand print on the corner of a mirror in reception. The back that you have to go down to such crazy levels to find anything whatever to complain about will give you a clue as to how brilliant we rate this hotel. It is very expensive, but then ALL hotels and EVERYTHING is crazy money compared to what we are used to in the UK. Within the costs of Venice however I would rate this hotel head and shoulders above the others we looked at.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location for the price”
Reviews.Author: laneck
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so conveniently located, the noise from the neighbor's shower didn't even matter! We stayed in room 311 (nice size) and although the walls are thin, the location more than made up for any inconvenience. The vaporetto stop is right around the corner. Also, the bar downstairs is very reasonably priced, compared with other places in Venice. We ate a restaurant not far from the hotel called Tavernetta San Marurizio and it was spectacular! Their number is 041.5285240. It is between San Marco Squate and the Accademia. We would highly recommend this place for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “lovely time in venice -Hotel Ala great location”
Reviews.Author: smileyMerseyside
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location close to resturants,vaporetto stop,brillant when you are wheeling suitcases and the many attractions we all come to venice to see. Room was cosy but had everything one could want,very clean and tidy.We had a lovely terrace to,and because it was our anniversary they left complimentary fruit and a lovely mug in the shape of a heart---vey nice touch.They couldnt have been more helpful We would definately recommend this hotel and if we ever come back to venice would stay here again Breakfast great too.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience - Loved the Hotel Ala !”
Reviews.Author: Bridget_from_Oz
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ala was one of the highlights of my trip to Italy last year. It is in a great location being a short walk from the Piazza San Marco and the Basilica di San Marco. It has a team of amazing warm and friendly staff who are on hand to assist whenever you need them. We felt so welcome from the moment we checked in, and the staff (including cleaning, catering, office, reception staff and management) were just wonderful. The price was reasonable for this area, however when you add the amazing service and very comfortable facilities, we believe that we got very good value for our money. We had a room on the canal which was wonderful (as it seemed to be one of the canals favoured by the gondoliers.) Our room was clean, comfortable and a good size for a European hotel room. The bathroom was spacious. The price while not budget, was reasonable, and the service was amazing which gave good value for our money. It is surrounded by shops, delis and restaurants and is just not far from anywhere. It is only 50 metres from the vaporetto stop â€œMaria del Giglioâ€�, so is easy to access by the cityâ€™s public transport system, but you can also walk nearly everywhere from the hotel as well. It has a nice bar downstairs, and offers a very generous breakfast, with an excellent range of good quality food (both hot and cold) to choose from. I am planning a return trip to Venice later this year and have already booked my room at the Hotel Ala, as I would not even consider any other hotel. I highly recommend this Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “It is the perfect hotel for us”
Reviews.Author: thornapple45
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Hotel Ala for the last 15 years -- a month at the time, summer and winter. We are always happy to arrive and sad to leave. We love the staff. They are so helpful, cheerful, well-trained and so "Venetian". We can't wait to go back. Marie and Doug Jackson

Reviews.Title: “room like a pigeon coup”
Reviews.Author: dublintravelller
Reviews.Content: check-in was fantastic, staff were friendly, 8 of us booked and paid for 4 twin rooms. 6 arrived and 2 of us agreed to take the rooms on our own. three of the rooms were great with full bathroom. i however got a tiny room with the bed pushed up against the wall. No room to move with a half bathroom. It was the same price as my friends and if my roommate had turned up it could not have accomodated us. No excuse was offered at all. However breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: sweetpea3011
Reviews.Content: Great location - 5 mins away from San Marco, clean as ever, great fast, great amenities offered in the room (eg, shaving razor, etc). Staff extremely helpful. Bed turned down every night and even twice a day sometimes!! I would def. recommend this hotel. There was not one thing that I can criticise about. Thanks for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, good location”
Reviews.Author: Megan_Chittenden
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a night in Hotel Ala in December. The hotel was very easy to find, about 200m from the Santa Maria del Giglio water taxi stop. I think we must have booked our room on a special offer, because it was a lot more than what we were expecting for the rates we paid. The room was quite luxurious, very large and comfortable with a lovely en-suite bathroom. The breakfast spread was fantastic! The hotel is in a great location, close to Saint Marks and the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel near St Mark's Square”
Reviews.Author: LoveItaly9
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel near St Mark's Square. Hotel was clean and well looked after. The staff very helpful and gave lots of good suggestions and tips. The room was small but nicely decorated and had a beautiful Venician glass chandelier as did the main enterance to the hotel. There was a good selection of food from the breakfast buffet. There's no restaurant within the hotel but there were lots of lovely places to eat near by for lunch and evening meals. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Hot Chocolate!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LOUCascais
Reviews.Content: Although I stayed at another Best Western Hotel while in Venice with my husband, one day on our way to the Opera (La Traviatta) we made te right decision: we stopped for a drink at the Hotel Ala + Tarnowskaâ€™s American Bar. During our vacation, we found this place to be an absolute MUST in Venice! You have to try the best Hot Chocolate in the world, and this comes from a "chocoholic"!!!!!! It is an unforgettable experience and the staff was extremely pleasant, enjoy, you won't regret it!!!!! Lourdes Fernandes, Cascais, Portugal

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kamaljani
Reviews.Content: I had visited this hotel on recommendation from my friend...I loved the hotel as it was in my budget and it was a best western property..The location of the hotel and the services rendered by the staff were excellent..Though the rooms are small they were comfortable and clean..Breakfast was wonderful too..!! I enjoyed my stay at Hotel Ala and would love to go there once again..!!

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: VancouverRetirees
Reviews.Content: This is the third time that we have returned to Hotel Ala within the last five years. We stayed in the hotel in May, late October and December. We have enjoyed this hotel....its proximity to the main attractions. The hotel is tucked away in a quieter section and yet extremely convenient. We were able to return to the hotel several times a day for short rests. The No. 1 vaporetto stop at Giglio is just steps away from the hotel. The hotel is close to everything practically. The hotel rooms are comfortable. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast at the hotel is superb! We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: fbrBelgium
Reviews.Content: Good location, very interesting price/quality hotel and good service! A hotel to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful week at the Hotel Ala”
Reviews.Author: Csock
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful week's stay at the Hotel Ala in Venice, Italy from September 13 to 20. Everyone at the Hotel Ala was helpful and friendly. The staff went out of their way to make us feel at home. The rooms were lovely, the hotel was maintained at high standards and breakfast was delicious. This made our visit to Venice such a pleasant experience. We would stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly OK”
Reviews.Author: AsaBove
Reviews.Content: Conveniently positioned for La Fenice opera house, midway between Accademia Bridge and St Mark's Square. Hotel is reasonably quiet considering location. Small bedroom with similarly small, but pleasant, balcony overlooking canal - bathroom tiny. Many rooms only accessible by shortish steep staircase and longish passage before lifts are reached. Efficient service. Wide choice of fruits, cereals etc for breakfast but poor croissants. WiFi connexion expensive - 6 EU for 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel And Location”
Reviews.Author: saunter
Reviews.Content: My husband and another couple were in Venice for 2 full days before visiting other areas of Italy. We chose the Hotel Ala for location and facilities. We were very pleased with everything. Staff helpful and courteous, and we enjoyed the hotel's facilities. I believe this hotel is suitable for adults of all ages. There are no real facilities for young children. The room included breakfast, which whilst did not include a hot, cooked breakfast, was excellent otherwise, with plenty of choices, including cheeses and cold meats, and was a very satisfying start to the day. We enjoyed relaxing in their fun bar at the end of the day before going out to dinner. This is a Best Western, and if you belong to their Gold Crown Club, you will receive points for staying in this hotel. I would certainly stay there again Jill Perkins San Rafael, California

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: savannahsandy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located just off St. Marco Square. It is small enough to be cozy, near a vaporetto station as well as on a side canal where a water taxi can pick up and drop off a passenger. The rooms are more than adequate, some opening on to a lovely small piazza, and the bathrooms and amenities are great. The most special feature is the roof top terrace where we sipped chilled Italian wines with friends, over looked much of the city of Venice and listened to the evening bells of nearby churches. The staff was friendly and English was spoken. The breakfast was nice, but not served until seven which is late if one is catching an early airplane.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Ala in Venice”
Reviews.Author: PaTravelers30th
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ala was wonderful. It is a Best Western Hotel in Campo S Maria del Giglio. Only a short walk to St. Mark's square. The hotel is a former palace built in the 1700's. with all the modern conveniences. The staff was very friendly and helpful and all spoke very good English. The room was ready when we arrived at 10:00 A.M. The room we were given was on the 2nd floor. It had a small balcony we could step out on and watch the gondolas below us. The ceiling was painted with a mural and had a Murano glass chandelier. It is close to many restaurants and shopping. The breakfast was included in the room price and was very good. A wide selection of fruit, meats, cheese, eggs and pasteries, coffee, teas, milk and juices. The breakfast room was very pretty and the staff very nice. The bar was very nice located on the first floor. The seating area off the lobby had a fireplace and comfortable chairs. If using the water taxi make sure they bring you to the door of the hotel on the small canal. I would highly recommend this hotel. Great hotel good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfying experience”
Reviews.Author: dezdemona
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ala for 6 nights at the beginning of July and I admit that our overall impression was very positive. The location is excellent. The rooms are not too big but very clean and there's everything you need. Insulation is good too and aircon is working fine. Staff was very friendly and helpfull, which is not often the case in Italy and rather rare in such a touristy spot like Venice. Breakfast buffet was included in the room rate and was very nice and plentiful. At check out the person at the reception drew my attention to the fact that I had paid 50 Euro too much when booking and reimbursed me on the spot. That was very nice indeed. Would definitely return there ( if the price is right of course ).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeenthereCanada
