Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Hotel Ala during our recent trip to Venice. We found the location was ideal . . . within a five minute walk to San Marco Square. Upon arrival, we were greeted by the friendly staff and accompagnied to our room which was nice & cool. The fact that the air-condition was already 'on' was appreciated given the fact that it was very hot outside. The room was a good size and very clean. Every morning, a breakfast was available to us (included in the price). The 'spread' offered a variety of foods . . . eggs, toast, muffins, fruit, cheese, yogourt, etc. Once ready to start our day, the front desk staff was at hand to help out with directions and/or arrangements. The hotel management really 'cared' for their guests . . . We would like to recommend Hotel Ala to anyone who enjoys a quiet, clean, friendly environment as well as very reasonably priced !!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Margarita51
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times now and have enjoyed the comfortable rooms, friendly staff and convenient location very much. The rooms are generally spacious and clean although the beds could be more comfortable. If your room overlooks the canal, you may hear gondoliers singing as they go past, while the bells of Santo Stefano chime nearby. The buffet breakfast is generous and varied and really sets you up for the day: very useful in a city where the better restaurants tend to be expensive. Location is very convenient: a short walk from St Mark's and a stone's throw from La Fenice opera house. I found the staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy Venice from a Great Place”
Reviews.Author: SailAwayFL
Reviews.Content: Recently my family and I (10 people/5 rooms) spent two nights in this excellent hotel. We were warmly greeted on arrival, our special requests were quickly accommodated and we were escorted to our rooms. Our rooms were clean, spacious and with all amenities expected in an outstanding hotel. The staff was gracious and helpful at all times. The big treat was that all of our rooms looked out on the canal which featured singing gondoliers in the late afternoon and early evening. The breakfast buffet was another welcome amenity. It offered a great variety of delicious foods. Our Murano tour guide that met us at the hotel commented on the central location convienient to the Rialto, St. Marks and other famous sites. It is also next to a Vaporetto stop and one of the major gondola sites. To top it off, the hotel has a direct access on a canal allowing the water taxis and private boats to pull right up to the lobby (no shlepping luggage). All in all, we had a superb hotel experience at a very reasonable rate. Thanks again to the staff of Hotel Ala for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convienent location, clean, but little expensive”
Reviews.Author: david_sTennesse
Reviews.Content: As everyone mentioned its a great location, close to San Marco and other attractions. It was also very easy to find just follow the hotel directions, from the San Giglio vaperetto stop ( I read a lot of horror stories about finding the hotel for some of the other ones). The hotel room was small (like most places in Venice I suppose), but it was clean and comfortable and tastefully decorated ... if all you need is a clean and comfortable place I think this is a little overpriced ... but if you are getting good rates its a great option and probably a good bet for a first time visitor staying only for a day or two. We paid 170 Euro/night for Queen room, and we had room with canal view, I think view of the piazza is better. Like most hotels in Italy the breakfast is part of the deal, but I think this was one of the better ones we had during our trip - good choice of meats, eggs, cheese, fruits, bread etc, and great coffee. I would definetly recommend this hotel, but if you are willing to look around my guess is you can find better value in Venice. For a longer stay I think you can stay a little further away and walk or take the vaperetto.

Reviews.Title: “Our third stay at Hotel Ala and not the last!!”
Reviews.Author: Lover-of-Travels
Reviews.Content: It is always wonderful to return and find a hotel just as welcoming and comfortable! We had a great three nights in a lg room overlooking the square - clean, comfortable, with good pillow and a good shower!! It meets my criteria each visit. The breakfast buffet is so good that one does not need much at noon. The location to walk from the vaporretto is perfect. It had been 3 years since our last stay and I hope to return in a few years as Venice is a favorite city of mine. The staff is always helpful and polite too.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: AriusDax
Reviews.Content: Single rooms clean but the size of a shoebox. No help from front desk people. Generally rude and unaccommodating. Make sure you know exactly where you are going from the hotel and how you are going to get there because they will not be helpful, and generally act as if you are a burden to be there. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families: 2nd time in 4 years with 8 year olds”
Reviews.Author: WeGoMama
Reviews.Content: We were delighted to return to this well-situated hotel (near to St. Mark's Plaza, the Accademia and the Rialto). Our kids loved the water taxi up to the hotel, the peaceful campo where they could play and our spacious room (that could accomodate a visit by another family of 4 and a fun game of chess). We had 4 year olds the first time we came and were thrilled with our quad room where the kids could nap in the afternoon as virtually all light could be filtered out. The windows were so high that kids were safe. On our next visit we'll look forward to two rooms; one with a water view! This quad had a real king bed (called a 'matrimonial' here and not twin beds pushed together); the kids had twins nearby. The kids were happy to have their nightly bath in the tub yet we could shower. The staff here was fabulous: our housekeeper was always pleased to see us, the front desk always helpful and the breakfast room servers promptly brought (really tasty) hot cocoa for the kids. When we left critical clothes in one of the drawers, both housekeeping and the front desk got a package to us in Milan in 3 days! We love this place and came at the recommendation of another family that liked it, too.

Reviews.Title: “Ala was worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Arden92
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location is excellent. From the train station you have to take the #1 vaporetta boat, which lets you off at the Giglio dock, about 75 yards from the front door, that overlooks a modest but picturesque square. St. Marks Square and the Accademia Bridge are short walks and many distinctive and enjoyable neighborhoods are nearby. The rooms are small, but clean and comfortable. Our standard double room was a smoking room (as are all standard rooms in this hotel) but they moved us after the first night to a non-smoking room with a view of a minor canal that had a lot of gondoliers, many that sang. They also have boats that take you over to Murano, and pull right up to the back door. Noise level within the hotel room at night was quiet. Common areas were tasteful, the breakfast was excellent and the staff was very friendly and professional. And the location was excellent (did I say that already?).

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Newgrumps
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay. The hotel is indeed only 5 minutes walk from San Marco (St. Marks Square). You can access the hotel via a small passage way from the Vaporetto stop Santa Maria Del Giglio and it does only take about 3 minutes. The breakfast was full, but not full English, the only warm food being, boiled or scrambled eggs or omelettes. However the rest of the breakfast was extremely good and with plenty of choice. The room was presented to a high standard. Although the bathroom was a little tight for space, it was scrupiously cleaned every day. The staff were friendly, spoke good English and nothing was too much trouble. In all a very good hotel and a very pleasant stay. We would certainly return again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved It”
Reviews.Author: phillipsshay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a gem! My mom and I stayed at this hotel May 18 thru May 22, 2008. We purposely booked a deluxe room that opened up to the canal after reading reviews here. We stayed in room 275. It was extremely clean, very roomy, and the bathroom was decorated with marble "accessories". There was plenty of counter space (which I love) and the bathroom was very functional. I love a hard bed and the mattress was rock hard. The canal view was of a less traveled canal, but it was still beautiful. The hotel was in a great location and within close walking distance to St. Mark's Square. It was very quiet at night. I would DEFINITELY stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Hotel in the Lagoon”
Reviews.Author: benoit908
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights during a bit of an Italy tour. First thing I should mention is GO TO VENICE! It is unparalled to any other city and certainly doesn't disappoint. Be careful where you stay in Venice and read the location carefully. Venice also covers mainland Italy and staying there would leave a fair commute to the sights everyday. Hotel Ala is a 3 star Deluxe although I can't see how. It is up there with the rest of them and there are only a handful of 4 and 5 stars anyway and they are expensive!!! We stayed in a Deluxe Room and it is worth the upgrade. Instead of 220 euros per night for a standard room it was 260 euros. When you pay that much for a room you may aswell stretch a bit more for a bigger room. Venice is extremely expensive. Rooms, drinks, food, gondoliers, taxis souvenirs etc. The only thing reasonable is the waterbus which is a god send at 16 euros for 24 hour travelcard to anywhere. A gondolier will set you bet about 80 euros for a 45 min tour which seems strangley worth it as you see places you can only get to on a gondolier. Our water taxi airport tranfer was about 90 euros but, again, bearing in mind it was 45 mins on a speedboat, it was relatively good value (In San Marco Sq, 2 club sandwiches and a tea and a wine was 63 euros!!). It is probably the best city I have ever been to and I doubt anyone would regret going. Just remember to bring the credit card!! Hotel Ala is seconds from San Marco Sq and has a taxi, gondolier and bus stop about 50m away as it is just set back from the Grand Canal. I would recommend it. Remember, all the hotels are old and the rooms everywhere are small. The main differences in Venice hotels is the location. One tip - with a deluxe, you pretty much have a choice of canal view or the jacuzzi. We chose the jacuzzi. Bit of a mistake. It is rubbish and we would have probably enjoyed the view better.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Torcello
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the Ala and are now regular visitors. It is a good central hotel with a delightful bar for those sgroppinos and limoncellos after a meal at the many restaurants in the vicinity. They have a lot of single rooms and some with canal views although you will probably have to lean out of the window to see it., The breakfast is very good with a lot of choice. Avoid the filter coffee have either cappaccino or the hot chocolate. The staff are helpful and will book restaurants for you. It is only a short walk down a narrow alley to the S. Maria d Giglio vaporetto stop which is a huge bonus if you have a heavy case.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located, clean and fab breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: shamaw148
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located near enough to St.Mark's Square, but not too near to be hassled by the noise. It is extremely easy to find - take the water taxi to the Giglio stop and walk through the small alley (it is the only way you can go, without ending up in the water!) - the hotel is located at the end of the alley! St. Mark's Square is about a 5-10 mins walk away - depending on the route you take. Gondolas are available from just around the corner. The rooms are extremely clean and tidy. We had quite a tiny room - though we had a view of the canal (which was a great trade-off) - but the rooms are tastefully decorated and very well organised. The breakfast is delicious - everything including fresh fruit, eggs, pastries, toast, tea, coffee...and if you want a cappuccino or espresso they happily make it for you - without any additional cost! With regard to food and gelatos (Italian ice cream) - try restaurants further away from St. Mark's square for more reasonable rates. Be careful as many restaurants put a cover charge and service charge on your bill for dinner. Would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Ala”
Reviews.Author: GaeilgeIreland
Reviews.Content: My friends and I (six of us in total) have just returned from a wonderful trip to Venice, while this was my third visit to this wonderful city I had never stayed in Venice my previous two visits were day trips. My five friends had never been so I was the tour guide. I booked the hotel after reading some very positive reviews on the internet. They were all true we were all so pleased with the Hotel, its location is perfect just a short walk from the Water taxi (on arrival) and we were picked up again by water taxi on departure from the back door of the Hotel. It is beside San Giglio and overlooks a lovely square to the front and the canals to the rear. We were awoken each morning by singing gondoliers going past with tourists in their gondolas. The staff were courteous and friendly and very helpful, we had booked three rooms and on discovering that two of the rooms overlooked the canal I asked to change my room so that I could also overlook the canal, they couldn't change on the night we arrived but changed it for me the next morning the staff helped us move across the hallway and anything we asked for we got extra pillows etc. Breakfast was delightful with so much to choose from. The front desk staff helped us with directions and gave us the names of some lovely restaurants, we went to the Al Assassini a short walk away close to the Fenice Theatre, this was a find, we went there everynight. We had cocktails in the bar and had so much fun, the bar man joined in helping us choose cocktails. All in all I can say that each of us highly recommend this hotel, for convenience, service, and friendliness

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Simchok
Reviews.Content: This may be a little late, but I realized that I had forgotten to rate this hotel (we travelled for 6 weeks and stayed at 4 different spots). It is truly in a great location, the breakfast was superb, and service was equally wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: readingcoach
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a gem! It was a perfect location, just steps from the vaporetto stop at San Giglio and a few minutes walk to St. Marks Square and the Academia and Peggy Guggenheim Museums. The room was tiny, but the service was wonderful and charming. Each evening the maid came in to close the shutters and take the bed down (even pj's were laid out!) Everything was immaculate and in the bathroom the toiletries were replaced daily. One thing you should know...there is only a stall shower (no tub) and it is very small. The brerakfast was the best we had in Italy and that is really saying something! Aside from the uusal cheeses, meats, and croissants, there were tomatoes and mozarella, scrambled and soft-boiled eggs, many cheeses, fruit salad, sliced fruit (pineapple, cantaloupe) as well as whole fruits. We didn't need to eat again until late in the afternoon! I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Venice. We got a fabulous non-refundable internet rate so it was very reasonable in a very expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Venice at Hotel Ala”
Reviews.Author: euroroverReading_UK
Reviews.Content: We throughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Ala. It is in a great location, situated on the peaceful Campo Santa Maria del Giglio. It is a 30 minute boat transfer from the main railway station and 2 minute walk from the boat stop. It is ideal for exploring the San Marco area of Venice. The hotel was clean and tidy, the rooms a good size and very comfortable. Whilst there is no restaurant, this does not matter as there are plently of restaurants nearby and the hotel does provide breakfast which was excellent, with plenty of choice. There is a nice bar in the hotel, with live music, great way to finish off a busy day. We cannot recommend the hotel highly enough and would certainly not hesitate in staying at the same place the next time we visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot for venice”
Reviews.Author: LIVETOTRAVEL8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good. clean. enough space. The breakfast included was better than some others in europe. the hotel were very helpful in ringing tours for us and finding tours for us. Hint is to do the Doges palace with audio guide yourself. to get into the secrets tour is so hard. The tour to murano burano and torcello is great. Look for the person with tour sign near the buildings not at the bridge. This location was excellent to be into all of the venetian streets. excellent spot. Also book gondola tour when you are there. barter and then able to do on your own.

Reviews.Title: “Most uncomfortable beds in the world!!”
Reviews.Author: Pauline_1
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed here for 4 nights from 30th Dec. I booked a deluxe room. When we arrived the 1st room we were given was the standard room that is pictured on their website! I told the men on reception I had booked a deluxe room and not a standard, they then sent us to room 273, which was also clearly not a 'deluxe' room. So again I complained and was told the hotel was fully booked and I would have to ask tomorrow (New Years Eve?!) if another room was free. We just gave up and took room 273. It had the hardest bed I have ever had the misfortune of sleeping in, seriously it was terrible! The pillows were equally hard, it really was terrible. The breakfast was ok, nothing special - very runny scrambled eggs. The location was ok too, a few minutes walk to St Marks Sq. We had an absolutely fabulous time in Venice, but I would not stay at this hotel again, I was so glad to get home into my comfy bed and get a decent nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Adriaan_Leuven
Reviews.Content: We had the luck to enjoy a three night stay at the hotel Ala in Venice (member of the Best Western group), near to the Santa Maria del Giglio, a ten minutes walk away from the magnificent Piazzo San Marco, but evenso from the Rialto bridge. One cannot imagine a better place to stay to explore the mysterious venetian alleys. We stayed in room #495 on the top floor of the hotel. To be honest the room was tiny, with only one window beyond our reach, but we didn't care that much because when on a city-trip we don't spend that much time in the hotelroom anyway. More importantly was for us the peace and quietness at night of the room. We had three wonderfull nights of sleep, not interrupted by other hotel guests, people on the street or singing gondelieri. In addition - and as important as the quietness - was the cleanliness: the room was spotless in every way. In the morning there was an extensive breakfast buffet and we even had a (limited) turn down service. Because we spent New Year's eve in Venice, hotel Ala even surprised us and all other guests with a bottle of delicious prosecco, to start 2008 in a good way. Summarized: we would definitely recommend this hotel. Good value for prize.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good value”
Reviews.Author: Nell2
Reviews.Content: We had the luck to enjoy a three night stay at the hotel Ala in Venice (member of the BestWestern group), near to the Santa Maria del Giglio, a ten minutes walk away from the magnificent Piazzo San Marco, but evenso from the Rialto bridge. One cannot imagine a better place to stay to explore the mysterious venetian alleys. We stayed in room #495 on the top floor of the hotel. To be honest the room was tiny, with only one window beyond our reach, but We didn't care that much because when on a city-trip we don't spend that much time in the hotelroom anyway. More importantly was for us the peace and quietness at night of the room. We had three wonderfull nights of sleep, not interrupted by other hotel guests, people on the street or singing gondelieri. In addition - and as important as the quietness - was the cleanliness: the room was spotless in every way. In the morning there was an extensive breakfast buffet and we even had a (limited) turn down service. Because we spent New Year's eve in Venice, hotel Ala even surprised us with a bottle of delicious prosecco, to start 2008 in a good way. Summarized: we would definitely recommend this hotel. Good value for prize.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ANGELA,GREECE
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Venice we did book one Triple room in the price of 170 euro per night with the breakfast included in the price The location was excellent (really close to Saint Marcos Square) the breakfast was lovely the rooms and bathroom in good size and very clean Venice is a magical Place I will definitely stay here again in my next visit in Venice â€¦

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel In Venice”
Reviews.Author: WillieC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ala for one night, November 17, 2007 prior to departing on a cruise. We were quite happy with the hotel and would stay again with no hesitation. We arrived in Venice by air and used the water bus service from the airport to San Marco stop. From there it was a short walk, with only two bridges to cross, to the hotel. Finding the hotel was quite easy. The location of Hotel Ala is ideal, allowing for a short and direct walk to San Marco as well as easy access to all parts of central Venice. The hotel itself is very pleasant, with a very attractive lobby, nice public rooms, and a pleasant looking bar attached. We were unable to use the bar since there was a private party there the night we stayed. The hotel also has lifts which makes transport of luggage much easier. The hotel appears to have two wings. We were in the wing to the north of the lobby which does not appear to be as ornate as the other wing, but was still quite nice. The room was quite large, with a queen size bed, good sized bathroom, and nice linens. The view out of the two windows (this was a corner room) was very good. Everything in the room appeared to be newly redone. The inclusion of a digital safe was a big plus. We had no complaints about the room at all. The included breakfast is a very large spread and even included scrambled eggs. The rest was pretty typical European breakfast buffet with cheeses, meats, yogurts, cereal, breads, etc. Over all a very substantial breakfast and quite good. We were able to skip lunch thanks to the hearty breakfast. The staff was very friendly and most spoke good English. They were quite helpful in suggesting local places to dine (we used on of the recommended places and were very happy with it). In summary Hotel Ala is a very good place to stay in Venice and offers pleasant rooms, good staff and an excellent breakfast. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ala never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: Jackaleen
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I've stayed at Hotel Ala, beginning in 1994. The location is perfect (right at a traghetto stop) and easily walkable to many tourist destinations. The staff is helpful and the rooms spacious and clean. Great breakfast, too.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, comfortable hotel. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Disgusted17
Reviews.Content: The Ala is a charming and comfortable hotel. The rooms and common areas are very clean and smart. The room servicing staff are very efficient and courteous. Our room was in the "Deluxe" category, a little more expensive than we normally pay in Venice, we did get a private terrace (quite rare in Venice) although the view wasn't up to much (the canal was 4 floors down!), we could hear the tenors singing in the gondolas below. The room was a little small and overfurnished, the bed was large and very comfortable. The bathroom was smart & was equipped with a Jacuzzi! The breakfast is the best that we've had in Venice, I had to be dragged away from it! The location of the hotel is excellent, close to the SM Giglio bus stop - not too far to drag the bag. An easy walk to both the Rialto & San Marco. To summarise - Good points: well run, clean, good location, in our opinion good value. Drawbacks: small rooms?, more expensive than some.

Reviews.Title: “Close To St. Mark's Square”
Reviews.Author: mlcw
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location close to St. Marks Square and shops along the canals. The hotel was recently renovated and the room was spacious and clean. The bathroom was a bit tight, but it did have a very nice shower. Our room overlooked a small square, but it was surprisingly quiet despite weekend crowds. Staff were very helpful and courteous. Breakfast was very good with lots of choices and fresh food. All in all, a very nice, moderately priced hotel for this very pricey city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travelman2107
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Ala for 3 nights. The location is very convenient. Just a few steps to vaporetto stop, not even 10 mins. walk to San Marco Square. Nevertheless far enough away from the big crowds, very quiet at night. Many nice restaurants nearby, e.g on Campo di Santo Stefano. The rooms are not really new, but in good shape with clean bathrooms. Counter staff is friendly and helpful. If you want to see a Murano glass factory ask for the courtesy motor boat trip. Breakfast is opulent with good quality and may take you through the whole day. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our second vist and would come again”
Reviews.Author: bennybear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ã�la a few years ago prior to a cruise that left out of Vence. Our experience at that time led to us booking with them this past summer. The staff at the hotel are extremely friendly and helpful. Many that were there two years ago were there again to greet us. If you wish to go to Murano to vist the glass factorys they arrange a water taxi at no cost to you. The breakfast buffet is wonderful with fresh juices, fruit and artisanal breads and pastries, to cold meats and many different cheeses. The hotel is very well located and easy to get to off of the water bus, with no stairs or brides is you have luggage and from there Venice is at your doorstep. You can hear the gondolieris singing fomr your room off of the small canals by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice!”
Reviews.Author: Yasmina72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at BW Ala Hotel, for 5 nights; we booked on bestwestern,om site, it was an "one day promotion"; the room was nice, but small, and very, very clean; we had all the confort we needed, too much for 3 stars, they should have 4! breakfast-very good, staff-very friendly and always ready to help!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our location and adorable corner room”
Reviews.Author: sabrejobs
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice by ship and had our bags brought to our hotel from the pier by a private luggage handling company....a very wise decision. We then took the ship's shuttle to St. Mark's Sq. and walked to the Hotel Ala which was a very pleasant 1/4 mile walk from the Sq. Great location. We had a 2nd floor corner room with shutters and a fireplace and lovely bathroom. We opened the shutters to find a lovely small canal where gondolas passed frequently under our own walking bridge below us. We loved the hotel. The front desk people packed us a breakfast to go in the morning because our flight left before the dining room opened. The only hardship was walking all our bags over 3 bridges to St. Mark's Sq. There's a boat stop right at the hotel, but they couldn't be sure a boat would stop there at 4:45A. Taxi's are very expensive and the shuttle was only about 10 Euros, about 1/10th the price of a taxi. I would highly recommend this hotel for it's great location, the very helpful staff and the relatively reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted in a Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malaga97
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed at in Italy, and it was wonderful! I can't believe it only gets two stars! We have stayed at many hotels, and we would say this gets a definite 3, probable 4, stars by U.S. standards. After taking two boats from the airport, it was only a two minute walk up a little alleyway right into the cute piazza where the hotel is. The facade and lobby are small but very nicely appointed and cared for. The front desk was friendly enough (especially for Italians!). We could only access our room by small elevator and a short staircase, but the porter was extremely helpful in assisting with luggage. We had an absolutely gorgeous room! Many beautiful furniture pieces made it a little crowded, but it worked out fine. We were delighted with the modest balcony overlooking a narrow canal and absolutely BLOWN AWAY by the huge bathroom with a TV, CD player, and enormous whirlpool tub! The location could not have been more perfect. It was extremely quiet at night, yet barely a five-minute walk to St. Mark's Square and all the shops and restaurants. Breakfast was a very nice spread of pastries, cereal, fruit, yogurt, local specialties (mozzarella, prosciutto, etc.). No restuarant, but an awesome bar wtih a great vibe and very nice drinks for surprisingly modest prices. Also there is a very nice restaurant about 20 paces from the front door with al fresco seating. My only complaints would be that the air-conditioning didn't work so great, and the pillows were very uncomfortable. (I used my travel pillow one night!) We would definitely stay here again upon returning to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: mystery mole
Reviews.Content: Touring Italy and Slovenia in July, we ended up in Venice and took advantage of the very good value 3 day deal offered by the hotel Ala - â‚¬360 for 3 nights in a deluxe room. We knew the Ala offered good value in the competitive Venice hotel market, having stayed there before 32 years ago in 1975. It was even better value on this occasion. The room was airy and spacious, with a very comfortable bed and lots of storage space. Most importantly it had excellent air conditioning and was blissfully cool - very necessary in the heat of July. It took us a while to get the hang of opening the door with the card key (you have to get the time delay just right) and remembering to hang the key on the hook just inside the door (otherwise the lights and TV donâ€™t work). We were kept entertained by the constant stream of gondolas outside our window, with their singers and musicians providing lovely background music and their passengers clicking their cameras for all they were worth. We calculated that in Venice approximately a million tourist photographs are taken every hour. The hotel is ideally placed, being a five minute walk from St Markâ€™s in one direction and from the Accademia bridge in the other. The Rialto is ten to fifteen minutes away. The Santa Maria del Giglio vaporetto stop is half a minute from the front door, as is the traghetto to Dorsoduro, which is the quickest and nicest way of getting to the Peggy Guggenheim and Accademia galleries and the Zattere along the Giudecca canal. The hotel lobby and public rooms are elegant and comfortable, and it has a lovely roof terrace, though in the fierce July heat not many people were prepared to sit there for long. Breakfast at the Ala was a real treat and one of the best we have had in any hotel, and despite the large number of people in the hotel there was always plenty of room and never any waiting. The staff on duty were hardworking, cheerful, courteous and efficient. We would thoroughly recommend the Hotel Ala and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SheilasWheels
Reviews.Content: A great friendly hotel, handy for St. Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge. Just behind the Gritti Palace hotel and easily accessible from the Grand Canal vaparetto route no. 1. The staff were very friendly and helpful, bar was good and breakfast excellent. They also had a lovely little roof terrace. Our room had a canal view (of a very small canal) and were were treated to singing gondoliers. We couldn't fault this hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Underrated Place!”
Reviews.Author: DandNSouthington_CT
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights from June 29 through July 1 and were very happy with our choice. The rooms were clean and well-furnished, the hotel itself was decorated tastefully and the staff was very helpful and friendly. The location was great for walking to the significant areas of the main island. Of the three places we stayed in Italy, this one had the best breakfast by far!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: FloridaMember
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ala is a great hotel in a great location. We walked everywhere. I'm not sure why all the reviews seem to be dated 2004, but we just got back from our stay there (6/2007) and loved it. I have trouble staying at a hotel that doesn't have a good review from Tripadvisor, so for all of you like me, this hotel gets high marks. The only problem we had was waiting for coffee at the breakfast buffet. The front desk staff was very helpful and the room was nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Tashko
Reviews.Content: For the majority of visitors Venice's joys are to be found in exploration, either by walking or by taking a boat through the canals. Therefore we rated Ala's convenient location quite high on our checklist - it is only a fine 10 minute walk away from San Marco, 50 meters from a vaporetto stop on the Grand canal and also very close to the Accademia bridge that crosses over to Dorsoduro, with its many attractions and interesting nightlife. The other high point worth mentioning is the breakfast - quite often a source of frustration in Italian hotels, this was clearly way above the country's usual offerings. We booked a deluxe room overlooking the piazza, which was of adequate size and featured a moden bathroom with a jacuzzi. We did not experience any problems with noise, and the occasional fleeting sounds of laughter or footsteps braking the eery silence and finding their way through the non-double glazed windows rather added to the charm of the experience. The hotel also featured an 'American bar' for those wishing to spent their evenings inside the hotel, but this was an option we did not pursue. We did not have much contact with the staff, but they seemed to be well organized and efficient, if not particularly warm or smiling.

Reviews.Title: “A very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bluerev
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel mid June and found all but one of the staff very helpful and friendly. As mentioned in other reviews the Hotel isn't far from San Marco Square (Just over two small bridges heading towards the Accademia bridge). We arrived by the No. 82 Vapporetto and got off at the Square about twenty minutes from the railway station and walked about 5/7 minutes and the hotel was right in front of us. If arriving from Treviso airport take the Linea 6 bus (a small bus stop to the right and on the same side of the airport terminal) to Treviso railway station and ask for Venice Santa Lucia station. The rooms were not that small, afterall we were only sleeping there and how much room do you need just to sleep. Of the rooms we had, one over looked the square and the other a canal. The square was not noisy and in the canal room we didn't suffer from mosquitoes, we just used the air conditioning. The air conditioning went on the blink but it was fixed with no fuss and very quickly so this cannot be faulted in any way. The breakfast is self service (one american lady didn't seem to understand the concept of this) and had plenty to choose from. The one thing that let the place down was asking for a hot chocolate in the bar. The barperson decided to tell us that it was summer and that the chocolate was hot and therefore it was not a summer drink (hot coffee and hot tea anyone!) just a minor quibble but if we wanted to pay for a hot chocolate that was mentioned on the menu then surely we could have one. Minor quibble apart this is genuinely an excellent hotel and the staff are very friendly and helpful but be careful of asking the bar staff (well one of them anyway) for hot chocolate in the summer. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: LoisLaneDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Ala occupying several rooms with family and friends. All the rooms were excellent. What did stand out was the service provided by all the staff from the minute we arrived to the day we all left. They were extremely patient and accommodating with any request. The breakfasts were varied and substantial, the bar cosy and welcoming. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to others and have booked again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, even greater staff”
Reviews.Author: katycox
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ala on our way to a Royal Carribbean cruise out of Venice. We had two days to see Venice. We stayed there because we had read a good review on Trip Advisor. It is a great location, a few blocks from St Mark's Square. The staff was fantastic. My husband's passport was stolen on the Vaporetto on our way to the hotel, and everyone on the staff helped us. They helped us call the Consulate in Milan, and the Embassy in Rome. They advised us as to how to get the train to Milan and how to get back. I don't know if we could have accomplished replacing his passport in one day without their help. This is the 2nd Best Western property that we have stayed in in Europe. Last year we stayed at Caen France and were very happy with that stay also.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GraceN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at the Hotel Ala for 3 nights as part of our 12 day Italian vacation in May, 2007. I booked this hotel directly on the Best Western website after reading many positive reviews on this website, and we were happy with our choice in the end. Location: I loved the location of the hotel. After we arrived at the Ferrovia train station, we bought the 3-day vaporetto pass right away. We took the #1 Vaporetto to the Santa Maria Di Giglio stop. The ride was approximately 45 minutes. After geting off the Vaporetto there was only one way to go. We passed through a narrow alley way that was less that 100 ft long, and the hotel was right in front of us. The hotel was a 5 minute walk to San Marco square, and short walks from a few other lovely squares, restaurants, cafes, shops, etc. Room: We booked a standard room at 220 Euros per night. We got a room on the 2nd floor facing the square, with a lovely flowerbox in the room window. We never took the elevator in the hotel, we walked up a short flight of stairs (which has faux-marble steps and railings) and our room was almost right at the top of the staircase. At the top of the stairs there was an interesting display of antique armor and weapons. The room was not large by any means but adequate, and it was spotlessly clean. The furnishings were fairly new and well-kept; floor was hardwood, there was a flat-panel TV. The mattress was firm; I happen to like firm mattresses, but I can see how a lot of people wouldn't like it. The pillows, however, were too firm and too overstuffed. We both woke up with neck pain and a headache (and no, the headache was not from drinking all that delicious prosecco). The bathroom was white tiles with a pretty floral tile trim and has a pretty flower shaped light fixture, again spotlessly clean. We didn't have a bathtub, only a semi-circular shaped shower enclosure. The enclosure door didn't close properly all the way and when we showered the floors got quite wet. The hairdryer was on the weak side and took a while to dry hair. The sink was a small pedestal sink and didn't have any counterspace on which to put my bath/beauty products. They mounted a cubbyhole on the wall for this purpose, but the cubbyhole was tiny and on the wall opposite of the sink, and over the toilet. I guess in general it wouldn't be a problem with most other people but I am a beauty product junkie and this was a minor inconvenience that I could deal with. Breakfast: Too bad we never got a chance to go to the bar in the evenings or got a chance to go to the roof-top terrace. We did have breakfast there every morning. The selection was large: there was a good assortment of breads, cheeses, cold-cuts, olives, peppers, cereals, fruits, eggs, etc. The pastry was from an outside bakery, the croissants were kept gently warm, and it was delicious. Of the 3 days that I was at this hotel I never ran out of new choices at breakfast. The coffee was dreadful, however, extremely weak and no coffee taste or aroma at all. Cappuccino can be ordered at additional cost. Staff: The staff were helpful and polite. The front desk were efficient and made good recommendations for restaurants. They almost always had a smile. The housekeeping staff worked hard, and even though we only had a standard room, the beds were turned down in the evening. Overall, we were very satisfied with this hotel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel , location, and staff!”
Reviews.Author: normawahl
Reviews.Content: I booked 4 rooms for 9 family members for 3 nights and we all agreed this was a wonderful hotel. It is very easy to get to from the vaporetto stop and is a pleasant stroll away from Saint Mark's Square. The breakfast was very good with alot of fresh fruit, cheeses, yogurt, and breads. My only complaint would be that the pillows were as hard as rocks! We all had good size rooms. I would definately recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great!”
Reviews.Author: ITCruisesVP
Reviews.Content: Went with a group of friends (13 in total) May 8th for 1 night before a cruise. I was a little hesitant about which vaporetto to use to get us to the resort, but it ended up being very easy (the #1 vaporetto - 6 euros from Piazzale Roma). The hotel is just at the end of a narrow alleyway and is very well situated in relation to St. Mark's Square, Rialto Bridge, etc. The front desk guys were very helpful. We had some strange electrical problems in the room. A lamp was knocked over and this caused all the lights to go out in the room, but the bellman flicked the breaker down the hall and all was well. Then, the next morning, the light bulb above the sink just decided to drop out of its socket, but they replaced it right away and flicked the breaker again! For those of you not used to small European hotels, they want you to drop off the key before you leave for the day, and they'll give it back to you when you return. You wouldn't want to carry it with you anyway...it's huge! The elevators are REALLY tiny (somehow we fit two large men, one small bellman, and a suitcase and it was TIGHT) and the hotel floors are split in two, so you may have friends staying on the same floor but you can't get to their room unless you go to the lobby and go up the other side. Quirky but not a big deal. Be SURE to check out the rooftop patio...it is a wonderful retreat and there is a phone up there if you want to order breakfast. There is also a small bar area that is very comfortable just off the lobby. An example of prices - a gin and tonic was 8 euros. The bartender was very helpful in recommending a local restaurant and it was very good. The breakfast buffet was very good, too, and was included in our rate. I haven't mentioned the room...we checked out everyone's room in our group...they were all different...we had one triple in the group and it didn't appear to be very comfortable, but our double room was just right. Antique furniture and situated right above a canal with serenading gondolas passing by at night (room 275). The shower was very powerful and bathroom very nice and clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who would like a comfortable, easy to get to hotel, who doesn't require opulence, just comfort and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: jml5q
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from March 17-21. We had a double superior room for 130 euros per night. I had requested a balcony and we had a good sized balcony on the 5th floor overlooking a small canal on the back side of the hotel. The room was a little small, but had plenty of room to walk around and put our stuff everywhere. The room was nice, comfy bed, flat screen TV, decent size bathroom with good water pressure. The only downside was that the room was quite warm at night. We had to open our windows at night to circulate air and got eaten alive by mosquitoes. The hotel does provide mosquito repellent wipes which helped some, but definitely bring your bug spray with DEET in it! Iâ€™m sure this mosquito issue would have been the same at any hotel in Venice though, so I canâ€™t hold that against the hotel. The location of the hotel was great. Right off a vaporetto stop and a 5 minute walk to San Marco Square, 5 minute walk to Accademia Bridge, and 10 minute walk to Rialto. From our hotel we were able to walk everywhere. This hotel was definitely a great value for the money and Iâ€™d stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Praise for hotel Ala”
Reviews.Author: simplemind
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the hotel Ala March 28 for 3 nights. We were nicely surprised by the standard and location of the hotel (opposite Gritty Palace and minutes from San Marco square).Get off at the Giglio vaparetto stop as its only 20 seconds to the hotel door. We took our insect repellent plug in, for use in room and were not troubled by mosquitos(we had a canal view room) The breakfast was plentyfull with a good choice and friendly staff on hand if anything was needed. We had a great stay in a clean comfortable hotel in a good location

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bosox2004
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here in October 2006, having reserved on the internet before our arrival a deluxe room with a request for a room overlooking the canal. As requested, we got a room on the narrow canal next to the hotel with French doors opening onto a small balcony. This canal is used by many gondoliers, so we not only saw a parade of gondolas gliding below us, but were serenaded by singers and accordion players in some of them, too. It was a quintessential Venetian experience. The lobby area of the hotel was quite nice, but our room and its furnishings seemed dated. Likewise, the bathroom and its fixtures seemed dated. Also, there is a building right across the narrow canal from the hotel which is taller than the hotel, so that our room was constantly dark, even in broad daylight. The hotelâ€™s ventilation system had been turned off, so that the only way to get air was to open the French doors. And as soon as we did that, there was always a group of mosquitoes ready to give us their own special welcome to Venice. The included breakfast buffet in a very pleasant dining room off the lobby was good and included scrambled eggs, cured meats, yogurt, cheeses, pastries, breads, fruit, juice, and cereal. Internet service was available on a computer near the breakfast room and cost about 5E per half hour. Internet cafes were hard to find and were about the same price as the hotelâ€™s computer. The location of the hotel is absolutely perfect. If you take the vaporetto, you get off at the Santa Maria del Giglio stop and walk straight down a narrow sidewalk between two buildings. After about 50-100 yards, the sidewalk opens to a small piazza, and hotel is on your left. Itâ€™s a fairly leisurely 10-15 minute walk to Piazza San Marco and about the same to the Accademia Bridge, Accademia Museum and Peggy Guggenheim Museum. A 20 minute walk will get you to the Rialto Bridge and the fish and produce market. We were right in the middle of everything we wanted to see and do in Venice. We found the staff to be very friendly, and they were very helpful in suggesting restaurants. We enjoyed both of their dinner recommendations. We also found a terrific salumeria near the hotel, where we bought outstanding prosciutto naturale with pecorino cheese sandwiches for our train ride to Florence. On our last visit to Venice we stayed at Hotel Antiche Figure, which we feel is a much better hotel than Hotel Ala, but its location right across from the train station is too far from the things we like to see and do in Venice. At Hotel Ala we could stroll through Piazza San Marco late at night and be back in our room about 15 minutes later. Our room at Hotel Ala was the most expensive of the 12 hotels we stayed in on our 12 city visit to Western Europe and provided the least value. One bonus, however, is that since Hotel Ala is a Best Western member, we received a lot of points in our Crown Club account. We definitely want to stay in the San Marco area on our next visit but would probably not stay at Ala at the price we paid. If we were to stay at Ala again, we would request a room overlooking the piazza at the front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ala Is Good Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Al4travel
Reviews.Content: Along with anothe couple, we just returned from a five night stay at the Ala Hotel in Venice. We have good things to say about this property. The hotel is clean, the upper floor deluxe rooms are nicely furnished, and the location is excellent. The hotel is within a minute walk of the Vaperetto, five minutes from St. Marks Square, the same from the Accademia, and in a quiet part of San Marco. The provided breakfast is well above average, and the staff attended to any and all questions. Use the Best Western website to get the lowest rates, which are half the high priced hotels closer to San Marco Church. Another comment..........watch out for extremely high priced restaurants near the main square. They look good, but check the menus before proceeding. Just one concern. Our friends stayed on the canal side of the hotel, and were somewhat bothered by mosquitos. We stayed on the square side of the Ala, and never saw a mosquito the entire time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ChiT0wnTraveler
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay in Venice at the Ala Palace (although it rained every day). The rooms, though a bit on the small side, are very clean and the staff is very congenial and helpful. Just a note to those staying there in the winter - the Santa Maria del Giglio vaporetto stop (very near the hotel) is out of service in the winter. The closest one is San Marco and it's an arduous walk with luggage from the square to the hotel. The hotel has a water taxi stop at its back door, though, so the staff arranged for a water taxi to pick us up to go to the train station. That trip for 5 of us and our luggage cost $50.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: VAGreg
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ala is situated just a short walk from St Mark's Square. The rooms were very clean, the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was recently renovated and very nice - excellent water pressure. The breakfast was delicious, especially the coffee. The staff was very helpful with directions and recommendations. All in all a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what room you stay in”
Reviews.Author: artypat
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Ala many times and usually bring friends with me. This last time we were in rooms that faced a brick wall, a room in which the shower emptied into the bedroom and one that was so small, two people and their luggage didn't fit into it. Ask for superior rooms facing a canal or the square, otherwise, it is not worth the price. When you get the right room, it's a pleasant place to stay, in a good location. Nice bar downstairs. I just wish they were more consistant.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Drmaz
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from spending 3 nights in the Hotel Ala and will certainly stay there again on my next visit to Venice. Located literaly a stones throw from the vaporetto stop Santa Maria Del Giglio (Line 1) it is ideally located for exploring the back waters that lead to the Rialto, St. Mark's and the thaetres and galleries around Accademia. Our room was luxuriously furnished (Flat screen TV, minibar and wireless internet connection included), stylishly decorated with many typical Venetian features and very very clean. As with the majority of hotels in Venice the bedrooms are quite small, but high ceilings and large patio doors give a feeling of space and ensure that the rooms are bright and fresh. The bathroom was compact but had a bidet and power shower. Towels and bed linen were changed every day. Bathrobes, slippers and the usual toiletries were provided.Coffee making and ironing facilities were available on request. There are numerous comfortable public sitting areas and a nice bar in the lobby all decorated with fine individual pieces of art. An extensive selection of hot and cold food was provided at breakfast. All in all a very good hotel that I would recommed to anyone. It is worth noting thought that not all rooms are accessible by lift but ask at time of booking and lift access will be accomodated.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: C.petersen
Reviews.Content: We took the #1 Vaporetto from the train station to the Santa Maria del Giglio Stop then walked down the narrow lane just a few hundred yards to the hotel. No carting luggage over large distances or bridges! The hotel was charming with a beautiful entrance way, nice rooms with a complete bath and a fabulous morning breakfast buffet. There is also a rooftop terrace you should check out and a lobby side bar with entertainment at night. The Piazza San Marco is just a few minutes walk away and there are other piazzas with good restaurants and cafes close by We could view one of the small canals out our bedroom window but you might find mosquitos will get you if you leave the window open too long! My husband & I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location & very good staff”
Reviews.Author: BTravl
Reviews.Content: My single rate was very good considering the location and that breakfast was included, which was very hearty. After checking out and heading away from Venice I realized I had left all my good jewelery in the safe, called immediately and housekeeping found it. The staff was so accomodating to me and shipped it back, all pieces in tact. I can't say enough about their integrity and helpfulness. I would recommend this hotel highly. One suggestion, if booking a single room you might want to upgrade to a double for more space as the single room is quite small. East Patchogue Long Island NY

Reviews.Title: “pay the extra bucks for 'superior' room”
Reviews.Author: oellen
Reviews.Content: We had a corner room and it was roomy with two big windows. We loved it. I think it's probably worthwhile to pay the extra cost for a superior room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - perfect area”
Reviews.Author: Joanna.Highet
Reviews.Content: There are so many places to stay in Venice, my husband and I were crossing our fingers that Hotel Ala would meet our expectations. We were more than pleased. Just off the beaten path, the hotel is in a prime location - not far from San Marco Square yet tucked away from the crowds of people. For a very reasonable price (approx 110 euros per night) our room had a queen bed, large bathroom with jacuzzi tub and balcony overlooking the canal. It was a great way to start off our honeymoon. The staff was also very friendly and accomodating. The drawbacks - not by any fault of the hotel - but nonetheless good to know...the canal was somewhat smelly...while beautiful on the balcony be prepared for a strange odor. Also, the mosquitos were out and both my husband and I got bit numerous times. Apparently the hotel is aware of the problem, because the room came with mosquito repelant lotion. Aside from that however, I would highly recommend this hotel. Be sure to request a room with a balcony in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Farleigh
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room at this hotel and that is exactly what I got. I am not bothered by the size of the room but just felt it was not one of their better rooms. Room 309 had a bowing floor - be careful on the way into the bathroom. You could trip! The shower had no cubicle and no shower pan. Just a drain in the floor and a shower curtain. Therefore you could slip in the bathroom very easily. Hairdryer fixed to bathroom wall and really annoying to work. When you have long hair, standing for ages makes this irritating. Saying this, it was clean and ADEQUATE. The breakfast had a great choice and couldn't be faulted. The location was superb - very easy to walk to St Marks etc, and the vaporetto was just one minute away if you felt lazy. Staff could have smiled a bit more. To be totally honest, I only paid 80 Euros per night for this room on a special offer so "got what I paid for". If I had paid anything over 100 Euros I would have been really really upset!! Make sure they give you a decent room if you are paying full whack! Tell them you do NOT want 309.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: blauner
Reviews.Content: We had a very small double room, but that is to be expected in Venice. This hotel was surprisingly easy to find; we walked off the Vaporetti at Santa Maria del Giglio, went one block straight ahead, and we were there. The ac was effective. The hotel has 80+ rooms and a bar. They served a good breakfast buffet with an assortment of foods, including eggs, ham, juice. Good location; near San Marco and Academia. Decent shower. Good light. Helpful staff. Windows overlooking the canal. We got a great deal by booking early on the Best Western website and by paying the non-refundable internet rate.

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: Member17
Reviews.Content: This is NOTHING LIKE an American Best Western. Our extended family booked five rooms and all of them were large, with balconies or large windows opening up right over a canal that had a constant stream of gondolas passing by, some with singing gondoliers. (If you book, make sure you request a room on the canal side of the hotel.) Each room was unique, including the style of the decoration on the very high ceilings, but all were furnished with beautiful antiques and completely modernized marble baths. The breakfast was the best we had in Italy, with the most delicious fresh fruit tarts, cheese-stuffed peppers, etc. etc. The hotel is right down an alley from the number 1 vaporetto (boat bus) stop on a beautiful square. San Marco is a five minute walk. The only disadvantage is that the rooms cannot accommodate a family of four, so if there are more than three of you, you have to take two rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: jholtco
Reviews.Content: The was a great little hotel, efficient staff, clean but small rooms, air conditioning struggled to keep the room cool, a great location with San Marco Square a short walk. The breakfast was outstanding(included) everything you could possible imagine from grilled peppers, fresh fruits, pate, pastries, cereal, eggs, you name it. We took the water taxi from the airport and it delivered us to the Hotels back door.

Reviews.Title: “A charming gem of a hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: wrldtraveler-7
Reviews.Content: Venice is a difficult city to navigate. If your hotel isn't near a vaporetto stop (or on a side canal,) you will most likely have to drag your luggage through meandering streets to find it. Hotel Ala is ideally located right off the Santa Maria del Giglio stop. It is a charming gem of a hotel in a renovated palace, and it has character. More importantly, it's less than a ten minute walk to Piazza San Marco. On the way, you'll pass all of the ritzy Italian designer shops like Prada, Gucci, Etro, etc. Just northwest of the hotel is a wonderful little "campo" (square," called Campo San Stefano that has some wonderful outdoor restaurants and cafes. The staff of Hotel Ala are professional and friendly. Hotel Ala deserves another star, and this little hotel certainly doesn't feel like what we, in the US, might consider a Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: Hauxwell
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay at the Hotel Ala, this is our second visit in two years and I cannot recommed it too highly. The rooms are very clean, a little on the small size but that was no problem. The reception staff are efficient, not overly friendly but to be honest I prefer it this way. Breakfast buffet is excellant, again the staff are very efficient replacing items, clearing tables etc. I feel the hotel gives really good value for money, we paid less than I would have expected in Venice. I also like the location of the hotel, it is just off the hustle and bustle of St Marks square very peaceful and tranquil but very easy to get to via the water bus, just a few yards from the stop. We will definatley be returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the Hotel Ala”
Reviews.Author: MCTozzo
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Italy. I took my 70 yr. old mother on her first trip to Europe along with some friends. We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Ala. The location is extremely convenient to everything you'll want to see in Venice. We arrived by train and took a water bus (Vaporetta) to the Giglio bus stop (one stop past the Accademia stop). The hotel is just down a small walkway / alley on the left. The staff could not have been more helpful and all spoke excellent English. The rooms were very small, but not anything you wouldn't expect in a touristy European city and were comfortable. The bathrooms were nice with small showers, but again, to be expected. There is a rooftop deck that was very pleasant. There is a Free water taxi to the glass blowing island of Murano if you arrange it through the front desk. It picks you up from the hotel's side canal entrance. You step out of the hotel and into the water taxi. They also provide a ticket for the return trip. The bar downstairs was great and the bartenders were lots of fun! We had heard that Venice can be smelly in the Summer. We did not experience this at all. But I think you should try and avoid July and August. The crowds were getting big while we were there but not terrible. Again, probably worse in mid-Summer. I would most definitely recomment this hotel and would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: acekhan
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Venice. Previously I stayed at the Best Western San Marco. After having stayed at BW San Marco I was reluctant to try another BW in Venice. We researched and found some great reviews on Hotel Ala. This hotel in my opinion has everything you would want in Venice. The hotel in VERY close to San Marco Square. It is very easy to find and has convenient canal access for water taxis. We traveled to Venice with our 2 year. Having a nice buffet breakfast was extremely helpful. The staff is actually very nice and will take time to give you directions and suggestions. We were going on a cruise from Venice so we stayed at the Ala two days before and two days after our cruise. Both times we had very nice and clean rooms. The bathrooms in the hotel are all new and very clean. The rooms are spacious for hotels in Venice. I would most likely stay at the Ala again. This is a 3 star hotel but in reality is far better than any other 3 starr hotel in Venice. The rates during summer are high but not as high as some of the other hotels. If you get bored of the San Marco area you can venture off to the Accadamia area (which is right behind the hotel). I can't really think of a downside. Don't waste your time going to Murano. The hotel offers a complimentary service to Murano but it's not worth the high pressure sales pitch you get when you arrive at the glass factory in Murano. Most if not all rooms require you to take the stairs. But don't worry the staff will help you with the luggage. Venice is a wonderful city stay at the Ala and you will get a better feel for it. Enjoy your trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Dates in Europe are reversed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In reply to one of the reviews, I just wanted to point out that dates in Europe are reversed and the day is written first then the month, which is probably why his booking was messed up. 5/4/06 is 5th April in Europe and not May 4th. Therefore, this is no reflection on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jotabecu
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in May, excellent location and front desk service, vaporetto is 50 meters away. Values is great, I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We reserved this hotel a month in advance. I logged on to the Best Western Website and entered May 4. Somehow the confirmation was transcribed to April 5. We arrived at the hotel with the information from the website showing May 4. However, their confirmation showed April 5. Consequently, we had already been charged for the hotel and they said "we could stay but the rate would not be much higher rate". The staff was exceptionally rude. They would not let us talk to the manager. In fact we waited 30 minutes to which they said the "manager was coming" and we watched him in the back room laughing. We tried to call the Best Western International Operator. Also unhelpful. When we were there, another American couple had trouble with their room and was waiting to see the manager in the lobby. They said their room was unacceptable and wanted a new room. We went back to the tourism office and found another hotel in a much better location. We were gladed we did not stay at Hotel Ala - it is actually pretty far from the main square.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ala - a gem in the heart of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Hotel Ala, and we could not have been happier. The front desk service was exceptional, and the staff was extremely accomodating. The breakfast buffet was incredible. The room we stayed in was charming, clean and comfortable. I would highly recommend this property - it is truly a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: royhasek
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. The rooms are lovely, we splurged for the canal view. The beds are large and comfortable. The bathroom is of a good size and everything is nicely decorated. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast was delicious with a good selection. The location is excellent only a few minutes walk to St. Mark's Square, 10-15 to the Rialto. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ala was much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a nice discovery! Hotel Ala is fantastically located and is very pretty. The lobby has a great chandelier, Murano glass of course, and the ones in the rooms are just as lovely. There is a well known Wine bar amongst Venesian just off the lobby. The rooms are very comfortable, very pretty and the bathroom was splendid! We found this hotel on the internet and could not believe how lucky we were finding it! Venice is a must see, and getting to rest in this hotel was just icing on the cake...

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: Tulip57
Reviews.Content: See other reviews too: hotel is great, because of the location, staff, furnishings (some rooms have nice antiques), breakfast, etc. We stayed here with a (college)student group, with a great rate through BW international.

Reviews.Title: “Underated Hotel in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: nataliatiyad
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed 3 night stay at this hotel ( 5 mins San Marco) in early March. Recently refurbished, the (smallish) rooms were clean and well attended to by the maids. Minibar prices reasonable. Bar downstairs was well priced. Hotel nicely located in quiet spot. had rooms overlooking canal. Enjoyed generous breakfasts in basement breakfast room whilst watching gondalas glide past. Roof garden not open until April. Paid Â£72 per room pernight and this was good value for central Venice. PS. avoid Harry's Bar in Venice however great the temptation.....rip off because the bar has no character - in fact it's real poky.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great City”
Reviews.Author: wwilliams3
Reviews.Content: My mother and I spent 3 nights at the Hotel Ala. The staff was very helpful. The location was just about perfect for Venice. Far enough away from San Marco to avoid the noise but close enough for a short walk. Our room viewed out onto a small balcony on a small square and it was lovely. The breakfast was superb, with lots of choices and great coffee. The room was small, but had everything we needed and our beds were very comfortable. I would definitely stay at the hotel Ala again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: VR91704
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night and it was a Very Nice hotel, our room faced the canal, it was sweet when the gondolas passed by playing music. The lounge/bar area was very nice, good staff, service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect (sort of)”
Reviews.Author: sophiebd
Reviews.Content: Just checked out yesterday with my husband. Little sitting room off lobby is adorable and nice place to read, as rooms are tiny and dark. Room was adequate, beds are very very hard, and pillows are harder! Breakfast was lovely with eggs, meats, cheeses, fruits, pastries, cereals, yogurts, juices, breads---more than you could expect in Venice--- and decent coffee. My room overlooked the small side canal so you couldn't sleep late because the gondoliers sing as they row. Great if you're in it, not so great if you're not!. Bathroom was tiny and as the bedroom, was spotless, spotless, spotless. Last night we had a sewer gas smell and couldn't determine where it was coming from---it is, after all, a very old city. Remember the same smell at the Swan Hotel in Brugges. Left the window open for awhile---no biggie for one night. Perfect location. Steps from Giglio Vaporetto stop.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: aplutzer
Reviews.Content: Venice was our first stop for a mediterranean cruise and we spent four-nights. Just loved the hotel, especially its location which was walking distance to San Marco. We had a room overlooking the little canal used by water taxis. The best way to get there with luggage, if not springing for a water taxi which is quite expensive from the airport, is to take the bus into the bus terminal and take the vaporetto to the stop for the hotel and you have a one half block walk to the hotel. Rooms are small but modern. We enjoyed the great buffet breakfast and at night the bar for munchies and a glass of wine or cafe americano. The staff was very cooperative. Buy a bottle vino or some aqua and go up to the rooftop lounge for late afternoon views.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ala is a charming hotel.”
Reviews.Author: luvtravelStl
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Hotel Ala located in Santa Maria del Gilio. Get off at San Marco and take Waterbus #1 two stops to Santa Maria del Gilio stop. Walk down a narrow alley, turn toward the wall and you are there! It was a very convenient location, tucked away into a small campo but very close walking to most major sights like San Marco, shopping, cafes and other campos. Our room overlooked a small side canal and the room while small, was very comfortable. They served a buffet breakfast each morning which was included in the cost of your room and they also had a small bar area attached for a nightcap close to home. There was also a rooftop deck only available till 10:00p.m., but we loved having sunset drinks or a bottle of wine up there. We found it was a nice place to chat with others and get some great tips on where to eat. We liked that it was a smaller hotel, the service was very good and we would certainly consider a return visit to Hotel Ala.

Reviews.Title: “Not that good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok, not excellent or average, the room that was given to us was very small, dark and humid, but very dark. If you go to this hotel try to get one of the front rooms. The want that I took was facing a corridor close to the vaporeto via. The breakfast was ok, abundant. But the room horrible you get depress.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: penpun
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in this hotel for 5 nights it was nice and staffs are very helpful. I got a single room yes it is small but very clean barthroom is exellent condition. I am traveling around Italy for 6 weeks and this hotel is the best money value (had stayed one, outside florence equal price 80 euro but nothing near hotel ALA ) If you are considering to stay a few days in Venice I would recommend plus you will hear songs from Gondolar men rowing by from a little canal which you can watch them from the window of your room classical music by someone who are playing Cello ,violin on the bridge near by.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Julianna22
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value for Venice. I really appreciated the convenience of having a vaporetto close to the hotel (take Line 1). The hotel provides a good buffet breakfast and a very comfortable lobby. I agree with a previous reviewer that the bartender was great. The room was clean and air conditioned, and the bathroom had a full size bathtub. The hotel is only about a 5-7 minute walk from Saint Mark's Square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: Coeury
Reviews.Content: We staid 2 nights in this hotel in a superior room, As July is not the best time to enjoy Venice u usually can geat discounts (check hotels web sites...for Special deals). About 5 mn walking from St Marco and La Fenice...on a very quiet and nice square. Some rooms with view on the Campo and some on a rio (ask for them). Staff was nice and breakfeast too. Ideal location to rest after a lond sightseeing walk before u go out again for dinner. Very good value for money (we paid 120eur/day for the room...)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine”
Reviews.Author: dandb
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is great, a short walk from San Marco but without the crowds and very close to Vaparetto stop. We recently stayed at this hotel on two occasions during our visit to Italy - (we took a weekend to Florence in the middle of our stay). We chose this hotel from our holiday brochure based on reviews on this website, so we were not surprised to find that our first room was small (but still smaller than we expected)! However, it was spotlessly clean and the bed linen was immaculate (only criticism - pillows were too hard on both of our stays). Our first room overlooked a small courtyard, which was fine except when it rained in the night, as it bounced loudly off a metal surface and kept me awake. On arrival for our second stay, we were given a much smaller room (looked a bit shabby) than the first and the bathroom was just a shower wet room, which I was not happy with. We asked if it would be possible to change rooms and the gentleman on reception was very obliging. We were given a much better room on the top floor, bigger with modern refurbishment and far better bathroom facility (although no view as window was high up). The public areas are really nice, there's a magnificent chandelier in the reception area. The American Bar was really great for a drink at the end of day, definitely recommend the hot chocolate and the staff were really cheerful and welcoming in there. The main reception staff were very professional and efficient, a smile or two would have been welcomed from some. The breakfast provided had a good choice, but was not always fully laid out for 7am, a little frustrating if you have an early start. As we left our first room, I checked out the safe to make sure we'd left nothing in there and found something left by a previous guest, I handed it in to reception and obtained a receipt, so if you're reading this and you know you left something behind - check with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Amber34
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week in this hotel and found it extremely good value given its position in Venice so close to St Mark's Square. Although our room was small and had no view, the room was comfortable and the air conditioning in the room was very effective considering that the temperature during the day was over 35C and the nights were not much cooler! The room was very well kept and the bathroom very well equipped with bath, power shower and plenty of toiletries, hair dryer etc.. The public lounges, breakfast room and reception area were also more than adequately air conditioned. The staff were very friendly and courteous especially when we practised our Italian on them (this definately helps). As for the breakfasts, we haven't had such a wonderful choice as this in some 4 star hotels! You could eat yourself silly from a range of breakfast cereals, fresh fruit, breads and rolls, cakes, jams, meats, cheeses and scrambled or boiled eggs. We found the Hotel Ala well placed for visiting all parts of Venice. The public water bus stop is only a few metres away and the hotel also has its own private landing stage if you arrive by private water taxi, as we did, allowing you to step from the boat straight into Reception. St Marks Square is a short walk away and there are a couple of nice (and reasonably priced) restaurants in the Piazza St Stephano at the back of the hotel for lunch or dinner. We would seriously consider this hotel again next time we go to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Amazing Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: ChiTownHoneymooners
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and found the staff to be friendly, our room was clean and decorated nicely. The hotel location was perfect and the breakfast was great!!!!! It saved us a lot of money by having the free breakfast buffet with eggs, juices, fruits....They also offered a free glass blowing tour on Sunday. If you are planning a trip in Spring, try to visit Venice during the Vogolonga boat races in April/May, it was so fun to watch because of the costumes and the decorated boats.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Hotel Ala”
Reviews.Author: Luca2
Reviews.Content: Stayd for three nights at this overpriced, impersonal and unwelcoming hotel. The hotel itself is decent enough. However, even in the best and more expensive rooms, the bathroom is very basic and has no proper shower (and no slippers and bath robes, as advertised on its website...).
