The service is patchy and the staff tend to be rude and unobliging (if you let them get away with it). For example, my English partner was consistently told that room-service was not available. However, when I requested this service it was always available (I am Italian...). Again, on one occasion I witnessed the waitresses openly mocking the hotel guests at breakfast time... The hotel is very central (very close to St Marco and the Accademia). This is a good thing if you like to be right in the heart of the tourists' beaten track. However, if you prefere a more authentic scene, this is definately not for you. The main entrance of the hotel is on a nice square (Campo Santa Maria del Giglio) and some of the hotel rooms have a view over this square. The rear of the hotel, instead, overlooks a small canal. It could seem (as it did to me) a romantic idea to book one of these room. However, beware, after the first singing gondolier has gone by warming your heart with this uniquely Venitian experience, a second soon follows... and a third... and a fifthieth... (by which time there might be very little romance left in the experience, as you might just find yourself wanting to kill!...). One good thing: the hotel has a pleasant roof garden, from which their are some spendid views of Venitian roof tops.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of help from front desk”
Reviews.Author: dinnerguest
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel April 2005. Location was very good, room was clean but small. We did have quite a bit of outside noise at night. Air conditioner did not work, but there was not a great need for it in April. Staff was helpful, but in a reserved manner. Beware of front desk offering to send a FREE water taxi for you to the glass factory. Our taxi driver took us to a â€œtourist factoryâ€� and our boat was met by high pressure â€œguidesâ€�. The area we were dropped off in, was not the actual shopping area and the good folks at the factory were not real helpful giving us directions into town which was just a few minutes away. Everything at the factory showroom was 3 times the price of other stores. We felt a little scammed by our hotel staff to set us up with this.

Reviews.Title: “Ala - so romantic!”
Reviews.Author: shelleybgood
Reviews.Content: I loved the Ala! The room we had was small, but by far not the smallest we had. We were in room 460 or 406 I think, a superier canal view room. We had a balcony and a jacuzzi. Our bathroom was huge, over half the size of the bedroom again. Our balcony was SO romantic, with the gondolas going past with singers every now and again. We would go down the road and get a bottle of wine and pizza and sit on the top of the balcony just soaking it in. The shutters were great, they blocked out any noise and light. The staff were friendly and the breakfast was varied and great. The only problem we had (and it really was minor!) was the concrete bed and pillows, not an issue if you like your bed REALLY firm, and the rooftop terrace is closed for restoration (but we had our own balcony anyway)...Besides that, the Ala was perfect, so close and central to everything but so quiet too. I would definitely recommend it if you are looking for a romantic getaway (but do upgrade to a superior if you can afford it - the other rooms we peeked into looked a little sad).

Reviews.Title: “Cozy”
Reviews.Author: TNgal
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel in Venice based on reviews we read on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. The primary reason we chose it was due to the location just a short walk from the vaporetti. What a comfort it was after flying 16 hours, 4.5 hours on a train and the boat ride to get off and see the hotel right there in the square. I can't imagine finding some of the other hotels that are on tiny alleys etc. The desk clerk was very friendly and the bellman walked us up to our room. When he opened the door we were shocked at how small the room was. The bed took up the whole thing! We did have a window overlooking a small canal and the bathroom, although also very small, was newly redone and extremely clean. We were also pleased to discover how close the hotel was to St Mark's and some great little shops. It is impossible to get lost as there are signs pointing out all the major sights. The evenings were quiet with the exception of the fact that our room was right near a main set of marble stairs and when others came clanking in at 2AM we could hear their footsteps and voices. The best part of this hotel was the outstanding breakfast! It was by far the best we had on this trip (Rome and Florence couldn't compare). There were delicious creamy scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs ,fresh pastries, and rolls. There was a huge cooler filled with fresh fruits, tarts, several meats and cheeses, tomatoes, fresh mozzarella and yogurt. So to sum up, tiny very clean room, excellent location, and awesome breakfast. We would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutelly Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and me stayed just 2 days in this hotel and we loved it. Small rooms but really nice decoration, clean and comfortable (we took a superior room, 20 euros more a day. It worth it) Breakfast ESPECTACULAR!!! (Best in our Europe trip because of quality and options). Great Location (Train station, Vaporeto Line 1, 50 meters from vaporeto stop). With a really nice walk (you are going to see shops like GUCCI, ARMANI, etc ) and then youÂ´ll arrive to San Marco Square. Service GOOD! Remember, it has small rooms but you will love the hotel! I definitelly will go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: sannasun
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 days at Best Western Hotel Ala. LOCATION: Its a basic hotel close to Piazza San Marco. The hotel is steps away from a Vaporetto (Water bus) stop and close to many tourist attractions. ROOM: I stayed at a single room. It was just basic with very little storage space in the room and bathroom. The room was small to European standards. The bed and sheets have a worn look. Bathroom was quite big to European standards. STAFF: Staff were pretty helpful. I bought a ticket to a gondola ride at the front desk which was my best experience in Venice. FACILITIES: Just a basic room with worn look. To SUM UP, I'd say Ala is a 3 star per U.S. standards. The hotel location and price made me reserve there. But the worn look of the room is making me reduce the tripadvisor rating of this hotel. I'd definitely look at other options and shop around more for my next trip to Venice unless they rehab the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Traveler111Stamford
Reviews.Content: Although the size of our triple room was rather compact, we enjoyed the overall experience of staying at the Ala. The room was very clean. The people who work here were very nice, the breakfast good with excellent scrambled eggs. The location is next to the Hotel Gritti with a water taxi at the door which makes getting to and from the airport or train station very convenient (althouigh expensive).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We would probably never think of staying at a Best Western in the United States. In our first night in Venice and our first night in Italy, having the Best Western guarantee was a security blanket. We arrived very late and the hotel was prepared for us. The location is fabulous! Our room was 160 euros for a triple in February. The breakfast was more than adequate. The hotel was also very clean. We would probably stay there again. Several of our other family members are staying at the Ala because it provides what it promises.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Concierge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed on 10th to 12th December at 105Euro per night, booked through Zuji. Reasonable price for Venice. It's supposed to be a 3star superior establishment, but we find the service was just standard. To be fair the general staff were very efficient and friendly, but the concierge staff were snobbish and unfriendly. We prefered to deal with the junior staff. The room was small, but the bathroom was a reasonable size, and comfortable. We got a canal view, but the canal smells, so you'd be unwise to keep the window open too long. The breakfast was great though. The location is fantastic, 1 minute walk from Santa Maria Del (GIGLIO) vaporetto stop, the Hotel is just at the top af the alley. We arrived by train, and took the water bus (Vaporetto) to the Hotel, but you could just as easily walk to the Hotel, about 20 minues, if you're not carrying heavy luggages. Walk towards San Marco square, you need to ask for direction along the way. The water bus to the airport takes 1 hour from San Marco, which takes 10 minutes walk to reach, it costs 10Euro one way, reasonable. One thing though, beware of cheats selling useless dancing paper toys, and copy designer leather goods to tourists. You'll find out later and you'd be sorry, as we were, if you bought from them.

Reviews.Title: “first visit to venice 1 Dec 04 to 3 Dec 04”
Reviews.Author: portraveller
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Ala after reading reviews on Tripadvisor and were not disappointed. We chose a superior room with a small balcony and canal view, the room was a good size, spotlessly clean and well maintained and very quiet, well worth the extra as the standard rooms are very small. The staff were friendly and very professional, breakfast was excellent, served until 10.45 and continuously replenished. A free tea/coffee kit with biscuits can be delivered to your room on request until 11pm, ours arrived within 10 minutes. The hotel is situated in a quiet location about 10 minutes walk from St Marks Square and 2 minutes from Giglo water bus stop. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay just as nice as first”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a week at this fine hotel. Staff is excellent. Breakfast is excellent. Rooms can be a little small, but I guess that's Venice. Try seeing what you get in London for the same price. The last two nights we were there we upgraded to a larger room and it was very nice. Location couldn't be better. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Hotel Ala”
Reviews.Author: celusnek
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed four nights at Hotel Ala in November 2004. We enjoyed our stay and feel we got a good value. We used the Alilaguna boat service from the airport to St Marks, took 1-hour, cost 10-Euro each. Then we walked to Hotel Ala, about 15-minutes over 3-bridges, follow signs toward the Academia Bridge. We had reserved the web-special room for 110-Euro. Check-in was efficient and bellman showed us to room 353. Cute room, Venetian glass chandelier, window to an opposite wall, good quality bed linens, ample storage, hooks on the wall for coats, and a big bathroom, new fixtures, and plenty of big, soft towels. Breakfast was a typical Italian buffet, with delicious cold-cuts, incredible cheese, scrambled and hardboiled eggs, pastry, fruits, juice and awesome Italian espresso (or cappuccino). We were impressed with the hotel's staff. They were everywhere! Polite and efficient. Hotel Ala is situated on a canal. Water taxis pick up passengers right at the lobby! (Very convenient if you can splurge, it's 100-Euro to the airport) We travel frequently in Europe, don't mind walking and carrying our own bags, and look for quality and character in hotels. (I am "a bit fussy" about bed and bath linens!) We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Ala and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean but very small”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Aklthough rated above average, I can only guess as I have never stayed at another hotel in Venice. I understand they are all very small as real estate is obviously at a premium. The beds were very comfortable and it was very quiet, clean and the bathroom well appointed. Staff were fantastic and breakfast great. Location is excellent but Venice is so small that everything is within walking distance. We did have some trouble finding it but prevailed after some chats with the locals. I would recommend not bothering the glass factory tour as it was long and boring and they submitted us to the usual high pressure sales technique. Zzzzz. Venice itself was wonderful but after three days we were ready to leave. Some must see's - Of course, St. Mark's church and museums, take a day tour which includes a gondola ride. It is cheaper this way and you get some of the local history - very enjoyable. Restraunts are below average so we usually ate at those small cafe's. Also - check out the concerts at night inside some of the small music conservatories. We saw 2 and they were superb.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel ala”
Reviews.Author: steph
Reviews.Content: the best western hotel ala is in a very convenient location. we walked to san marco square, the rialto bridge and many other places. it was a short walk of just a few yards from the water taxi stop to the ala. the buffet breakfast was wonderful.there was a huge assortment of food. the rooms were small, but clean. the bathrobes were a nice touch. we had a standard room and it had a canal view. the more expensive rooms were much larger, but when you are touring all day, you will be tired when you return to your room and will fall asleep no matter what the size of your room. we can definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ala is ok but...”
Reviews.Author: gbonsall
Reviews.Content: The breakfast is great. Location is great. Nice property but understand if you get the cheapest room with 2 twin beds it is REALLY small. You get what you pay for when it comes to room types. We've traveled alot and there is no real reason not to like and stay at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Ala So-So”
Reviews.Author: cellapink
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ala for 3 nights in early September of this year. Of course, the location was wonderful, but we were disappointed in the Hotel itself. Our bathtub leaked when draining causing a flood in the room below. We were called by staff and the tone seemed to imply that this was somehow our fault. We were asked to move to another room immediately so repairs could be made, but there was no offer to assist us, or compensate us in any way for our trouble. Upon my request, they did assist us with our bags. The new room was much smaller than the room we had, but had a deluxe bath. My husband also had the misfortune to loose a credit card and his ATM card while in Venice. Trying to contact banks in the states, etc, was difficult (800 numbers for customer service generally do not work from Europe). The staff offered vitually NO assistance to us during this stressfull ordeal. In short, while the location was great, we would not stay at his hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location! Excellent service, nice decor, large room”
Reviews.Author: Forevermemories
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights Oct 12-14, 2004. Great, large corner room with 3 windows overlooking the canal. Lovely to listen to the gondoliers sing. Excellent location. Extremely short walk to the vaporetto. Taxi to Murano very efficient and fast. Great service from the front desk. Enjoyed the roof garden with a nice wine and great snack from the bar just over the bridge next to the hotel. Absolutely everything is within walking distance of this nice hotel. We loved the little plaza in front of the hotel. Would definitely recommend and would love to stay there again. Note to the person who found the hotel noisy: You should have closed the outside window shutters for complete darkness and sound reduction. We could have slept until noon but with so much to see and do in Venice, who needs sleep? We loved the old history of this hotel with its modern conveniences. The morning breakfast buffet is better than many found in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edros
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything going for it. Fair price for Venice, very nice room, nice views of either a small piazza or the canal, modern fixtures, great breakfast, very helpful, English speaking staff. Located 5 minutes from St. Marks. We listened to violin players just outside. Why pay big bucks for a fancy hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in September, 2004. We booked directly through Best Western website and received an acceptable rate by Venice standards. Location is just a 30 second walk from the vaporetto and water-taxi stop which is great when you arrive and don't have to drag your luggage through Venice. The hotel is on a nice quiet square but is an easy walk to St. Mark's Square. We had one of the rooms that overlooked a side canal so we were serenaded by gondoliers in the early evening. The hotel also has a small roof terrace. We walked to a local market and bought wine and cheese and enjoyed the sunset with our friends on the terrace. Breakfast buffet was good and the staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel IF you get the right room”
Reviews.Author: JWB_Amsterdam_NL
Reviews.Content: As others have noted, the Hotel Ala has a very good location -- on a tiny square, close to the Piazza San Marco and a stop for the #1 vaporetto (but not the #82). The prices are astronomical as compared to most other cities (EUR250 for a plain room in a 3-star hotel?!), but by Venice's exorbitant standards that qualifies as reasonable. Breakfast is pretty good -- not lavish but decent variety and quantity (except they kept running out of eggs). The bigger problem is the uneven quality of the rooms. The initial room we were given was cramped, dark and dingy, with peeling paint, sagging bed and an unfortunate smell coming in from the alley under the tiny window. For the price this was clearly unacceptable. We complained and were changed to a much nicer, larger "family" room in what appeared to be a newer part of the hotel (a new annex, maybe?). So in the end we were happy enough, but I would caution you to insist on one of the newer rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SpiritofPlace
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ala is in a great location, a five minute walk to San Marco, with lots of shopping on the way. There is a water bus stop at the canal outside of the hotel, which is very convenient. Service was great and the breakfast was nice. The room and bathroom were a decent size, clean and comfortable. The room we stayed in even had a balcony with a canal view, and this canal had a lot of Gondola traffic which was nice to watch. I would recommend Hotel Ala!

Reviews.Title: “A good value”
Reviews.Author: boomerlady
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been completely refurbished recently by Best Western and is much more modern than when we stayed there in the mid-90's. The rooms are still tiny and have some odd configurations but have nice fresh decor and modern fixtures. The breakfast was definitely above average. The front desk staff were a bit distant but helpful. Best Western has a senior rate which helped a bit but it was still $192 Euro per night. However, I had done a lot of research and this is not high for a 3 star hotel. The location is central, an easy walk to San Marco Square and the Accademia Bridge, a bit further to the Rialto Bridge area. Vaporetto stop very near. We were quite satisfied and would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location but a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay. Took private water taxi right to the door and vaparetto stop is 30 second walk. Great location to walk to everything. We had a deluxe room with a lovely balcony overlooking a side canal. Could hear the gondeliers singing as they went by. Breakfast was great and location was perfect however we did find it to be noisy at night - not really sure why but if you are a light sleeper this is not the place other than that it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location....Can't beat the Ala!”
Reviews.Author: I_Love_2_GoKy
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice by train during a terrible rain storm. Trying to figure out the vaperreto system amongst chaos was difficult at best... however we were so pleased to find our hotel Ala right at the end of the sidewalk at our stop. I can't imagine dragging all of our luggage through out the narrow alleys to most of the hotels that we saw throughout our stay. I can't emphasize enough how important location of hotel to your vap. stop will be. You either walk everywhere or take the water bus, so location, location, location is more key than anything.... The staff was very accomodating and helpful. The breakfast is by far the best we had anywhere on our trip. We booked our room via the internet and chose the cheapest rate room, which was still $200eu. Our room was painfully tiny. We had two twin beds a small luggage rack for one suitcase and that was it... so so small. The bathroom was clean and nice...great water pressure. Our room was on a walkway, and pretty noisy until late, but not unbearable. We did have the opportunity to see other rooms on our floor and the rooms were 5x's the size and very nicely decorated. Our stay would have been much more enjoyable if we had upgraded, but we decided to spend our funds on shopping instead of the room! Just make note, you do get what you pay for if room size is important to you. We were close to all of the areas that we were interested in seeing, so we couldn't have been more happy with the location and really, the hotel as a whole. Would stay there again but get a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Quality in such a lovely city”
Reviews.Author: Stewart166
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ala. A hotel Best Western can be proud of. You hear so much about Venice only having squatty little rooms in which to stay, not the case here. Our Triple room was in the timbers of the hotel just before the exit to the roof terrace. A good size queen bed, with the childs bed which was a chez longue and all very comfortable. We had skylights in the room and there was plenty of space to put yer clothes. Bathroom was very nice indeed, tiled throughout, well lit with a jacuzzi bubble bath. The service from reception was immaculate, whatever you needed they would help. We were offered a private courtesy boat on one day only to take us to Murano, then make our own way back. Not many hotels would offer that let alone for free. Breakfast was very good, nice selection, always refilled and tables cleared promptly. The location is pretty cool too... Vapporetto direct from Station to Santa Maria Giglio, all the way down the Grand Canal, only only 2 minutes walk then to hotel. San Marco Square is 5 minutes away, take in a bellini at Harrys Bar on route, yes you may pay a little but its well worth it, just remember you guys to wear trousers not shorts. Gondolas are all around but be prepared to bartar!! Can't wait to go back here. Will be recommeding to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: seewhy
Reviews.Content: Quaint hotel in a very convenient location. Had nice canal view rooms. Staff was helpful. Breakfast provided a variety of foods. Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location by the vaporetto stop”
Reviews.Author: PGC94102
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Hotel Ala, which is conveniently located by the vaporetto stop so the walk to the front door is not too far. This matters if you are lugging lots of luggage. It's also only a five minute walk to Piazza San Marco and the front entrance opens on to a charming little square. Much has been written about their breakfast but I would only describe it as a little above average. The room was comfortable and clean, but we unfortunately experienced an air conditioning problem while we were there. All of the rooms (but not the lobby) ended up being uncomfortable which was unfortunate. The hotel discounted our rated 10% but I think it should have been a little more than that. Nonetheless, I would recommend this hotel given that the problem was probably a rarity.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: freddy82
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice stay, it is very near St. Marcos Square and other sites. My room was small, but very clean overlooking a nice little courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a total of 3 nights at Hotel Ala in Venice. The location is very convenient and the employees were very helpful--especially Stephano. I had two different single rooms--both were small but utilitarian. The first had no view-in fact the window faced on an alley. Also, it was a smoking room as they had no non-smoking available even though I had requested non-smoking. The second room had a canal view and was non-smoking. The breakfast was wonderful!! I would stay here again as the rooms were decent, the price was competitive, and the location was very good. I feel the Hotel Ala was a good value compared to other properties I considered.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were made very welcome during our five night stay during June 2004... the room was small but suited our needs, it had a balcony that we were able to use whilst having our pre-dinner drink and watch the world go by. Who needs a map in Venice- you cannot get lost!!. The breakdast was the best in our 13 day stay in Italy, just a pity that there was a watewr bus strike when we where departing and the water taxi turned iut to be very expensive for a short journey to the railway station. The staff could not have done moor to make out stay an veryenjoyable one and we hope to return very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PKIGHT
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be a great location. Very close to most attractions. The staff was very efficient, freindly and helpful. Our room (349) was very clean and the windows open over a canal so we could listen to the gondoliers singing as they passed our window. Breakfast was especially good and plentiful. Great hot coffee. I would highly recommend this property when in Venice. I would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ala for five nights in late May 2004. We can't say enough nice things about the hotel. The location is excellent, the rooms are impecable and the bathrooms recently remodeled with all conveniences. They even had the air conditioning on! The staff was helpful and alerted us to some transportation problems because of a regatta on the Grand Canal. The breakfast buffet is wonderful. Although it is a Best Western, you still feel you are in a fine European hotel. We would certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.. highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: brmSt_Louis_MO
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with unbelievable service. This hotel is at a great location and is worth a deal in Venice. Our only regret is that we didn't spend more nights there.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and I was not disappointed! The hotel is only a short walk from the main square but still far away enough that you are not constantly barraged by tourists. The hotel is beautiful & clean and the staff friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was the best I had the entire trip â€“ I donâ€™t know how they make coffee there but Iâ€™ve never tasted anything so fabulous. After a 3 week European tour which included several hotels I can say that the Hotel Ala was my favourite - and believe it or not the cheapest!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cba50
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a 10 day stay in Italy, 3 nights of which were spent in Venice at the Hotel Ala. The location is in a quiet piazza, but very close to the activity of Piazza San Marco. We had 2 rooms, a double and a triple. The double was 2 beds pushed together with a private bath. The trip was 2 twins together and a cot like bed. The rates are high, but they are typical for Vednice. The rooms have shutters and are pitch dark when they are closed. There is a computer for guest use in the breakfast area....the cost is 5 Euros for 30 minutes. Unlike many other Italian hotels who provide a roll and beverage for breakfast, the Ala serves a full American buffet of high quality. We would definetely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: BJL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with another couple stayed at the Hotel Ala for 3 nights in January 2004 -- it snowed our first day (first time there in 5 years!) and was beautiful. This was our second stay at the Ala and we'll stay there again next time we go to Venice. Fantastic breakfast, perfect location, quiet, courteous staff (I too asked for extra pillows and they were delivered to our room within minutes) at a reasonable price -- especially for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “This is where to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let's face it, venice is expensive. The food is very expensive. $4 for a can of coke. We spent an average of $100 a day on food per person (we're talking just lunch and dinner and we are not big eaters at all...) The number one reason to stay here is the breakfast. Nice buffet- and from what we heard the only hotel that serves more than a breakfast roll with coffee. The second reason to stay is the perfect location. Steps away from everything you need. Just ask for softer pillows. The ones we had originally were as if you folded up a sheet and put it in a pillowcase.
